review_body: Booked thru AMEX Fine Hotels/Resort (FHR) program. Got upgraded to corner grand deluxe room - has walk in wardrobe and larger bath - with view of Imperial Palace Plaza. Nice welcome tray of fruit for our wedding anniversary. Room was well appointed with luxe robes/slippers. Large ensuite bath with best washlet during our stay in Japan. Nightly turndown service with hydrating sleep masks provided. Daily breakfast was provided with the FHR program - the property's Grand Kitchen had a wonderful breakfast - had the choice of a la carte, set Western or Japanese menu, or buffet. I highly recommend the buffet as it offers both Western and Japanese food. Fresh, quality, tasty, and unlimited! On property also had dinner at Sushi Kanesaka - omakase only; and dessert (a magnificent mango treat) in the Palace lounge with live Jazz. Swam in the indoor pool - swim caps provided. Well appointed locker room with robes, slippers, and shower. Overall, a magnificent property - great hospitality, location, amenities, food/beverage.

I can't imagine a better place to stay in Tokyo. We splurged and got the club floor rooms with the balcony. It was totally worth it. The club floor had a great breakfast buffet with hot options (pancakes) they brought to your table. The club had afternoon snacks, and drinks at night. The balconies on the rooms were the best, with an expansive view over the Imperial palace. I've attached some pictures from our rooms. The service was discrete and efficient. We ate at the kaiseki restaurant, Wadakura, and also at the Grand Kitchen when we'd had our limit of Japanese cuisine. Both were great. They had a nice wine list at the grand kitchen. The rooms were extremely up to date and comfortable. The bathrooms were gleaming. The location is right near a major junction of the subway lines, so you could directly get to many places without a change. My family really enjoyed it as a base to explore Tokyo, and we'll be staying there again the next time we visit. It was faultless.

2 night stay before heading to Hong Kong for mandatory quarantine - so i was extremely anxious.The hotel was running 20% occupancy I was told. Everything was very good. 99% staff with face masks and hand gel readily available. My room was a spacious with a big balcony overlooking the Imperial palace grounds. If I chose - would prefer room with no carpet.Quiet air-concomfy bed (firm mattress )Bathroom was good - separate show /bath/ toilet / Anne Semonin amenities . Breakfast was good - no buffet, which is sensible at this time. Ordered everything I wanted and it was served by masked staffF&B - reasonable vegetarian options for lunch / dinner in the restaurant, particularly good service staff in the ground floor restaurant.  Japanese restaurant was enjoyable ... but service was a bit erratic.Staff: excellentLocation: 9 mins walk from Tokyo Station. Great for walking around the Palace. Perfect for me.Hopefully can return visit in happier times

Our room was lovely , the service was excellent, we loved this hotel , great location great experience ..I would recommend this property to anyone ..of course during coronavirus..no buffet at breakfast..understandable

We have stayed at some of the most prestigious global hotels globally, each year selecting a new country. The Palace Hotel in Tokyo exceeds even the highest 5 STAR expectations on all levels.Right from the moment and method the hotel administrates check in Hotel Guest Services (Yui Kudo) and the entire 24hr Extremely professional Concierge team; Additional to the Club Lounge each day (Fareen Takahashi) and team go above and beyond the expectations and obligations.Room and Cleaning and staff on hand in all areas was absolutely flawless. A credit to all staff and Mr Masaru Watanabe.Thank you and see you very soon.Darren & Jacqui room 2131.

Excellent hotel - lovely facilities and lovely service. Very friendly and attentive staff, eg they wrote down all my destinations in Japanese on cards to give taxi drivers. Rooms are spectacular and with tons of thoughtful details and amenities. Lovely location near palace gardens and walking distance to shopping.

My family and I stayed at this hotel from January 31st to February 6. This is my 3rd stay at the Palace Hotel and it did not disappoint again!Although the gym and Evian spa could be upgraded, I thought the food and restaurant offering was spectacular. Some of the best restaurants in Tokyo are found in this hotel. My husband and I enjoyed the sushi restaurant, the tempura restaurant was spectacular with limited seating. Chinese restaurant was great as well.Location is perfect next to the palace, and great for park walks and fresh air. Easily assessable to Ginza area and could walk to shops.The staff were all very friendly and offered very good sanitization and hygiene kits to us. We thought the level of detail and room decor was very modern. We switched rooms in the middle of our stay. We had a corner room with a balcony which was amazing (see photos) but as our stay got extended we wanted to save money so moved to a room without balcony and it was as beautiful. I highly recommend the Tokyo palace hotel, it is one of our favorite city hotels. Designs are more modern than the Grand Hyatt. And what I loved most was the amount of ceiling lights and options I had on the light switch.

The staff here goes above and beyond, and the rooms are perfect. The location next to the moat overlooking the Imperial Palace grounds is stunning and on a practical level, it is only a couple of blocks from the train station. The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is that the restaurant is average for dinner (we ate dinner there twice), although the breakfast buffet is extensive and very good. One other thing is that they don't let you know that there are a lot of casual restaurants and noodle shops in the arcade under the hotel, down the escalator. Unfortunately, they were closed when we were looking for a casual meal, but it's worth checking out.

We stayed at Palace Hotel Tokyo in Nov 2017 and this review is kind of late. The hotel was recently renovated at the time of our stay and I think they did an excellent renovation. Location is just right across from Imperial East Garden and it is nice to be able to just walk around the garden in the morning. Our state included breakfast at the lounge and they provide high quality breakfast. Concierge is pretty helpful and was able to help us with our dining reservations prior to our arrival. I would definitely go back to stay at this hotel again in the future.

One of my favourite hotels. Staff are extremely courteous and professional but never overly so. The rooms are perfect- clean, quiet, comfortable, a/c does exactly what it should, bathroom facilities are excellent with all essentials provided and the bed is very comfortable. I liked the addition of the Bose mini speaker this time round, won't have to bring mine next time! Breakfast is good with a lot of choice, the eggs Benedict/Royal are very good. Bar on the 6th floor is very quiet and comfortable and the staff in there are always friendly welcoming. the range of wines and spirits is impressive and prices not too bad.All in all a top class hotel and one which I always enjoy staying at.

Had an opportunity to enjoy this fine hotel's services during a business trip to Tokyo. Its location next to the imperial palace property in Tokyo provides an excellent opportunity to run/walk in that neighbourhood which is a great diversion from the congestion in Tokyo.The hotel is well located in Marinouchi-chome which is one of the prime business districts in Tokyo. It has access underground to various subway stations, which is convenient during Tokyo's numerous thunderstorms.The hotel provides a great tea service in the room with an exquisite tea set set up on arrival. The bathroom is well appointed and the toiletries are of excellent quality.I had the opportunity to take advantage of the swimming pool on the property and it was well maintained.

This is a fabulous hotel. The rooms are first-rate, and the service is outstanding. We were there during a very busy time, but the service was still impeccable. The wait staff at the restaurants does an excellent job; they seemed to anticipate our needs. The breakfast is excellent as well. Finally, the location across from the Imperial Palace can't be beat. Highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel is very busy. They do not have enough facilities as compared to the number of guests. The front desk is not very helpfull and either do not tell the truth or misunderstands. As for the concierge do not grasp the requests made in english.

Hands down the best in Tokyo. Everything was perfect. We loved our stay of 7 nights with 2 connecting rooms. The only negative thing is tte location which is a bit off the main shopping area and there is restaurant around at night if you want to eat .

Sadly Japan is changing its standards of service most probably because of the overwhelming number of tourists.. Hotel itself is beautiful ,rooms are small but view is fantasticspa is beautifuldining options superbscommon areas are gorgeous these are the very good pointsWe ve been going there for years and sadly have to mention that in comparaison to hotels such as Peninsula where guests are valued , Palace managemenf does not recognise loyalty and that s a bit dissapointing. Service is getting worse , lost of time wasted on the phone trying to get informations needed as you ll be first connected to some staff with limited english and then need to explain once more to the department in charge, it would be more efficient to be connected directlySome staff can be rude as well , when Asked for humidifier (it took a couple of phone calls to finally talk to someone who understood my request )the housekeeper who seemed to be a japanese senior member of staff came with a large device and instead of installing it in the room she placed it in front of me at the door !! Could not believe she did not even offer to bring it in and install itFront desk male on check out was very unpleasant to say the least and his attitude is in contrast with the service in Japan we have always experienced ..so weird to find such staff .. gives a poor image of the hotel.

Sadly only there for a few days, rooms were very comfortable, club lounge and breakfast superb, its a joy to have a swimming pool, gym looked good but did not use it, wish we had been able to stay longer.Staff are off the scale, hence my title

We had an excellent stay in the Palace Hotel. We wanted something luxurious for the last three nights of our Japan trip and were not disappointed. The service level were top notch. The rooms were spacious and in very good condition. The staff at all level were very attentive and responsive.The location of the hotel is very good, a short walk from Tokyo station. Don't walk underground to and from the station though unless really necessary or raining as the underground network is practically a maze. Furthermore Tokyo station is an incredibly busy place with lots of people walking in a fast pace.Breakfast were great although the buffet spread is not big. A la carte items more than make up for it. You can also order a Japanese Bento box. Quality of food is excellent. The staff at the Grand Kitchen provides good interaction.A note for folks with kids. It is not necessary to add an extra bed even for two kids unless they are really big. Kids are children below 11 by the hotel definition. The king size bed is really large. The largest that we have ever come across. Definitely sufficient for two adults and one kid of average size. The younger kid can use the day bed. Adding an extra bed would mean that you will be charged as three adults. If possible get a room with Palace view. I believe the view will be great. All in all a very satisfying stay for us albeit a bit pricey.

After 9 years, my family and I finally made our return to Tokyo.The city is always amazing that we love most among all in Japan. And this time we were very lucky to get a chance to experience the great hospitality in Palace Hotel.Initially we booked Mandarin Oriental but were recommended to try Palace Hotel by our friends. We felt so grateful that we had made such a switch because Palace Hotel did exceed our expectation.From pre--arrival, I had been in touch with the hotel and could already feel the excitement. Upon arrival, our family was warmly welcomed by GM Mr Watanabe and Director of Guest Experience Mamiko. It did make an impact of how you felt from the first impression.We were then escorted to two adjoining rooms which were perfect for my little son so he could run between both to look for family. He was small but did love the space especially he got to try many wonderful properties for his previous 7 trips.Room was actually spacious for Japanese standard and both rooms had a great balcony overlooking the park. Special amenities had been set up for us including a little dog doll for my son and also the personalized card printed for our visit to Mount Fuji. Lovely thought indeed!Bathroom was quite transparent to bedroom but could be blocked by sheer and doors. Other hotels always had the same issue where the bath mat blocked the door of the shower cubicle but was annoying but this hotel worked perfectly fine. You may think that's a little issue but it meant the hotel did pay attention to small details like this.I personally liked rain shower which was relaxing and this one also worked much better than our recent trip in China.It was a pleasure to enjoy a nice breakfast before the day start at the club lounge. Team there was particularly friendly and made us feel comfortable even though I was slightly afraid of the noise from my little one disturbing other guests. Selection for hot dishes, pastries and salad were sufficient for lounge standard where we could also order different options of egg as well as Japanese set breakfast.We all liked the juice blender where we could made our own fruit juice, something I didnt see in other hotels.Three nights stay at Palace Hotel Tokyo were memorable and we all look forward to returning one day, hopefully not having to wait for another nine years!

This is an amazing hotel in a great position, 10 minutes walk to Tokyo Station, a few minutes to the East Imperial Palace garden and 12 minutes walk from the Sky hop on hop off sightseeing bus. We had a deluxe room with balcony and a view toward the Imperial Palace, we have stayed in a lot of hotels and this was without doubt the best room we’ve ever had. There service and attention to detail throughout was impeccable. The only criticism is that the hotel‘s restaurants are very expensive (some ridiculously so) and so we ate out but there are plenty of places nearby. High prices in 4* and above hotel restaurants in Japan seem common for some reason. We had breakfast included and it was an excellent buffet and they will cook eggs for you in a variety of ways.

This was the worst stay in Tokyo we have ever had. We stayed from 24-26/Nov 2019.Our view in Room 1104 was stunning, but that's it.We arrived at the hotel at 1:00 pm, after travelling from Noto Peninsula early in the morning. We were told that the check-in time was 3:00pm but the hotel could keep our luggages at the store room. That's fair enough and was expected. But could the staff be more thoughtful when they "observed" that we were very tired and asked if they could get us a table for lunch inside the hotel , settled down while waiting for check-in ? That's a 5-stars hotel, right ? Anyway we went out and walked for half an hour before we could find a place for lunch.We came back at 5:30 pm , and to be told our room was not ready ! The gentleman at the reception told me the room was unavailable because of late check-out of the previous customer ! We came at 1:00pm and your hotel still allowered a late check out of my room , unbelievable ! And, the receptions knew , that We had reserved a table at Alain Ducasse at 6:00pm ! How could we prepare for fine dining at a Michellin French restraurant without a room ?We have been staying at other 5-stars hotel, namely Mandarin Oriental, Peninsula, Ritz-Carlton... and the truth is your hotel is miles behind. Last worth mention was when we tried to get a Taxi to The Quintessence restaurant, none of your staff willing to help, only one we asked just point his finger to the Taxi Stand , amazing ! Also I needed to drag my luggages by myself when checking out ! Can you call yourself a 5 Star hotel ?

We only stayed here one night before our flight back to the US and wish we'd had more time here. The hotel's location in Chiyoda is excellent - short distance from Tokyo Station and right across the street from the Imperial Palace. Our rooms had spectacular balcony views of the Palace grounds as well as the Tokyo skyline. The rooms also were beautifully appointed and impeccably clean.Service was outstanding and efficient, despite the hotel being fully booked. When the hotel was unable to upgrade us (we had booked through American Express Fine Hotels which provides for an upgrade if available), they provided us with other credits instead - something I've never experienced with any other Amex FHR booking. Prearrival communication with the front desk and the concierge was easy in terms of setting up airport transfers etc.We will certainly stay here again on our next visit to Tokyo, for a longer experience.

Definitely one of the oldest hotels in Tokyo but when you go inside the hotel, it's a whole different new world! Everything inside the hotel is new and modern. You cannot trace anything ancient from the past. The rooms are perfect! The lobby lounge is beautiful! It's perfect for an evening night cap and just to lounge around with family. I will be staying here for many years to come.

Fantastic hotel with an ideal location and amazing service.From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave, the entire staff is absolutely perfect, extremely kind and helpful.The rooms are large, functional, comfortable, and exquisitely designed. Good level of amenities, and constant recharge of water and such. The gym is very good and they also have a private pool which I have seen but not tested.Breakfast is excellent with a wide offering including hotel and cold items, many prepared upon order. The Crispy Bacon is particularly good ! The view over the water and the possibility to eat outside makes it a great experienceDefinitely recommended !

The Palace Hotel Tokyo is by far my all time favorite Hotel in the World. It is five stars and you feel it. From the quality of service, to the breakfast in the restaurant, the lounge for cocktails, the room design and comfort, this is indeed a luxury hotel.It sits across from the Imperial Palace and the view from the rooms are excellent. The first time I stayed we had a view of the Palace. This time we had a room of the park with a fountain and it was also nice. The subway station is just below the hotel and transportation is convenient.I cannot praise the quality and service of this hotel enough. It is my all time favorite.

The Palace hotel is in an ideal location just 5 minutes walk from Tokyo Central Station and across the road from the Imperial Palace and gardens. What sets it apart is the quality of service that exudes from every member of staff; so polite and so professional. We had in total eight nights stay in two parts over our holiday from greeting to departure it couldn’t have be bettered.

This is a beautiful hotel in a perfect location. The room was large with a wonderful balcony overlooking the Imperial Palace grounds. The view was great during the day time and the evening. The bathroom had the best shower and of course that heated toto toilet. Every hotel room needs to have that special toilet. The bed was the largest bed I've ever seen yet alone slept in! Our rate came with the breakfast downstairs. It was a buffet with many choices. We ate dinner in the tempura restaurant. The food was delicious and the service was a real treat. My only complaint was I wish I could have stayed there longer!

Spent a couple of nights here celebrate my wife first pregnant, the room was great, spacious and clean, view from our room was fantastic.We had breakfast at the club lounge 19F food was delicious but I think limited food items here, the staff at Club Lounge were helpful and friendly. Thank you for your excellent hospitality.

OverviewThis most recent trip was the second time we stayed at the incredible Palace Hotel in Marunouchi, Tokyo. I normally book through Leading Hotels of the World and did check out to see whether there were any other options (other than the Imperial which we discounted the last time, and this). There is a new property (The Okura) opening soon but the Palace is so amazing it would be a hard ask for us to stay anywhere in Tokyo, as much as I usually like trying new places.Would I stay here again? Yes in a second - it’s in a perfect location, great facilities, amazing service and the Evian spa - wow!Location Located right next to the Imperial Palace grounds, this hotel is only 0.3 miles away from Tokyo Station (5 minutes in a car and less than 10 minutes to walk) and 2.5 miles from Ueno Station (about a 15-20 minute drive, depending on traffic). The hotel is situated above Otemachi metro station (escalator down from lobby into a small shopping area that connects by tunnel) so makes it really easy to get to most places. We found Uber very expensive in Tokyo, not like elsewhere else it seems in the world, but in Japan it was normal taxis that were using Uber only, not private cars. We went to Teamlab Planets in Toyosu (only about 3.5 miles and 20 minutes) but that was as JP¥ 3,050 (about $30 or £24) for the single journey.AccommodationThere are various room types (Deluxe w and w/o balcony, Grand Deluxe, Club Deluxe w and w/o balcony then Grand Club Deluxe) and six suite types. We were in a Deluxe with balcony on the 14th floor with great views across some of the Palace grounds and the cityscape, with the Tokyo Tower in the distance. The room was incredibly spacious with an entrance hall (with stool and slippers to remove your outer shoes), a large walk-in closet, large bedroom and sitting area with a spacious balcony. There was also a large en-suite bathroom with a deep soaking tub right up at the window and wet-room style overhead shower, single sink in a large vanity unit and a separate WC with of course the expected Toto Washlet toilet.The room was serviced twice-daily, was spotlessly clean and everything was presented so perfectly - high quality Japanese hotels seem to offer every conceivable bathroom amenity, not just shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. As well as an amazing welcome (wine, mineral water, fruit and chocolates - also Evian water spray, hand gels etc.) every evening we were left pyjamas on the bed as well as a self-heating relaxing eye mask.Food & DrinkNext to the main lobby is the Grand Kitchen (open 6am to 11pm daily), this is where breakfast is served; either in the main restaurant area, the conservatory or out on the covered balcony. There was a fantastic choice of both Western (fruits, yoghurts, bakery, cereals, juices, hot dishes) and Japanese buffet items and various eggs and other hot dishes available to order too. Service was exemplary as was food quality, breakfast here was an amazing start to the day. On this trip we didn’t eat in the hotel (other than some delicious cakes from the in-hotel Deli/Patisserie/Cake-shop) but on a previous trip we enjoyed a delicious meal at the Michelin-starred (Chinese) Amber Palace restaurant - this is open for lunch and dinner every day - great views from the 5th floor and amazing ambience in the evening.Other than these two eateries, there are a number of additional choices for dining and various bar options too; all of the highest quality and incredible design throughout.Facilities & ServiceThere is a great indoor pool and jacuzzi, but our highlight was the Alpine-inspired Evian Spa, adjacent to the pool and gym area. We opted for an afternoon treatment of massage and facials, we were so lucky to have one of the couples’ treatment room (Mont Blanc) - the therapists were excellent and treatments couldn’t be faulted. We started off by relaxing in the men’s aqua area - here there was a dry sauna, heated baths, hot reclining bath and a cold plunge pool too. The changing rooms were filled with fridges of Evian mineral water and huge fluffy white Evian towels and oversized bathrobes. After our treatments we went to the men’s relaxation area where we were served herbal teas, dried fruit and nuts. What an amazing relaxing afternoon with superb service.The facilities in this five star hotel were second to none - from the deluxe in-room toiletries (Anne Semonin) and service from all staff (from welcome to departure) nothing could be faulted - we had another amazing stay in what is an incredible city. ThePrivateTraveller’s top tips (any areas for improvement?):I am quite a fastidious person but think I can honestly say there is nothing I would change here, or look to be improved!ThePrivateTraveller’s absolute highlights:The Evian spa - Mont Blanc double treatment overlooking the Palace moat and gardens was exceptional.Breakfast on the terrace - fantastic service and great food, such a good start to each day.You can check out my blog and other travel information on my website (link in profile), ThePrivateTraveller dot com. You can also find me on Instagram @theprivatetraveller.

If you would like to experience REAL Japan finest service with class and view, this is hands down the place to stay. There is no hotel’s location can beat the Palace - next to The Imperial Palace, the Tokyo station, and the MOMAT. My check in and out were impeachable, and every staff member was friendly, considerate, and helpful willing to go extra miles. The balcony view facing the imperial palace and the park made every morning a pleasant one. Their fitness center and the Evian Spa are also worth to check out. I’m a bit surprised the Palace only ranks No.3, which is underrated, in Tokyo. I have also stayed at the place ranks #1, but the experience cannot compare with the Palace. Next time, when I come back, the Palace Hotel Tokyo will be the one.
user_name:
travelpanda100
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed for business for 2 nights in May 2019. Just an amazing property especially for business. Fantastic all around, both the hardware and the service. I have only seen room sizes this big at the Park Hyatt in Tokyo. And with a big balcony!

The Palace Hotel is easily one of, if the not the best hotel in Tokyo. We had been traveling in Indochina and we wanted to make the most of our short layover in Tokyo. The location is close to the Tokyo Central Station and the Imperial Palace Gardens. Our room with a balcony overlooking the city was spacious and beautifully equipped.The king bed was enormous and comfortable, the shower and soaking tub outstanding. The hotel staff and concierge were most helpful. The concierge arranged for baseball tickets at the Tokyo Dome before we arrived. We dined both evenings in the Grand Kitchen and even though it was the all day dining venue, the food and service were five star. I highly recommend this property if you are traveling to Tokyo.

I just had a wonderful 4 nights at Hotel.Service, could not be better.Room, amazing views of Palace and Gardens, bathroom shower as strong as could be imagined. Air con and bed as comfy as could be imagined.FT paper placed at door in morning... a nice un asked for touch...Bar on ground floor warm and inviting.Access to Tokyo train station an easy 5 min walk...Would I go back,of course...

Palace hotel offers the best combination of discretion and attentive service that I have experienced. In a climate of aggressive and in your face service, the team at Palace hotels manages to give you space while making themselves available at all times. The concierge was immensely helpful both before and during our visit. This together with the wonderful housekeeping and food really makes this one of the best hotels I have stayed at.

Amazing/ impeccable sevice and ammenities. Rooms have spectacular views of the city and park. One of my all-time favorite hotels in the world. Excellent/ prime location. The hotel resturants were also good.

My family (with 2 teenage children) stayed for 4 nights in 2 Club Deluxe rooms at the Palace Hotel and we had the best time. Breakfast at the Club Lounge on the 19th floor was excellent with great views, likewise the afternoon tea and the evening cocktails. All the staff, including the greeters, bellhops, front desk, concierge, wait staff, etc. were super attentive and anticipated our every need. They were all naturally friendly and interested in your activities. The rooms were luxuriously decorated, the bed super comfortable, the amenities (e.g. fresh cotton pajamas every night, etc.) great and the view (our rooms were on the 23rd floor) of the moats and the imperial gardens were excellent. We highly recommend this hotel for families vacationing in Tokyo.

This is what service should feel like. Attendants are everywhere to assist you.The room was clean, well stocked and equipped; very clean and modern. Bath/shower, simply amazing. Extra large king bed. Power adaptors everywhere. Everything is solid and well built. White cotton PJs for adults and kids provided.Right opposite the Imperial Palace. A few minutes walk from the main Tokyo station; Otemachi station is even closer. Lots of excellent choices for breakfast and a decent 4-hour window to have breakfast.My 2 young kids enjoyed their stay as well. We would definitely consider staying here again on our next trip to Tokyo.How can I forget the gym- it has everything you need, solid, new and modern equipment even a Tantia scale for your body composition. Take as much Evian water as you need.

Despite a somewhat unhappy heading of my review, I had to give this hotel 5 stars because of the service and efficiency, which are second to none.Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights in July 2019. The location of the hotel, the views from most rooms, the range of services offered, the efficiency of check in, check out and responsiveness of the staff - all excellent. There is really nothing to complain about. If you're a tourist - very accessibly and centrally located for quickly getting to all the interesting Tokyo neighbourhoods. The hotel area is a classical downtown that has literally nothing but the businesses in it. Not much personality - a very well run international luxury hotel. Best for the corporates etc. I am a smoker, so choosing a hotel where most of the rooms have balconies was a no-brainer for me. Otherwise, I would always prefer a hotel with more personality.

Perfection. Japanese perfection. You see my point.Grand, beautiful design down to every element. Polite and attentive service. Amazing rooms with wonderful views. Top notch luxurious amenities. Convenient location right by the metro (intersection of 5 major metro lines). Delicious breakfasts by the Imperial. If I could only give a 6 star rating, this one would be it.I can’t wait to be back already.

My husband and I stayed at the Palace for three nights. The lobby decor is beautiful with contemporary art through out. In the evening a wonderful pianist plays in the gorgeous bar area...Our room was spectacular. We had a perfect view of the Palace Gardens and city and had a terrace as well. Everything is state of the art and the design and fabrics are very special. The bathrooms are gorgeous.Our room was a club floor booking and we were able to enjoy the most refined, elegant environment for breakfast, teatime and cocktail hour. We chose to have breakfast downstairs so we could enjoy full access to the gorgeous overflowing buffet. Everything that you could imagine is available and displayed beautifully. The club floor access for cocktails was a great and the views of Tokyo were stunning. Champagne, wines and beers are offered with different crudités, cheeses and various Japanese treats. We enjoyed the tea service on our last day when we returned to the hotel earlier to pack for our evening departure. I recommend booking a club floor room because it truly made our stay superb.We dined at the teppanyaki restaurant on our last night. It was excellent. I do not eat steak and the chef offered lobster instead. The careful and precise preparations of each course were interesting to watch and our dinners were delicious.The hotel is superb beyond words and we would absolutely stay here again. Location is excellent with a short and interesting walk to the Ginza area and close to the Maranouchi area. We booked the Peninsula Hotel as well and debated which hotel to stay at. I labored over the decision. I definitely made the correct choice. We walked over to see the Peninsula Hotel and it looked very tired.We travel a lot and can sincerely say that the Palace is among the top hotels of or recent travels.

A brilliant experience.All staff are so friendly and professional.Products are high standard and hotel facilities are first class.They would like more tourists as they are already well supported by business visitors.Try the tepenyaki restaurant.Wow!

The hotel may get its name from overlooking the Imperial Palace gardens, but it is a palace in its own right. I was hesitant to stay here based on reviews that said it was a business hotel, but to me, it was far from it. Three of us shared an enormous room with a bathroom nearly as large to go with it, and a balcony with a stupendous view of the Imperial Palace gardens and the high rises of Tokyo beyond.Admittedly, this was a splurge for a special birthday with two friends who were also celebrating this special birthday, and the Palace Hotel couldn't have made it more special for us, including sending up a platter of complimentary fruit and chocolates for our birthday and advising us on places to dine in Tokyo. If I were to return to Tokyo any other time, this is the place I would pick, although admittedly the Tokyo Station Hotel (where I also stayed and enjoyed) is probably more convenient to a train station. We enjoyed a stellar cocktail in the upper lounge--so good that I asked for the recipe and still make the drink at home now.Really, do yourself a favor and stay here if you can afford it. You won't regret it!

This was our first visit to Tokyo and we were not sure which district to stay in, this was a great choice. The location is a short walk from the railway station and there is access to the underground from the hotel. The hotel has a nice whisky bar and a cocktail bar with views over the imperial palace gardens. There are several restaurants, the Japenese restaurant is excellent and the European style on the ground floor also very good. We had a larger room with a balcony, which we used a lot. Room amenities very good.

Big hotel with great service and lovely rooms, comfortable and bathroom really nice. We were a room on 18th floor with a partly view over the palace. We had no balcony (know that several of the rooms have this). There is a large breakfast buffet with all you can eat. Service at the hotel is excellent. We wanted to go to a Sushi restaurant the last evening and within walking distance (this was not a demand) they recommended this great restaurant nearby.

Our stay in the Deluxe King Room with Balcony was an absolute delight and almost an oasis to the hustle and bustle of inner Tokyo. We very much enjoyed our balcony view (very hard to find in Tokyo hotels) and loved the concierge service. Well located next to the station for easy arrival but Tokyo does have some of the best cabs in the world which we ended up catching for convenience.

This was the start of our first visit to Japan. We had booked a superior room with balcony and the view was superb. Our room overlooked the large moat around the Imperial palace gardens which were a very short walk away. The main Tokyo railway station is also very close. The room was very well appointed and all the staff were excellent. Breakfast could be taken indoors or, as we did, could be eaten outdoors overlooking the large moat. It was an extensive buffet with waiter service for coffee and an egg speciality like eggs benedict with ham, salmon or crab.

The Palace Hotel exceeded my expectations. Service was fantastic from check in to check out. The rooms were fabulous, plenty of room with an amazing view and comfortable bed. We were upgraded to a balcony room and appreciate the gesture. One day we could even see Mount Fuji from our balcony. Lovely bathroom with super soft towels and great shower. Very nice toiletries provided and in the room an iron & ironing board and complementary water. The breakfast was outstanding and we ate dinner one night in the restaurant and the food was very good.The rooftop bar had a wonderful view but £9 for a coffee wax quite expensive! I would highly recommend the Palace Hotel.

The Palace Hotel Tokyo is an exquisite property. It is right across from the Imperial Palace and the surrounding streets are wide boulevards -- it felt like an oasis of calm in the middle of Tokyo. A room with a balcony is a must -- so unique in a city setting. It was an easy walk to/from Tokyo Station, but a cab may be necessary with luggage. There is a subway station that is attached to the hotel via an underground passageway, which was a convenient way to get to Shibuya in the evening. The service was impeccable. The concierge staff in particular was superb -- very responsive via email prior to our stay and helpful in person during our stay. The front desk staff were so welcoming, as were the restaurant staff at breakfast. The buffet breakfast was generous and varied.Our room was very nice with elegant touches, such as the Japanese tea set and sweets. All of the amenities were wonderful and the room was immaculate. We look forward to staying again.

We ended our 2 weeks in Japan with a few nights here and it was the best idea ever. After Japans small hotel rooms it was lovely to have a large room with all of the bells and whistles.The staff were all amazing and attentive, the hotel restaurants that we tried served beautiful food.From the moment we arrived we were made to feel very welcome even though both myself and my wife are heavily tattooed. The staff only had nice things to say about them and one even apologised that we were put on the 13th floor.I would come back here in a heartbeat.Truly one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and if I were to try to find fault I would be nit picking.The hotel deserves its 5 stars

tasty cooked breakfast, lovely fruits, amazing pastries, everything was close to perfection; on top of it all, a committed staff, kind and efficient; finally, a good view to the lake....... what else can i add here?

LocationThe Palace Hotel Tokyo has perhaps the most exclusive and priveleged address of all Tokyo hotels, being right next to the Imperial Palace and gardens. No other hotel even comes close in this regard. Its strategic location at the doorstep of the 5-line Otemachi metro interchange station means you can get to most (if not all) of Tokyo's main attractions (e.g. Shinjuku, Shibuya, Ginza, Ikebukoro) within 20 mins, usually without even having a swap a line. The Tokyo Station, which is within walking distance, facilitates cross-country travel and is in itself a gold mine for food and shopping. So you get the accessibility and convenience to pretty much all of Tokyo while being blissfully cocooned away from the crazy crowds. Location-wise, this is as perfect as it gets. Rooms Refined Japanese luxury and elegance at its finest. Guests will easily appreciate the eye-pleasing living space crafted from the tasteful combination of space, great views, quality amenities, and the harmonious blend of modern and traditional decor.The crown jewel of the room is the balcony overlooking the Imperial Palace grounds and/or the cityscape. Similarly, this balcony feature is pretty much unique to the Palace Hotel so we strongly urge that you consider at least a balcony room when booking a stay here. It is a real difference-maker to your hotel experience. ServiceWarm, attentive, and efficient, with good command of English to boot. Get used to being greeted with warm smiles and respectful bows by the staff throughout your time at the hotel. This is Japanese hospitality at its absolute best. Food The Grand Kitchen offers a wonderful breakfast each morning, which pairs a comprehensive buffet spread with a special menu for made-to-order dishes (e.g. egg benedict with crab meat). Guests additionally get to dine outdoors overlooking the Palace moat. We can't think of a better way to start the day. Be sure to have breakfast included in your room rate, or you'll certainly be missing out on something memorable.Other facilitiesThe hotel pool within Japan's only Evian Spa is worth highlighting for its beauty. It is large enough for meaningful laps and remains lightly used for the most part, providing a refreshing respite to guests weary from a day in the bustling city.Overall value-for-moneyLuxury travellers are not short of top-tier hotel options in Tokyo. They are all excellent and for the price, the Palace Hotel is right up there with the best of them in terms of providing top-notch quality and service. But what makes the Palace Hotel stand out are all the features that only it can offer. We are talking about the exclusive location, the unrivalled views that come with it, and the unique balcony that brings those nice views to life. And we should also not forget its rich heritage - this is a hotel with a storied history that very few Tokyo hotels can boast of having. What this means in short is that you will be residing in a special place, and indulging in an experience that transcends luxury. Exclusive, exquisite, exceptional. This is the Palace Hotel Tokyo.

The hotel was great, we enjoyed our time there. I will say for such a lovely hotel, the concierge is lacking a lot in enthusiasm and effectiveness - I would say they’re more of a translation service than a concierge service.

I have not even arrived and I am delighted. I reviewed the top hotels in Tokyo and was deciding between the Mandarin and the Palace. I settled for the Palace because I have been blown away with the concierge. They have been incredible. We booked the top hotels in the other cities and I have been trying to make local reservations and none have come even close to the concierge at the Palace. Incredible! We are already delighted with the choice. Will review more later.

The Palace Hotel in Tokyo is a world class facility overlooking the Imperial Gardens. The location is in the heart of the city. The room balconies are a unique feature that affords you a wonderful opportunity to relax and watch Tokyo light up at night or hustle during the day. The staff is very accommodating. Room are spacious with loads of amenities; pj’s, eye heat mask for relaxation prior to going to sleep, slippers. Japanese electric toilets are a wonderful amusement for westerns.

Our family stayed here for 3 days last week. The service was incredible, the staff spoke very good English and were friendly. The views from the balcony overlooking the Palace were fabulous and the room was well appointed. I would recommend the club level lounge as a full breakfast is provided along with drinks and appetizers in the early evening. I would highly recommend this hotel which is part of the Leading Hotels of the World.

A luxurious yet comfortable hotel, with a great location right opposite from the Imperial Palace Garden Main Entrance and direct access into the underground city that leads to all the nearby shopping centres and subway stations. The room was well appointed and very comfortable with a lovely bathroom that was a delight to bathe in. Service twice a day to the room made sure it was always spotlessly clean and tidy. The Club Lounge is one of the best I’ve seen. Open from 7am to 10 pm with attentive and helpful staff at all hours. It has a marvellous view of the city and a rooftop area to enjoy your drinks too. This hotel is highly recommended and I do look forward to being back again.

We stayed at the Palace Hotel between May 9th and 13th. The hotel is at a great location. All the rooms offer a stunning view and the hotel connects with the local Subway network. The gym and swimming pool and spa are top Notch quality also.We would like to point out the excellency of the club lounge. We used to take our breakfast every Morning because the quality was very best and the place very quiet with a stunning view on Tokyo. We liked also cocktail time with the litlle snacks. Finally the team was able to satisfay all our needs. For example a private cab driver to go around tokyo. At the end of our trip I had forgotten my raincoat in my room and they sent it to me by FedEx

One of the best I expect, unbelievable service, excellent rooms, quiet, great restaurant, central 5 mins walk to Tokyo central rail.had a good time, glad we stayed. Not sure what other platitudes to use, its 6 stars, has an information counter for lost tourists such as usand has the most helpful concierge counter I have experienced

This was the worst stay in Tokyo we have ever had. We arrived at the hotel after traveling for 20 hours to be told our room was not ready. This was at 3:30pm at a hotel that has a check-in time of 3pm. After waiting 20 minutes to check-in, I asked the front desk clerk, Kamae-san, why it was taking so long and if there was an issue. Her respect nose was ‘wait for some more minutes”. Eventually she admitted that the room was not ready and would not be ready for about another 30 minutes. We were escorted to the lounge as a courtesy and ended up waiting a total of 1.5 hours until we got into our room at 5pm.Once in the room and waiting for our luggage, someone barged into the room without knocking and then quickly ran out. We had booked under the American Express program but not once did anyone explain nor honor the benefits. In fact, we had to call and ask where breakfast was served, times etc.Breakfast on Easter Sunday was another awful experience. We were seated at a table to find dirty napkins from the prior guests still on the chairs. To add insult, the coffee was cold. Not once did staff even acknowledge it was Easter. Previous years we have stayed in the Conrad and the Ritz Carlton, both have fabulous Easter celebrations and great service.Given this hotel charged close to $1000 a night, you would be better to save your money and go stay in a Tokyo 3-star hotel where the service would be better and you would feel like a valued guest.I would not recommend this hotel.
user_name:
frogandjj
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location and a superb hotel. We had a room on the 13 th floor with a fantastic view especially from the bathroom. There is a piano bar and a restaurant. You may need to book in advance especially if you want Japanese. Great service

Impeccable location, refined service, to the finest detail! I utilized the American Express Fine Hotels program. The attention to comfort is unsurpassed! Loved the dining options and most of all the immediacy to the Imperial Palace!

Probably the best service we have ever received in our life!! This is a business hotel- so they do have a few restrictions for kids... but worth it. The concierge was bananas... geisha show on 2 hours notice- no problem. Double seat bike desired... no problem. My only complaint was sofa in lounge could use an update.

You definitely feel as if you are royalty while you are staying here! The bellman meets you as you are walking with your suitcases toward the hotel. The gardens are amazing ! You walk in to the lobby filled with flowers. The room is incredible—electronic curtains, television in bathroom, super comfy beds. We don’t want to leave!! The breakfast buffet is the best! There is soft music playing in the lounge at night. I can’t say enough about this hotel and can thinkof nothing negative to say!

Loads of nice things about this hotel, great service and perfect rooms. But the showers.... oooof, amazing! So powerful. Fast room service.My room tip, get the higher floors for better view. We were on the 20th and had a massive balcony you could host a BBQ on.

Was a little concerned at staying in a rather large skyscraper hotel as assumed it may cater for corporate customers and be a little ‘remote’. Nothing could be further from the truth. We were warmly treated throughout our stay. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful at every turn.our room was very comfortable and the views of the Palace and Gardens from our balcony amazing. Really pleased we came.

The Palace Hotel Tokyo is in a great location, easily accessible to the trains, Ginza and the park. Staff is WONDERFUL. Rooms lovely, clean, comfortable and nice bathroom amenities. I love a hotel that supplies a real hairdryer that actually dries hair! Incredible daily breakfast - so delicious!
user_name:
traceymccarter
New York City, New York

review_body: The re0 build in last 7 or 8 years make it an outstanding hotel to stay . All possible amenities.Noteworthy was the service provided by the concierge team , to be commended , and there welcoming assistance made all the difference to a stay in Tokyo.

The Palace is well situated, 5 minutes from JR central station with its own subway station right underneath and a plentiful taxi rank ensures good links around the city. Rooms are spacious and well equipped and service throughout is exemplary.As a base for exploring Tokyo and for arriving and leaving the city the Palace is the ideal, if expensive, choice.

The hotel when I first visited it in 2003 was tired and dated, fast forward many years and it is a wonderful hotel with old and new entwined. No other hotel in Tokyo has the location and the history.Enjoy !

Out of all the possible hotels to stay at in Tokyo, the Palace Hotel rises to the top in terms of the city views, pristine location, building quality and attention to detail. It’s a world-class property with service that can’t be beat. There are several metro stations within walking distance, cabs are easy to get and there’s a huge variety of restaurants and cafes that surround the location.

I have to admit that I only go to Tokyo once or twice per year on business so I am not an expert. But I don't plan on staying anywhere else. Beautiful hotel and convenient to the financial district. Its directly across from the Imperial palace with great sidewalks for walking and running. Lots of restaurant choices at the hotel but all very pricey. If you head down into the tunnels, there are more affordable options. Staff is incredibly attentive. Lots of shopping and dining options within walking distance as well.

Every aspect of The Palace Hotel is exemplary, from the beautiful and superbly maintained public spaces ( enhanced by wonderful art and floral displays)  to the spacious, comfortable,luxurious bedrooms and bathrooms (housekeeping of those rooms is exceptional) The buffet breakfast is outstanding and the restaurants are of a very high standard.The staff are efficient, friendly and charming with a polished attention to detail.Nothing is too much trouble and they have a genuinely caring attitude,which is to be admired.Looking forward to returning next year and would highly recommend the hotel to fellow travellers.

room location food all top notch particular praise to the very helpful staff who spoke a decent level of english very rare in japan the crown french restaurants could teach a few 3* Michelin restaurants in Paris a thing or too
user_name:
Michael G
Tel Aviv District, Israel

review_body: Loved staying at the Palace Hotel. The service was excellent. Definitely take advantage of the concierge for restaurant and tour bookings. Highly recommend the brunch buffet at least once during your stay. The location is very convenient because many train lines available via Tokyo station. Also quick taxi ride to Haneda airport.

Next to Imperial Palace & Gardens. (need to preregister for palace; gardens are free & no registration is necessary). Short walk for main Tokyo railway station as well as multiple subway lines. Large rooms; nice balcony with automatic shears and drapes. Bathroom has separate shower/tub room (huge), toilet room (naturally with Japanese style toilet- heated toilet seat with built in bidet) and central room with sink. Closet is small; moderate drawer space. Room has bar soap, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, mouthwash, comb, hair brush, cotton swabs & pads, emery board, razor, toothbrush, shower cap, hairbands, facial tissue, sewing kit, shoe mitt & polish, teapot, coffee maker, ironing board, iron, fabric freshener, mini-frig; Blu-ray player, room safe, shoe-trees; scale; Fluffy robes and pajamas. Moderate sized exercise room with nice lap pool. Room is quiet only noise was rare emergency vehicle siren. Same plugs as US but only 100 V – things will work, but may not be perfect – damage is possible – better to use dual voltage or converter. Lots of outlets. Bedside USB charging ports. During the day the room was nice & bright, but at night it is somewhat on the darker side (could use brighter lights, the bathroom is nice and bright, but rest of room is dark – especially desk & sitting area. Reading lights at bed are okay. Bathroom lights are on dimmer which makes for a great night light without interfering with darkness of room for sleep. Central AC/heat. Great breakfast buffet – both western and Japanese foods. Some of lightest, fluffiest pancakes I’ve ever had – I eventually started ordering them daily! Daily paper delivered to room. Twice daily room service. Overall the service at this hotel was second to none.

Well trained staff, the entire hotel maintained to perfection, excellent breakfast and room service.All staff speak fluent English.Our room was with a balcony where we were to see the “shy” Mount Fuji on two mornings. Great views from our room with no other tall buildings blocking our view. The hotel location is extremely convenient for Tokyo station (bullet trains) and adjacent to the beautiful Imperial Palace gardens.Top notch and although expensive, it is good value.Only two small comments. • In terms of being green, is it relly necessary to replace our slippers, bath robes and night shirts every day?• For us older guests we do need good lighting, and I found the room central light to be too weak to see properly. It really does need a more powerful lamp – and this should not be an issue when it is on a dimmer.On a convenience note for other guests, from reception there is an escalator down to shops and the route to the local underground station. The shops include some decent value small restaurants and a 7/11 convenience store with inexpensive snacks, beer, wine and generally handy stuff.
user_name:
Stan C
Blandford Forum, United Kingdom

review_body: After a flight from LAX we arrived at the palace hotel. My Wife's first trip to Tokyo. The staff that welcomed us were extremely polite and efficient. We were escorted to our check in area where we given a very welcomed cool drink after the taxi ride from the airport. Our room was very clean and our bed very comfortable. The room service ladies were excellent. The hotel restaurants we ate in were very good and the breakfast buffet had a very large selection of food or guests from many parts of the world. If you are visiting Tokyo for pleasure or business I would recommend the Palace Hotel.

Staying here was a great experience. The hotel is new and lovely. It is located just across the street from the Imperial Palace gardens and has a view of the palace grounds. The service was attentive without being over bearing. The bed was huge and comfortable; the bathroom was great. I have to admit it was a bit small especially when we put an extra bed in the room to accommodate our adult son. The concierge was extremely helpful in giving directions and making reservations for us.The breakfast buffet was outstanding.We stayed there for 3 nights and thought the price was worth it. We would stay here again. There was just nothing bad to say about our stay.

A group of 10 stayed for three nights. We had a fabulous breakfast each morning which covered western and Asian foods. Omelet’s and pancakes freshly made. I had the best French Toast in my life on one morning with freshly made cappuccino.We had drinks in the lounge on one evening, the service as always impeccable, the pianist was talented but a tad loud which we asked a couple of times to turn down. The rooms were well appointed with comfy bed and pillows. Turn down service provided three bottles of water, ice bucket, pyjamas and slippers.The bathroom provided many supplies, lovely towels and the best water pressure with a rain shower or standard shower rose. We were amazed with the toilet, I know odd comment, but they were heated with variations of mechanisms and automations. The Japanese coy Toto has the monopoly on these and boy they do toilets well.

Excellent service, rooms, spa, amenities and ambience, right up there with the best (we've stayed with almost all the top international chains in Tokyo). The staff were experienced and flexible, and superbly hospitable. Excellent stay.

One of the nicest room I never had in Tokyo and it was not a suite...Beautiful terrace, splendid bathroom, I can’t count the number of amenities (some unique). A great concierge. Fantastic breakfast, fantastic location, fantastic restaurants, fantastic everything

The Palace Hotel was great from start to finish. I arrived quite late at night after my boyfriend and they were very accommodating. I was able to order from a quite extensive menu. The food was delicious. The concierges offered great advice and helped tremendously with navigating the subway system and booking our tour to Mt. Fuji. Breakfast was also quite delectable. We arrived midweek when it wasn't so busy, but boy does it get packed on the weekend, so I would give yourself some time to eat if you plan on breakfast then. It was really nice to have restaurant choices below and shopping around the corner. The amenities, views and even turn down service left no stone un-turned. I also recommend getting a massage and using the facilities of the Evian spa. A luxurious, pleasant and peaceful experience.

This is a 5 stars hotel, I got upgraded to executive floor, the curtain in the room is powered by electricity, control by wall control box & also bedside control box. Room is clean, service is good. Only one comment, the bedside lighting control box is not so user friendly, does not have clear indication, difficult switch on / off.

We concluded our stellar 10 day trip to Japan by staying at Palace Hotel Tokyo. We arrived at Tokyo Station after visiting Kyoto and made the easy nice walk over to the Palace. The moment we walked into the hotel the dashing bellmen heard the sound of our rolling cases and greeted us warmly and took our bags. Our beautifully appointed room overlooked the Imperial Palace. This hotel exemplifies a 5-star property in every detail - service, quality, design, ambience, and comfort. So much in fact we skipped our plans to go out on the town our last night in Tokyo. We stayed in our room soaking in this outstanding room, delicious room service and the overall Palace experience!

On previous visits we have stayed in Shinjuku but this trip decided to have a change. The hotel is located close to Tokyo station and an easy 10 minute walk. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was very spacious with a nice view over the palace grounds, The room had all the amenities that you need for a stay. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is located about a 15 walk from shopping and restaurants which was fine with us as we enjoy walking. We also walked down to Ginza fro the hotel. It is a lot quieter here than at Shinjuku. We would not hesitate to stay here again.
user_name:
Bev C
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Even though most things about Japan seem to represent the best in their class, this hotel has set the bar that most other hotels around the world fail to reach. From the first impression in the lobby featuring their own unique aromatherapy fragrance to the well appointed staff posted at multiple locations ready to assist, guide, greet or advise, you can't help feeling welcomed to a unique property. The meticulously designed rooms feature all the comforts of a world-class location, with complimentary pajamas, a selection of teas, ample amenities and toiletry supplies, the famous Toto electronic toilet, electronic shade and drape systems, soundless air-conditioning, a deep tub that fills in seconds, recessed lighting with multiple units in multiple locations, fluffy linens, and the most comfortable bed with gentle steam eye masks to help lull you to sleep. The rooms are utterly silent, and the front desk staff answer within two rings. One of the biggest highlights is the magnificent breakfast buffet and a la carte served in the main restaurant area. The options are beyond description with fruits, seafood, meats, cheeses, fresh baked good, jams, juices, egg dishes, rice dishes, nuts, grains and a litany of assorted condiments from all around the world. Located in the Marunouchi area, aside from the beautiful royal palace gardens, there isn't much to see from a tourist perspective, but the main Tokyo train station is a 15 minute walk.
user_name:
GibsonHyde
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location for business travelers, direct subway access from the basement, a bit far from all the tourist areas. As its located across from the palace, there’s a big detour to go around every time if you take a taxi.

Hard not to like the Palace Hotel: in Marunouchi just a stone's grow from the Imperial Palace, moments from Ginza and the Tokyo station that will take you anywhere in Japan! The rooms are spacious, the breakfast outside area by the Palace moat is simply beautiful, you can jog around the palace in the fresh morning.Staff is attentive and polite. As a business function, we hired the boardroom at the top. Not cheap but we have never had a global meeting so productive as this one, the room was extra big, massive windows, great catering, everything ran as clockwork.Fantastic job from these guys, this is definitely on the top of the list when I stay in Tokyo from now on.

I only write reviews when I am either profoundly disappointed or overwhelmingly pleased. In this case it is the latter. What a hotel! If only real life could be so heavenly. I walked in the doors of The Palace and I was at peace. The Palace is a hotel for those seeking a serene experience surrounded by beauty. The grace and kindness of the staff is, in my experience, without equal. The attention to detail was amazing. Every time we got in a taxi they had the driver map out our destination before leaving. As a result of a knee injury I needed ice every evening. In less than five minutes it arrived,every night without exception.We had a club room with a view of the Palace Gardens and a terrace. I loved watching the sun move over the Fall leaf color at different times of the day. It was like a tapestry.I really booked the club floor for the combination of the view and the rate at the time. Little did I know that we would enjoy the experience of the club floor as much as we did. It includes a breakfast buffet, that is amazing. We had breakfast outside on the terrace with a view of Mt. Fuji on clear days. In the early evening we enjoyed wine and appetizers, which were delicious, overlooking a view of the city, so lovely. In the evening in the salon, on the first floor, there was a fabulous pianist and a great jazztrio. We were taken aback by the restaurants. We read quite a bit and booked several on our own. We booked a very prestigious and expensive tempura restaurant and were astounded that that meant all you get is tempura, no vegetable, no salad. That's a lot of fried food for $200 a person.The concierge recommended an Italian restaurant within walking distance and it was fabulous. We also loved our dinner at Madame Toki. It is a bit of a hike from the hotel but absolutely wonderful. The chef is Japanese but trained in France. The food, service and the wine were exquisite.I will always remember my stay at The Palace with a sigh of pure pleasure.
user_name:
Sarah C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is a near perfect urban hotel. It is superbly located, with beautiful views of the Imperial Palace gardens. The staff is welcoming, attentive, and professional. The food is outstanding. The decor is beautiful and up-to-date. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with great amenities. No detail is overlooked. Since I said it was "close to perfect," I struggled to find a negative and could only come up with two, neither of which is very important. (1) There were a few errors with my bill, but they were easily straightened out afterwards by phone, and (2) I loved the pool, but the changing room is small and has no steam or sauna.

We stayed on the 14th floor over looking the old palace grounds, it was an incredible view. The room was top of the line and the staff was super friendly and helpful. It is walking distance to the Ginza area that has lots of stores and restaurants.

We loved this hotel. The rooms are spacious, with plenty of space for our oversized luggage. There's a table near the window with chairs that swivel so that we could enjoy the view of the Imperial Palace. Hotel has been rebuilt so the design is very modern, and fitted with modern conveniences such as power sockets in the right places and USB ports. The bathroom was large and spacious, with double vanities. It also helps to have two points of entry - both with sliding doors.The hotel is connected with one of the exits of Otemachi Station, which makes commuting convenient. It's also within walking distance of Tokyo Station.All the hotel staff we encountered were very polite and helpful. The concierge in particular was helpful in booking restaurants for us, although these days hotel concierges have less access to the hardest to book places.We really enjoyed our stay, and would love to return.

Beautiful rooms, excellent service staff and good food. The thing I enjoyed most about this hotel was the thoughtfulness and attention to detail: while everything looks tidy and minimalist, you're provided with just about everything you might need -- from mouth wash to a steam iron. If you leave your glasses out on your side table, you'll find a lens cloth placed beneath them. While we stayed there, pyjamas, slippers and an eye steam mask were left out each evening. The swimming pool at the Evian Spa is gorgeous and felt very luxurious. We didn't use the gym, but it looked well-equipped, clean and hi-tech. The buffet breakfast was terrific. We had a great stay, thank you.

The service in this hotel is outstanding. Rooms are beautifully appointed. Situation - couldn’t be better. Sitting on the balcony over looking the Imperial Palace. How can you better that. Breakfast buffet,teppanyaki restaurant, spa- I could go on and on. Finally a special thank you to the concierge service who went out of their way to find the time for the screening of the England - Japan rugby match. We will forever compare hotels to the best - the Palace Hotel Tokyo

My sister and I ended our two week stay in japan at the Palace Hotel for two nights. While the hotel was very nice, I wish I had known or researched better the area. It’s akin to staying on Wall Street in NYC. I imagine it’s oerfect for business travelers, but for pleasure travelers I would not recommend. Its location was far removed from anything to do in the evening. The hotel is somewhat sterile...even the multitude of restaurants were not inviting. I have no particular complaints and the complaint I do have has more to do with my lack of knowledge about the city and where the hotel is located.

Wonderful in every way: elegant and well-appointed rooms, outstanding service with a smile, excellent concierge services, great location, delcious breakfast buffet...loved eating outside. We highly recommend this hotel.
user_name:
cassidy24
New York City, New York

review_body: One of the nicest hotels I’ve stayed at ever. The Palace is a beautiful, well located hotel. The breakfast is delicious and plentiful. Service was impeccable. All staff we encountered were very helpful. The room was luxurious and large. Plenty of storage space to unpack. I would stay here again in Tokyo.

The hotel overlooked the Imperial Palace surrounded by moats and beautiful parks and gardens with mount Fuji in the distance. We had a Large comfortable room with all amenities. The staff were very friendly and wonderfully efficient. I enjoyed using the large swimming pool at 6.30 each morning which had a wonderful view over Tokyo. They give one of the best breakfasts I have ever had. Perfectly located for shopping, restuants and Toyo main station 10 minutes walk.

Yes, it is expensive. But it is also worth every penny: modern facilities, large rooms, great location, extremely good service. Breakfast buffet very good, but the two bars are also worth a visit: very professional, engaging bartenders that know their cocktails. Very helpful and knowledgeable concierge.

I have travelled the world staying in luxury hotels and this place is just amazing.PROS- easiest most polite efficient check in with room ready hours early (having just taken midnight flight from Australia this was much appreciated)- happy staff who always show courtesy respect and genuine desire to help- open space and capacity to sit in peace on balcony- QUIET - even though looking out over CBD Tokyo shut the door and no sound is heard- room so clean light fully stocked and most comfortable bed ever- location right next to Station and walk to beautiful Imperial Palace and tree lined Marunouchi neighborhood - constant attention to cleanliness, restocking room and outstanding turn down service with water fresh slippers - food - brilliant breakfast covering allcuisines and especially appreciated for a Melbournian excellent coffee/restaurant and in room dining equally top quality- the most beautiful flowers I have ever see in lobby CONS noneTIProom with balcony a must - see Mt Fuji and sit in awe of this beautiful cityWell done Palace Hotel to you and your wonderful staff

Flew into Narita airport and was able to take the limo bus right to the hotel. The minute I walked in staff was warm and welcoming. My room was very nice overlooking the imperial palace's gardens. Buffet breakfast was wonderful. Visited the Spa - had a wonderful massage. Subway conveniently located right under hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Having stayed for business at some of the nicest places in Asia, this place is on par with The Fullerton in Singapore or the Grand Hyatt in Taipei. The rooms are large, the food is great, the service is top notch, the bathrooms are incredible, the gym is pretty nice. It’s just hard to find anything to complain about except it’s a little pricey, but so are most things in Tokyo.
user_name:
calebtommasini
New York City, New York

review_body: I have stayed in many hotels - and this was the best, friendliest, cleanest, most complete hotel I've ever stayed in.The staff was courteous and helpful - I needed to find an american style pharmacy. The cleaning service was flexible and committed. We had just come from Kinizawa, beautiful and friendly, but few people spoke English, and it was such a relief to be understood and to understand.The best

The renovated Palace is truly very nice; the rooms with balcony are pleasant for a stay in Spring and Autumn and if you pick the right room (some are odd shaped) then the combination of view, service and luxury makes up for the somewhat smaller rooms compared with the Peninsula or even hotels like the Grand Hyatt or Ritz Carlton in Roppongi.

Only had 2 nights here, but will return if in Tokyo again. Great location looking out over Imperial Palace , although is a taxi ride to Ginza and pretty much everything except the Subway is right downstairs (big big station !!!) Staff just have perfect sense of service without obsequious. Great pool area. Breakfast on terrace is superb.

Had an amazing stay at the Palace Hotel while we were in Tokyo. Stayed there for 7 night and the service was amazing. Breakfast everyday was served in our room and was delicious. Additionally, the views were amazing from our room. I would highly recommend staying here to anyone visiting Tokyo.

I cannot say enough good things about the Palace Hotel Tokyo. The location overlooking the Imperial Palace, and a short above or below ground walk to Tokyo Station, gives easy access to all of Tokyo's sights. The staff makes it feel like a small luxury inn. From the doormen to the concierge, everyone welcomes you and goes out of their way to be helpful. The dining room with its outdoor patio overlooking a lagoon with graceful swans, offers a wonderful breakfast buffet in additional to delicious lunch and dinner. The room we had, overlooking the Palace, was spacious with a beautiful bathroom.

We had a 5-day stay at this hotel and loved it! It really was perfection. The hotel is located in a quieter area of Tokyo, which we really appreciated. It was close to Tokyo Station and a couple of Metro stops, so we could explore the busier and crazier areas of the city and come back to the tranquility that the hotel and surrounding area provided. It was also a nice walk to the Marinucci Building and Ginza, with great shopping and many (and varied) places to eat. Our room was very spacious and had a wonderful balcony with a fabulous view of the gardens and incredible sunsets. All of the various amenities in the room seemed very carefully selected--beautiful tea pot with ceramic cups, crystal glasses, teak boxes, nespresso coffee machine with china cups, etc. The bed was one of the largest I have ever seen (much larger than a standard king) and was so comfortable. The bathroom was amazing. A large tub, with bath salts provided, a beautiful waterfall shower head, extra-large counter space with razors, brushes, tooth brushes, etc. provided. The staff, cleaning both in the morning and those who provide turn-down service at night, did not overlook any detail. At no point did we ever want for anything or feel that anything was missing or neglected, and turn-down service included pajamas and warm eye masks. I was really impressed by the level of service from the entire hotel staff. Everywhere we went we were greeted and often asked if we could be assisted with anything. We regularly used the concierge and one woman, whose name I sadly no longer have, went above and beyond what I've come to expect from this service. We had the daily buffet breakfast, which was fresh and delicious, with many healthy Japanese and American options, and the pastries rivaled any I had in Paris. Breakfast was served both inside and out and both provided a beautiful environment and was just a great way to start the day. If there was any disappointment, it was the dinner we had in the main restaurant. We normally wouldn't haven't eaten there as it was mostly western food, but we were there when a typhoon hit the island and we didn't want to face the rain that night. We ordered the prix fixe menu with wine paring, and the food was just okay, and the service just above that. The highlight were the wines chosen by the sommelier--they were unique, varied and just spot-on. The dessert was also notable.I also took advantage of the spa services and received a 90-minute massage, which was the best massage I ever had. I told the masseuse that I really wanted something deep tissue and she delivered(!), but checked in with me during the course of the massage to make sure that the pressure was what I was looking for. After a long flight, it really helped me get all the kinks out. Our only regret was not staying longer. We went to Kyoto and then spent 2 nights at the Hilton in Shinjuku when we returned, which was a complete and utter disappointment, especially in light of the amazing stay that we at the Hotel Palace.There are many reasons to return to Tokyo, but staying again at the Palace Hotel is certainly listed at the top.

We stayed for 3 nights in this fantastic Hotel ... clearly one of the best leading hotels ... top service, extremely helpful, friendly and competent staff - in all departments. Speaks for outstanding management. Rooms very nice and very good price / value. Well equipped spa - always quite booked though. We didn’t test all the restaurants and bars / cafes. Breakfast clearly 5 star. If u want to enjoy Tokyo for some days / over a weekend or if you are there for business we can clearly recommend. Use subway as the hotel is very well connected !

We thoroughly enjoyed our 4-night stay at this beautiful property. The room was spacious with a great view of the Imperial Gardens, Palace and surrounding moat. (The shower was a wonderful delight! ). This is the really best hotel in Tokyo. It is a great location, walking distance to the subway and train stations. The service was excellent and attentive and the breakfast buffet was delicious! No problem for us with the language as the staff all spoke English. And our one issue during our stay was resolved quickly and satisfactorily. Note the teppan-style Japanese restaurant on the property is really good, but it’s pricey, so be prepared. All-in all, this will be a favorite of ours and one we highly recommend.

1. Good English speaking staff2. Strong water pressure shower 3 . Breakfast with good view 4. Best omakase ( sushi ) Japanese restaurant with good looking chef 5. Opposite to The Palace , I must visit again during cherry blossom 6. Unsuitable for family or kids , coz u might need a bit of walking to the train7. Great place for couples who loves green n good food 8. Nice flowers arrangement at lobby n bonsai

We stayed in the Palace, and absolutely loved our stay. Our travel agent suggested that we upgrade to the Club Level, and it was a great suggestion. They had fantastic breakfast and evening snacks and drinks, club service was impeccable and the views great. The hotel is very centrally located, which worked out great since we were touring every day and using the subway constantly. A great choice!

I travel a lot, this is one of my top/favorite hotel in the world. Worth staying here. Rooms, service, everything is the best. The restaurants in the hotel are good and popular so make a reservation asap, I didn't and could not get in while I was there.

The hotel is a very short walk from Tokyo train station and is opposite the Imperial Palace, so it is very central.We had a lovely room on the 12th floor with fabulous views over the river and the city. As one would expect, the room was spotlessly clean, the bed large and comfortable and the bathroom was well stocked with toiletries. Breakfast was excellent with a fabulous selection of pastries, juices and Asian dishes.However, we felt the service was not up to the standard it should be for a 5 star hotel. On our first day we sat on the terrace to have coffee. We waited so long for service that in the end my husband had to go to find a waiter to take the order.
