Also on arrival at the hotel (at 14:40) we were told that check-in isn't until 15:00 but they would find us a room, as if 20 minutes makes a big difference!It is worth bearing in mind that in the basement arcade below the hotel there are a number of restaurants which are not run by the hotel, which are much cheaper than the hotels own restaurants.

From arrival (which was 11pm) to departure I could not have asked for anything more!Staff were absolutely amazing, to the point that they would stay one step ahead of you and tell their colleagues if you needed something before you spoke to them.Room was very spacious and one of the best finished rooms I have stayed in. Pure luxury with being over the top.The view from the window was amazing.WiFi worked without any problems and was always fast.If you get the chance for a walk/run, the 5km loop around the palace is worth it.

Stayed here this month for 4 nights. Our room had a beautiful view over the Imperial Palace Gardens and was comfortable and, generally, of a high standard. Breakfast can be taken inside or outside on the terrace overlooking the river. It's a busy hotel with it's fair share of business travellers. In the evening the bar has jazz - a pianist and bass player - and a fun, bustling atmosphere. We ate in the restaurant in the evening and also took room service - both were of a high standard. I used the gym each day although for the size of the hotel I thought it was on the small side with just the average sets of equipment. So nothing spectacular here.If you're looking for somewhere nice to stay in the city this hotel is well positioned and provides great service - from the moment you arrive outside. As you might expect it is a very busy hotel and not just with business travellers - they had 11 weddings the day we arrived! So a popular choice for locals too.

What a treat to be able to stay here! Everything about the hotel exudes luxury with a personal service. The breakfast on the terrace was amazing - the eggs benedict with truffle sublime! We had the pool to ourselves which was also wonderful. The rooms were stunning with so many extras to enjoy. Finally drinks on the club lounge with the view were just the icing on the cake. Simply amazing thank you!

We are both experienced hoteliers in the luxury segment, so it is not easy to please us. However, the Palace Hotel is absolutely incredible! We stayed here twice during our trip in Japan, but the first as well as the second stay were fantastic. The service is top notch; you are greeted everywhere, service is fast, discrete and efficient, housekeeping folds your clothes, provides glasses cleaning towels, warming face masks. It is definitely not a cheap hotel, but if you want to be treated like royalty, this is your hotel. The spa amd gym are great, eye for detail in restaurants and front office is perfect. We will definitely return, and we have visited a lot of 5 star places. Compliments to the whole team of Palace Hotel!

Welcoming, quality Japanese hospitality and service with a view over the Imperial Palace. I was extremely impressed with the service from all staff members and the Head Concierge. P.S. I believe some concierge members fall below the this hotel's quality.

We booked the Club Grand Deluxe room, large room and very big balcony with fantastic view to the Imperial palace.. the club lounge is one of the best I ever visited, free flow champagne and delicious Japanese canapés at the cocktail hour which is from 5:30 to 8:00pm.. staff is incredible service minded and ever so friendly.. this was our second stay, this time 4 nights and we will be back again..

We stayed here in a Deluxe room in August 2018 for 4 nights. The room is spacious with a balcony and large bathroom with bath and separate shower cabin and toilet. The shower is excellent. The room has good air-conditioning and good lighting although you need an advanced degree in electrical engineering to understand how to control the lights. There is a minibar, water cooker and Nespresso coffee machine. Coffee capsules are for free and refilled daily. This also applies to 3 water bottles (1/2 liter each). The hotel staff is immaculate: extremely service oriented and very friendly. Wi-Fi is free and very good. Unfortunately the room has carpet but everything is very clean. The bed is large and very good. Breakfast buffet is excellent with a large selection of hot and cold choices, including a large selection of fresh fruit. The hotel (with 290 rooms) is connected to metro station Otemachi and within 5 minutes’ walk you can reach an area with a selection of restaurants. There you will also find a small 7-Eleven supermarket. The hotel is opposite the Imperial Palace and by metro every part of Tokyo is easy to reach.

The hotel is new and located right next to the Palace. The room is a decent size with a luxury setting and nice view. Service was excellent. Location is very convenient, within 5 minutes drive ( walking distance) to Ginza and Tokyo station. Only 5 minutes walk (indoor path) to Subway station. Will definitely stay here again next time visit Tokyo.

The best hotel I have stayed for business in Asia Pac region. Good sized room, have smoking rooms, comfortable bed, great bathroom, fantastic service - they even changed and gave fresh room slippers every day, good speed wifi, convenient location, best service and staff.

Excellent hotel. Well located near the palace and walking distance to the train. Breakfast is one of the best I have ever head - think four seasons Sunday brunch in A major US city as the closest comparable. Dinner restaurants are the only negative - insanely over priced and simply not that good. The steak house for example is over $300 per person price fixed for a menu that is of extremely high quality but mirrors Benihana. The rooms are cozy, beds comfortable (loved the pillows) though the bathrooms could afford a bit more privacy. Clean new feeling throughout the hotel. Overall a great place to stay.

This was our first stop on a 3 week trip around Japan, and set the bar very high! Its a fantastic hotel, only a short walk from Tokyo station and next door to the Imperial Palace. It has everything you'd expect from a 5-Star property but also a couple of really lovely touches that made the stay extra special.First was the Concierge (Mayako) and her team. This was our first visit to Japan and they went above and beyond in helping me plan in advance and secure some unique experiences. For example, we were able to see the annual Sumida River Fireworks from the Skytree Tower - something that was impossible to book from overseas and sells most tickets by a local ballot system. We were one of only a handful of foreign tourists there on the night. They were also able to help booking tickets for Universal Studios in Osaka later in our trip and were always on hand with advice.Second was the highly attentive service. As an example, we arrived early in the morning before our room was ready, trailing two tired children and looking like we had just stepped off the plane. Not only were we welcomed with a drink and a smile, no one complained when the kids fell asleep on the sofa and in fact staff actually brought them blankets to make them comfortable. This attentive level of service continued throughout, from the spa and pool to the restaurant. Overall it was an exceptionally warm welcome to Tokyo and we highly recommend the hotel.

My stay of 10 days was perfect for me and my personal assistant. I stayed in both the Club Grand Deluxe and then moved to a Club Deluxe with balcony; my assistant stayed in a Deluxe Room with no club access. The Club Lounge itself is quiet and relaxing, and has a formal and luxurious feel to it.Rooms are spacious and my balcony much appreciated, especially when it is summer. Amenities are good and though the room is a bit dated, it is comfortable and relaxing.I would recommend any of their restaurants. We tried virtually every venue. Tempura and teppanyaki, as well as the Chinese restaurant. However, the most impressive venue is their French restaurant Crown. A remarkable experience. It is delightful to see a Japanese Chef heading a French restaurant. Dishes are beautifully presented, the wine list better than expected and the service impeccable.The Evian Spa provides many treatments; on the two occasions I visited, service was attentive and my spa therapist was knowledgeable with excellent skills. Spa reception is careful in explaining the actual treatments to guests, and made good suggestions as to what combination of treatments might best suit my skin type.The Palace is for guests familiar with Japanese customs and style of service. It is a formal hotel as it welcomes many foreign diplomats as well as visiting royalty. Dress codes are enforced. If this is not the style one expects, then it might be better to choose a more relaxed venue elsewhere, rather than to be disappointed. I actually spoke to some guests who felt restricted and uncomfortable, and found the staff to be too formal or "unfriendly". I do not believe this is a hotel for young families.I would recommend this hotel to those who appreciate refinement and elegance.

Palace Tokyo has spacious facilities from lobby to spa and guestrooms. Possibly the only luxury hotel in Tokyo with the guestrooms having a balcony. The view is excellent. All the frontline staff are helpful and attentive. The lobby has an excellent menu (service could be improved at night when it gets busy) and food quality. The housekeeping staff is outstanding, room amenities are thoughtfully planned even including eye masks.

We absolutely LOVED our stay at the Palace Hotel Tokyo. Located a short walk from Tokyo Station and the Imperial Palace, away from busier areas of the city but easily accessible to all of them by metro or taxi

This review comes a little late, but better late than never. My wife and I decided to splurge on our last night in Japan last August, so we decided to stay here. Everything about the hotel was luxurious, and the staff had a genuine warmth that made us feel right at home.There is one specific incident that I'd like to mention, as an example of their dedication to service.We had booked a sushi dinner at their restaurant for our final night, we were departing the following afternoon. We had looked forward to it for the entire trip, and we couldn't wait to spend some time in luxury as we were embarking on our flight from Okinawa to Tokyo,however, this was not to be. A few minutes after take off, our plane had to turn around due to mechanical issues. We were informed that it's be hours before we could go to Tokyo. My wife and I realized that we would not make our dinner reservations and were quite sad to say the least. I emailed the concierge to cancel our dinner plans, telling them how disappointed we were and that we would pay the cancellation fee if necessary. This is when the Palace hotels dedication to service came through.Not only did they wave the cancellation fee, they even booked us a lunch at the restaurant the following day before our flight. There must have been 15 emails between the concierge and I as he kindly and patiently made new plans to salvage our ruined ones. The concierge single handedly turned an awful day into a wonderful one.The other reviews and photos here will show you how beautiful and comfortable the hotel is. I wanted to share what amazing service and dedication the staff here showed. A special thank you to Natsumi Kozaka. Since the day was so busy, I never had a chance to thank you... But you made our last moments in Tokyo so memorable. Arrigato!If my wife and I are ever fortunate enough to return to Tokyo, no visit would be complete without a stay at this wonderful hotel.

i have recently stayed at palace hotel for 6 nights in july. location is convenient from tokyo station. weather was so hot we stayed for twice room service meals and light dinner at the lobby. meals were okay but the bakery downstairs was excellent. we took walks around the area and around the palace at night. i like the location quiet and walking distance to many restaurants and shops. customer services were excellent, happy to help with positive manner. I did not stay at the balcony room but still with a very good view of palace, lots of green like a small forest in a busy city. excellent customer service, provide any needs in fast pace. i have lost a small gift during my shopping at one of the department store and reported to the gentleman at the concierge after returned back to hotel, he called the department store next day, found my lost gift and arranged to deliver back to hotel for me. You don't get this type of service in many places. I am happy with my choice and would like to stay again. By the way happy with room cleaning as well.

We had one night left in Tokyo on our return from Kyoto. Due to the Typhoon season - finding a place to stay was very difficult. We were able to get rooms at the Palace Hotel. No better place to be when rained out of touring for the day.The staff could not be more attentive and welcoming.Our rooms were magnificent. Our room with the balcony was breathtaking. Beds were very comfortable. We had a great night sleep.We enjoyed our time, the evening room service, breakfast, and a little shopping in the basement.

I had a room on an upper floor, with a fabulous view over the imperial palace's park. Ginza and Maranouchi station are in walking distance. The room (Club Deluxe King) was a bit small but very nice, functional and clean. The service was just perfect..

A great location right by the central palace, business district and Ginza. Service is excellent and having an absolutely delicious breakfast on the terrace overlooking the park and lakes is really special. Rooms are new and well appointed. Great bars and restaurants. Faultless really. However you cannot worry about the cost. Accept it will be high.

I recently stayed at the Palace Hotel at the start and end of my trip to Japan after first visiting the hotel in 2015 to dine at Sushi Kaneseka. As I came and went, the staff knew and greeted me by name, and were very welcoming and helpful. As many of the other guests have said, the hotel is very modern with elegant, refined decor. A calm oasis in the middle of Tokyo, adjacent to the Imperial Palace, right off the Otemachi stop (which connects to 5 subway lines) and about a 10 minute walk from Tokyo Station for the shinkansen and every other metro line.What I liked best that will bring me back to Palace Hotel next time: - Great, calming views of the Imperial Garden. I had a king deluxe room that faced the Imperial Palace, with views of the gardens from the "fishbowl" bathroom suite (with an oversized tub that offered a view of the gardens, if you did not draw down the power blinds).- Very quiet rooms. Not a peep from the neighbors or traffic on the street during my stay.- Super comfy rooms with good amenities. - Thoughtful turn down service, with Palace Hotel pajamas, eye masks that automatically "warm up" when removed from the packaging, and bath salts.- Excellent concierge assistance! The folks at the concierge desk (Mr. Kazushi in particular) were key in making lunch and dinner reservations for me at restaurants where I would not have been able to book on my own. I also received some great Tokyo city tour recommendations, including an "insider" sushi-making workshop at Tsukiji Market, which turned out to be terrific. - Thoughtful service generally. When I checked out for the last time, one of the bellboys helped me take my bags down to the concourse level so I could board the subway.- Terrific restaurants within the hotel. Sushi Kaneseka, two Michelin stars, is in the hotel and will also do a room service sushi box until 10pm each night. Tatsumi, an excellent tempura spot, is also in the hotel. There is also a Palace Hotel pastry and "cafe" of sorts in the concourse level for breakfast and snacks. Those were the places I tried and loved, but there are a handful of other quality restaurants within the hotel. Hard to go hungry if you prefer a quieter night in.- Pool and jacuzzi for the early morning and/or wind-down in the evenings.- Convenient location. Otemachi subway stop connects to 5 subway lines that will take you anywhere in the city. Tokyo Station is about 10 minutes walk away or 2-3 minutes by taxi if no traffic. Certain areas like Ginza, Yurakucho and even Tsukiji are within walking distance.
user_name:
Sarah W
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed in a Grand Deluxe Room with a Balcony. The room was large with a great walk in wardrobe area (see pictures). Normally, we wouldn't be bothered about a balcony in a city hotel but I would recommend a balcony room here as the hotel has open views towards the Imperial Palace and made a great place to sit and have a drink or lunch (see pictures). The hotel has a very nice small pastry, deli shop in the basement which was great for taking something back to the room to have lunch or a snack.Location wise it is excellent, just round the corner from the Tokyo's main rail station and the hotel also connects to the metro via a series of underground walkways (albeit it is a bit of a walk and easy to take a wrong turning). It is also directly opposite the Imperial Palace Gardens. We found it an excellent base to explore Tokyo.This is a large city centre hotel so whilst the service was not as personal as in a small hotel, we found all staff to be professional, courteous and helpful. The breakfasts were good (Western and Japanese choice) and you could sit outside (subject to availability) as well which is a bit of a bonus in a city.When we were there the bars and main restaurant in the hotel were quiet and perhaps lacked a bit of atmosphere.I would stay here again, I have not rated the hotel excellent as whilst it was good I wouldn't say it delivered more than you would expect for a five star city centre hotel.

great views, warm reception, great club level, such a nice and good room ,great breakfast, great spa close to metro...spacious..perfect place...tks for the attention guys... specially Kaz...I will be back

We have traveled the world staying in 5 star hotels and The Palace Hotel in Tokyo was definitely one of the best with regards to service, the club, and restaurants. The people were all lovely and extremely polite and helpful. Every place you turn there are polite staff to meet your needs. The hotel is in a quiet, business area that feels similar to Central Park in NYC. It is a beautiful haven away from the loud and busy areas toured but, very convenient to the subway. The gym and pool (only pool we found that had a few hours reserved for family swim time) are very nice and there is a wonderful 5K+ path just outside the hotel that circles the Imperial Palace and gardens. We traveled as a family and found ourselves eating a large lunch out and having a light dinner at the hotel as the food significantly exceeded our expectations and there were multiple choices. The breakfast was the best buffet we have ever seen with a lovely outdoor patio on the water. You must try the benedict with truffles! If you go I would recommend booking with the Fine Hotels Amex reservation or booking a club level room. The club served premium wine and food, above average variety and quality compared to the other 5 star hotels we stayed at in Japan. The rooms are spacious and lovely for a large city hotel. The balcony room is larger and the view was incredible but, the one without the balcony seemed to have a larger bathroom. We would love to go back to Japan just to stay at the Palace Hotel.
user_name:
Nannette K
Rancho Santa Fe, United States

review_body: The hotel is amazing and huge so you will spend some time to discover many restaurants and facilities. The staff is very helpful, friendly and respectful. You also have a convenience of entering the metro underground ways right from the hotel escalator down. While walking underground to the metro, you can see many nice cafes and shops. We enjoyed our stay of 5 days a lot!
user_name:
Nadine A
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: We spent 6 wonderful days in Tokyo. The location of the hotel is excellent but I had the following niggles. (1) There was no HDMI connection on the TV (2) There was no comfortable chair in our bedroom which overlooked the palace (3) The tiles in the bathroom were dangerously slippy. (4) At 10 pm we were not allowed to take our drinks to the terrace unless we had a meal. Most of the tables were empty and nobody was eating a meal at that time, (5) The mini bar was not replenished one day. (6) Even if staying on one of the more expensive rooms you do not get access to the club bar unless you specify this in advanceWe loved Tokyo and we loved the location of the hotel. but we didn't leave with a feeling of wanting to stay in this particular hotel the next time we visit Tokyo.

Hotel has everything you could want. Breakfast good, pool and gym good.If you want to go out in the evenings it is very quiet in this area so can be boring. Only a 20 min wall away from evening activity but if you don't like to explore then...

The service from the point of checkin to departure was gracious and attentive. The common areas are beautifully decorated, as was our room. Our room was a Club Floor king with balcony. It was spacious with a glass enclosed bathtub area the allows beautiful views to the park via the balcony, even from the separate stand alone shower. For privacy there are power blinds and sliding door to close off the bathroom area. The balcony is comfortable and very large.Our rate included the breakfast buffet in the Grand Kitchen so we did not visit the Club Floor during its breakfast service. The breakfast buffet and service in the Grand Kitchen was excellent. All of the food was great, with a special call out to the pastries and baked items, which were amazing. The Club Floor had a nice afternoon tea service with very good scones and finger sandwiches. The evening service over the dinner hours is very light- canapés and cheese.The gym is spacious with up to date equipment and has great window views of the adjacent park.

We had an excellent experience at the Palace Hotel Tokyo. We are a family of 5 and stayed in a club suite room which was tight but worked since we were only there for a couple of days. We did that because we found the hotel a bit expensive compared to North American hotels. That said, we looked at lots of alternatives and all of them were expensive, so we figured we may as well stay somewhere nice. The service was excellent. The location was ok. It is close to the subway/metro lines. We had trouble finding places to eat outside of the hotel until we realized that there were a lot of restaurants inside of an 8 storey mall nearby. The pool was great. It's shallow and long enough to do lengths.The view was incredible.

One of the best hotels I have stayed in and have travelled a lot. Worth getting a room with a balcony as they overlook the Imperial Palace. Staff is amazing and amenities in room are terrific. You can get 6 different subway lines-just remember to exit at 13b. Breakfast is also excellent. Cannot recommend highly enough-The rate we paid was very reasonable (it would cost 2-3x as much in USA). The pool is really nice and do take a look at the chapel on the 5th floor-it is stunning.

My family and I arrived in Tokyo on the first leg of an 9 day trip to Japan and were pleasantly greeted at the hotel by the bell attendant in the driveway as we walked up. He immediately took the luggage and asked for my name. Then he led us into the beautiful and peaceful lobby area to check-in. The receptionist at the counter was very pleasant and the check-in process was quick and painless. We were also handed the details of the restaurant reservations I had made prior to arrival. The bell attendant then led us directly to our room. It was large for a Japanese hotel room with a beautiful view overlooking part the of the Imperial palace grounds. The roll away bed I had requested was already in the room. The toiletries were high end and each family member had their own slippers. Each night, with turn down service, a set of Japanese pajamas sized to fit each family member was layed out with a pair of new slippers. The bed in this hotel is the best I have ever slept on. I slept so well each night which is unusual for me. My family also commented on how comfortable the beds were unlike the beds at the Ritz-Carlton. Even the rollaway bed had a very thick mattress and felt much nicer than a typical roll-away. My wife also raved about the awesome and expensive hair dryer in the room. She ended up buying one during the trip as she said it was the best hair dryer she has ever used. Every morning, upon exiting the elevator, a hotel attendant was there to greet you and help you with any requests. When it was raining one morning, the attendant immediately ran to grab a couple of umbrellas before we set out for the day. The hotel is connected to the Otemachi subway station and Tokyo station. Unfortunately, it does require a lot of walking underground to reach the subway but you are at least sheltered when it rains. You pass the hotel's underground arcade on your way to the subway and there are several restaurants, Tully's coffee, the hotel's own pastry shop, and a 7-11. The hotel provides free bottled water and coffee in the room everyday but it was nice and convenient to be able to pick up drinks and snacks. The pastries and desserts were delicious but somewhat pricy at the hotel pastry shop. The hotel rooms all have unobstructed views of the city of the Imperial Gardens. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed sitting on the balcony every morning drinking coffee from the Nespresso machine and looking out at the view. It was great to be able to walk across the street and stroll through the Imperial gardens. The only downside to this hotel besides the long walk to the subway trains is that it is a business oriented hotel. The majority of the clientele are business people but I did see a few families. However, our family of 4 including a 13 year old and 8 year old always felt welcomed by the staff and they were always very attentive to our needs. We did witness a family with a crying child that was asked to move to another part of the lobby as the hotel was receiving a large party of high level government officials. That father was angry but I felt it was appropriate as there were other places in the lobby to calm the child and not make a scene. Overall, it was a wonderful 4 night stay and my family cannot wait to return.

Admittedly, this hotel is luxurious with its balcony in room 2301 especially when I stay on June 12 until June 13, 2018, however:1. Ordinary reception service.2. And the unfriendly officers and / or hotel staff when my daughter and my wife were told to step aside roughly as my child drank milk in the lobby in front of the restaurant for breakfast, a loud reprimand under the pretense of hotel rules, never informed to consumers, and wherever there is no writing forbidden to eat and drink, and the result of that incident is my child crying,In the event of number 2 above, I did see that many people in tidy suits like there are high officials will be present at around 9 am.So when the incident above, we feel to be a less appreciated guest when an important official comes.I believe luxury without polite behaviour is useless.Maybe you should learn from one of the hotels in Kyoto that I also stay there during my holiday in Japan.Thank you

It’s my first time here, and I love it!Room size is decent with all the amenities. The shower and bath tub are awesome with the right level of pressure. King size bed in my case and what a great night slew when you master switch off— it’s like peach black. You forget it’s day time.Oh and this a nice surprise, they give out warm eye masks for you before your nap time! So awesome! The palace is literally next to the imperial garden, so you get this beautiful zen view, and feeling.The gym is fantastic too. All the latest gadgets, including a blood pressure and wellness machine. Wish I’d used it... next time.On the first day, I ordered in steak. Perfect size and taste. It’s so close to the Tokyo Statin - which I had only discovered on my last day there is so much to shop and Eat there!!Next time....

The staff is the worst. This hotel has a bad odor. The hallways have a musky smell. They charge you too use the pool. It's in a good location, but so are several other hotels. I would stay at any other hotel other than this one.

We booked the Tower Buildings. It took at least 10-15 minutes from check in counter to your room. If you like 1950s hotel, you will like it. The room is small. Not much service offered. The spa is in a hotel room.

We stayed 3 nights. Ideally situated, central and close to Tokyo railway station. Fantastic helpful staff, roomy comfortable rooms, the best comfortable bed. Our room had a balcony with views of the city and palace gardens. We loved it.
user_name:
Ian P
City of Greater Geelong, Australia

review_body: We stayed in a king room with a view of the Imperial Palace gardens. The public spaces are beautifully designed. Breakfast outside by the little canal was a treat every morning. The neighborhood is busy but offset from the visual chaos of areas like Shinjuku, Shibuya, etc. We had an issue with housekeeping involving an embarrassing personal care product left on our bedside table - it wasn't ours. Obviously housekeeping found it while cleaning and thought it belonged to us. This means they didn't thoroughly clean before we checked in, since the item was left after the first day. Housekeeping left us an apology and small gift, which we really appreciated. I'm sure it was an innocent mistake that led to an awkward situation. I'm an Unlimited Member of LHW and was surprised we weren't upgraded. The room was a bit angled, making it hard to enjoy the view. All that said, It's a lovely hotel with a warm staff and excellent restaurants.
user_name:
wholewideworld
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed in the Club Rooms - one smoking and one non smoking. Their extraction systems must be very good as there was no hint of smoke inside or out of the smoking room. We had a balcony with great views across to the Imperial Gardens. The Club Lounge provided first class amenities and service. Great coffee and you could make your own juices from a range of fruits and vegetables. The chef's eggs benedict with either smoked salmon or ham was superb. The staff were wonderful.We made use of their lovely tea sets making green tea in the rooms. The little extras provided were appreciated. The bed was superb and the spacious walk-in shower with rain shower and hand-held shower was great.We ate in their Japanese Wadakura Restaurant, the only disappointment here. The room was a bit bare and bright, lacking atmosphere. The real let-down though was the food The servings were too small and prices high for what we had. We spent just under $AUD300 per couple with minimal drinks (a couple of beers and some sake) and could have eaten it all again. We stayed in 5 star hotels around Japan over our visit and ate at many restaurants and thought the food was sensational and plenty so this was the only poor value and experience for us.This aside, we highly recommend the club rooms at The Palace Hotel in Tokyo and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.

Loved this gorgeous hotel and kind, helpful staff. Stayed twice, initially in a king delux with a fab view over the palace. Great room, seating area and enormous bathroom. Second time we had a balcony room which was huge with magnificent views over Tokyo and the gardens. Complimentary WiFi and nespresso. The most Divine bed EVER!!. We didn’t eat at the hotel preferring to wander around and find local restaurants. V close to the train station. Would stay again

This was our fourth visit to Tokyo but first time to stay at The Palace Hotel. Location was great, just a few minutes taxi ride from the Tokyo train station. Check-in and check-out was very efficient. All the staff from the room service to the restaurant down to the bell desk were very friendly, helpful and efficient.The room itself was large, with a nice king size bed, a small dining table, a separate writing desk. Bathroom was spacious with a separate shower and bath tub. All standard amenities were provided. The also have turn down service in the evening which is great.We ordered dinner through room service on our first night and the food was delicious and appropriately priced.Breakfast spread was really good and the quality of the food was also good.All in all a great stay.

How can you describe heavenly? The Palace Hotel in Tokyo, that's how! I have stayed at many fine hotels all over the world, and found and this is right up there with the best of them. It has a beautiful location, and, best of all, balconies overlooking the palace. We were not supposed to stay in Japan for 2 weeks, but the first day in Japan, while in a Kyoto hotel, I slipped and severely damaged my foot. I was ready to go right home, so we took a train to Tokyo. Once at the airport,I thought I had flown all this distance, so why not stay. The wonderful ladies at the AA counter helped us cancel flights, make new ones, and allowed us to use their phones to re book the Palace.

We stayed at Palace for a week. We chose this hotel as it was near Tokyo Station and within easy reach coming from Haneda. From here we could almost go to any place in the country.The hotel itself was super, with all the 5 star facilities demanded after you have paid this much. The room is very comfy, ours faces the palace and what a view! The room itself was very well appointed and toiletries galore, very good quality and I did not need to use my own toiletries. The shower was wonderful, so strong and heat settings just right all the time. Housekeeping came twice daily and always replaced and added a lot of things like the Nespresso coffees, tea, toiletries, towels etc. They even provided warm eye masks for you to fall asleep in. Quite a nice touch!Breakfast on Floor 19 (executive floor) was simple but was very good. I loved the slow juicer that was provided and the blueberries and I was not missing my daily dose of anti oxidants at all. Hi tea was again simple but very good quality as was the cocktail hours.All in all, a fantastic place to stay. I would return to stay here if I come again.One more thing, I love the aroma fragrance in the hallways. Absolutely filled up all your senses. Pls keep that one up!There were plenty of good food near to the hotel and one did not need to travel far to get great stuff to eat.

Let me start by saying that Japan is all round amazing! I have traveled fairly extensively and I think I have found my new favourite destination. Tokyo is an extremely busy city with a lot of high end shopping. Not really my thing but wow - what an experience. The Palace Hotel was mind blowing. Due to reasons that were in no way related to the hotel, I had to change rooms each night over 4 nights. So I got to see a range of views offered from the hotel rooms. All of them simply amazing. I was so excited to be able to go to room each night after work. It was a joy to walk into the hotel and be greeted by warm staff who while they went above and beyond in their service, seemed truly genuine in every word and action. I felt like this big fancy hotel was my home because of the beautiful staff that took such wonderful care of me and my colleagues. I can not thank them enough. Food was amazing. Rooms amazing. Service amazing. Location amazing. We walked into Ginza. Had a short taxi ride to Shibuya ans also Asakusa and Harajuku. I personally enjoyed Asakusa the most as it had a more cultural element rather than just shopping. I absolutely can not wait to go back. Arigato.

I stayed at the Palace on a business trip to Tokyo and absolutely loved this hotel. The rooms are very large, luxurious and are serviced several times a day. The turn down service is the best I've ever experienced with Palace sleeping wear laid out, bath salts ready, the weather forecast printed and left on your bedside table and all the lighting just perfect. I stayed in a room on the top floor with a balcony overlooking the Palace gardens which had an amazing view - would highly recommend asking for one of these rooms.The hotel staff are exceptional - anticipating every need in a warm way. Everything in the hotel feels effortless- which is a sign of incredible staff.The gym facilities in the hotel are the best I've ever seen - not only do they have first class equipment but the view while you're running on the treadmill is stunning overlooking the gardens. The location is great - very close to Ginza and there are a lot of good restaurants nearby. This is a really special hotel and if I'm in Tokyo again I would certainly stay here.

It is my first time in Tokyo and I believe that staying at the Palace Hotel made this vacation so memorable. The hotel staff is superb. They are very attentive and when I say attentive it is attentive even to the most minute detail. I cant praise this hotel enough.
user_name:
jmrmd
New York City, New York

review_body: Simply put, one of the finest hotel experiences we've had. The Palace Hotel does it all right. Couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in Tokyo. Location is idea. Hotel decor combines the "old" and the new seamlessly. The Hotel Staff -- everyone -- from bell staff to lounge staff, from concierge to restaurant servers -- are there to take care of your every need, almost before you think of it. In an era of the new "boutiques" and staying at people's private homes/apartments, The Palace reminds you of why you stay at a hotel in the first place. Truly memorable. Hated to leave this morning; glad we get to return this weekend.
user_name:
amanwarren
New York City, New York

review_body: I think the title of my review pretty much sums it up. The hotel itself is very nice, if a bit dated. The staff are really friendly and helpful. It’s also centrally located. The unfortunate thing is, it’s located near an ambulance station toward one end of the hotel, and near a major construction site with VERY LOUD work that goes on until MIDNIGHT. It’s nearly impossible to find a room that is not affected by these two things (I tried - I looked at four different rooms) If screeching ambulances and loud drilling doesn’t bother you, then this could be a great option. It tends to be cheaper than other comparable places in the area. If you value your sleep (as I did, with a full two days of meetings ahead), maybe stay somewhere else, as a stay at the Palace could be quite frustrating.

We stayed at the PHT for 3 nights un may 2018 with m’y husband. Everything was perfect. Large room with an incredible view to the imperial palais, a wonderfull breakfast with delicious pancakes and a bar with amazing cocktails. Everything si doing to make your stay perfect. A real 5 stars Palace. I recommend

We have spent three nights in the hotel for my wife birthday. It was an amazing experience. Everything is perfect and the service is high level standards considering I travel quite a lot. We have dinner at the sushi restaurant which was the best sushi restaurant we ever seen. A sushi master was in charge of only two of us and we discovered what sushi really means. The bar and the evian spa are also amazing always with high level services...our prior first minister was there during the stay...which is another proof that this place is amazing.Thanks a lot .

This was my first time staying at the Palace Hotel. Peninsula, Ritz-Carlton, Mandarin Oriental, Aman and Shangri-La are considered among the top properties in Tokyo; however, I can definitely say that Palace Hotel deserves a place among the elite.It was recently refurbished (extensively, not a mere nip & tuck job), so it's squeaky clean. The decor is modern zen - simple yet tasteful and done in very high quality. Service is attentive and friendly; it's very polished... check-in staff, room service attendants and concierge were all top notch.We tried out the Club Deluxe Balcony room. As one of the entry level rooms, it's very spacious (45 square meters), along with a big bonus... a large balcony with sweeping views of Tokyo and its surrounds, as well as a partial view of the Imperial Palace grounds. It's definitely worth springing for a room with a balcony!Palace Hotel will almost certainly join the roster of Tokyo hotels I'll be staying at in the future. Highly recommended.

We stayed at the Palace Hotel to treat ourselves at the end of a long trip with many hotels. It is perfection. The service, especially the front desk and concierge is excellent. I had written the concierge in advance to request reservations and they were handled with great attention to accuracy and detail.The rooms are large, very well appointed and have lots of thoughtful amenities. The entire facility has an aura of calm and peacefulness. The lounge is lively with great drinks and terrific live jazz.Every detail is perfect.

Ask for a room on a high floor. Enjoy a drink or two at the bar and do not forget to try the patisserie.Very well located. Tube station nearby helpful. Excellent concierge service. Evian spa is also great.

We stayed at the Palace Hotel for four nights after our arrival in Japan. It was perhaps the nicest hotel - both in amenities and staff - that we have ever stayed at. The view of the Imperial Palace from our room was a welcome added plus.From the walks in the area that we took, the hotel seems to be in a largely business area (except for the Imperial Palace). We took one interesting walk on the street that fronts the hotel and ended up in a university area filled with guitar shops.The hotel also has easy access to a subway station beneath it. We took the subway from there to a baseball game at the Tokyo Dome and it was a straight ten minute shot.In the arcade under the hotel is a 7/11 and good bakery/sweets shop.We visited the hotel pool and fitness center and they looked excellent, but we did not have a chance to use them.All in all, a fabulous hotel and let me stress again it could not have a more helpful and pleasant staff.

I stayed at the amazing Palace Hotel for 2 nights on business in May. On arrival at 9 am they allowed me to check in 6 hours earlier for no extra charge which was a good start! All the staff seem to speak good English and always so helpful and polite. The room was modern, clean and spacious with all mod cons and a fabulous balcony overlooking the Imperial Palace Gardens! The bathroom (see photo) has a wonderful large window with a spectacular view. Free water in the room plus welcome fruit and chocolates. Well stocked mini bar too. I ate in the cafe bar on the ground floor overlooking the lake - great views, good service but expensive. I had 2 gin and tonics which came to £50! Wine is also pricy! But my overall experience was excellent and could not have been happier, well maybe if my wife came next time!

The Palace Hotel, Tokyo, is not rated Tokyo's number 1 hotel for no reason. We stayed at the hotel for six nights in April 2018 and I must say, it was one of the best hotels we've stayed at globally. For a Tokyo hotel, the room size was massive. Plenty of room for our 14 month old, who started walking during our holiday, to practice his newly acquired skill! The king size bed was big enough for the three of us to sleep comfortably on. We looked forward to the nespresso machine every evening after a busy day of exploring the city. The breakfast spread was inviting and delicious and we enjoyed eating a leisurely breakfast every morning in the sit out by the moat. The staff was ever so courteous and eager to help. The hotel is conveniently located about 8-10 minutes by foot from Tokyo station and right in front of the imperial palace. Needless to say, we will be staying here whenever we are in Tokyo.

One of the best hotels we’ve ever stayed in worldwide. Decor and environment are top notch, you will feel like a million bucks the moment you step in the lobby: the furniture, artwork and floral arrangements are total Japanese modern luxe. It even smells nice!You will feel even better after you experience their amazing service. If traveling without kids, the in-house Japanese and French restaurants (on the 3rd or 6th floor) looked really nice. If with kids, at least sneak out for a drink at the lounge/bar (next to the French restaurant) - one of the best Martini’s I’ve ever had.Rooms are spacious, comfortable and (to my knowledge) all feature great views of the cityscape or palace grounds.Right next to Imperial Palace, Marunouchi district and Tokyo Station. Can’t say it enough, the service is truly first class!

My wife and I traveled to Tokyo for a long weekend to go on a food pilgrimage throughout the city. We picked the Palace Hotel because of its central location and strong reputation for providing flawless hospitality. We were thrilled to find ourselves in such a tranquil environment overlooking the spectacular views of the palace grounds.There service at the hotel was second to none. All of the staff greeted us by our names soon after checking in. The concierge was kind enough to assemble an information packet with all of the details needed to carry out our itinerary. My wife spent months researching the best places to eat for various types of japanese cuisine. She worked with the concierge over the 6 weeks leading up to our trip to plan an unforgettable itinerary of Tokyo’s best restaurants. This entailed contacting 15+ restuarants to get us into the best places at the best times. Our trip wouldn’t have been as memorable if it weren’t for all their hard work. We can’t wait to return to Tokyo and without a doubt, you will find us staying at the Palace Hotel!
user_name:
Newlyweds0715
New York City, New York

review_body: An overall perfect Hotel. Love actin was perfect. Hotel amenities and service were over the top. Breakfast buffet was exceptional. Overall service as terrific...front desk, bell staff, room service..room was spotless made up perfectly and turn down impeccable.

The most amazing hotel room i have ever stayed in. The view was insane and the location perfect, near tokyo station and the emperors palace. Close by shops and restaurants. The staff were incredibly polite and helpful. Shuttle bus from hotel to airport provided.

Impossible to find fault with this well-designed and magnificently presented hotel which enjoys a sensational location, close to the Ginza and Palace Gardens. Best of both worlds. I would strongly recommend against asking for the Concierge recommendations on restaurants. I received two recommendations, both for extremely expensive "Michelin Star" restaurants. There are thousands of Michelin Star restaurants in Tokyo, or that's how it seems to me and, frankly, my best eating experiences came from Level 10 of the Tokyo building in the Ginza and at the Japanese Restaurant inside the Palace Hotel where the service in the Tempura section was elegant and the food, delicious and graciously prepared. Clearly, the chef here sharpens his knife once a day' his knife being his partner. I strongly recommend the Evian Spa. Enjoy your visit. Tokyo is a FANTASTIC city. Spotlessly clean and superbly presented. Few people speak English to go prepared with a little Japanese out of courtesy and practise your sign language. I had a little to say at reception at the Palace, not sure I was understood. Housekeeping, EXCELLENT. FRONT DOOR welcome, very good. Jan Lindrum

Second visit to Tokyo this time with our 3 kids (16, 14 and 9) and we decided on The Palace. (I had stayed at the Peninsula last time, but this would have been too expensive for our family this trip).I had not heard of the Palace until I started researching 5-star hotels on Trip Advisor. We decided to book because I liked the location near the Imperial Palace, we could get connecting rooms, there was a metro stop connected to the hotel, the breakfast was supposed to be phenomenal and although not cheap, the value seemed good for a 5 star hotel. I will tell you all of these things hold true! We all loved the hotel, it's beautiful modern design and the top-notch service provided by each and every employee. The breakfast buffet next to the beautiful surroundings of the palace moat was the highlight of each day! It was fun to see the Japanese wedding parties on the property and the lovely Japanese people coming and going. You could tell this hotel was loved by not just the tourists. I will also mention the gym was great and had everything for a great workout including foam rollers. We will always remember our wonderful trip to Japan and our stay at The Palace Hotel.

The Palace otel in Tokyo Marunouchi lives p to all its five starts! From the room quality, to all the amenities; Nesspresso machines and pods, comfortable and usable slippers provided daily, room service, restaurants, bars, and etc. It is located right across from the Imperial Palace and beautiful views of the moat and the cherry blossoms in full bloom. Everything about the hotel is first class. It is five star rated and lives up to the five star rating.This hotel is also near the subway and train stations.

A fine hotel with the highest standards of service, very well appointed rooms and a good ambience. Thoroughly recommended.There is also a good selection of restaurants, with the hotel being particularly good for breakfast meetings.

We stayed for two nights at this Leading Hotels of the World. As the name suggests it is located close to the Imperial Palace and Gardens, well situated for Tokyo Station and many of the metro lines. The room was large and well appointed with a bathroom/shower and separate toilet. It also had a large balcony looking out over part of the gardens. Breakfast was both Japanese and continental style buffet with a good selection of food. Staff were efficient and friendly. The concierge team were largely good making sound recommendations for dinner and sightseeing suggestions. The hotel seemed largely geared for business purposes and somewhat more rigid than we would expect from a luxury hotel. It would not be our first choice if returning to Tokyo.

This was our second visit to the Palace hotel as we enjoyed our first visit so much.As we arrived early our room wasn't ready ,but our luggage was kept securely while we visited a temple and Tokyo tower and other places of interest nearby.There is a wide choice for your breakfast and we also had two delicious dinners in the dining room. Harry the restaurant manager was very welcoming as he remembered us from our last visit.We found all the staff very friendly and helpful.Most could speak English.We returned for lunch on our last day which was very good.A great hotel well worth a visit if you are in Tokyo.

The Palace is a historic property within the Imperial Palace Grounds that has been remodeled to project modern Japan at its best. Besides being a gorgeous facility, the staff is completely befitting of a 5 star hotel. The concierge was extremely helpful and made some reservations within Tokyo for us. The wait staff in the lobby dining facilities went out of their way to make sure we could eat at a reasonable time. We also had access to the 19th level lounge where the polite staff almost looked uneasy if you poured your own coffee. They also let me -the night owl- linger late at night while my family slept. The rooms are gorgeous with well appointed bathrooms opening to the main room (you can also close them off using blinds). The double beds are on the small side but they seem to be standard for Tokyo. Rooms were completely insulated from each other and I never heard another guest. It has a pool for guests located in the Evian Spa. My biggest complaint about this property is that children under 15 cannot swim outside the hours of 9-5. I understand if the kids are rude or disruptive, but the constricted hours made it very hard for my respectful 10 year old to enjoy the pool whilst we were also trying to sightsee in the city. It is an easy 5-10 minute walk from Tokyo Station and 15 minutes to Ginza. It overlooks the Imperial Palace and Gardens. The hotel is filled with beautiful art tastefully curated.

From the moment that the valet sprints to your taxi to greet you it’s clear this place is pretty special. The check-in process was efficient and very friendly. We have a room with a balcony and a fabulous view over gardens, some of the moat around the Imperial Palace and also down to Tokyo Station. Breakfast was faultless. They have thought of pretty much everything and their hiring/training must be handled with great rigour because all the staff are so helpful and friendly.

A must for all travelers who like a top quality chic hotel. I am staying in room 1021 it has an amazing sweeping balcony. The view day and night is breathtaking. The room is high tec everything you could wish for at the press of a button. 2 TVs lounge area and bedroom area. The bathroom amazing separate toilet and separate shower and bath.Fresh toweling coats everyday I have never had the luxury of that. The breakfast just the best everything you could want at the highest quality of food. The service goes above and beyond. Just book and enjoy

The rooms were very good. Clean, big enough for Japan and the bathroom was actually larger than expected. The room is well prepare and they give you details everyday. It is located next to the Imperial palace compound, so the view is nice and if you like jogging is great around it. Under the hotel you can connect with the subway system and can actually have access to stores, places to eat, convinient stores, etc.The breakfast was a bit limited on options for my taste as well as the food at their "Grand Kitchen" was not that good. I still highly recommend the hotel as an option in Tokyo.

We arrived very early in the morning to Japan and did not want an early check-in. Wanted to hit the ground running and they made everything possible, sending us out in the right direction to see the sights of Tokyo. Gorgeous views overlooking the Palace Grounds during Sakura. Breakfast was delicious for our very happy children.

We were on a Japan tour in a group of 13 and were booked in here by our agent. Couldn't have been better. perfect location, spacious without seeming like a barn, very well furnished. Excellent room and bathroom; great selection of restaurants, with an excellent breakfast, and most of all superb staff and service. Nothing was too much trouble, and everything went like clockwork. We would stay here again - and we were here four days.

What an amazing property in the center of Tokyo. My room was incredible. The service was excellent. Do your best to get a balcony room as the views are excellent and the balcony is an amazing amenity of the room.The fitness center is nice. Make sure to check out the bar facing the palace grounds on level 6 for a cocktail. Can’t recommend a hotel much more than this as far as the property itself goes.One piece of advice though: I may be in the minority here, but sometimes I don’t formally check out at hotels and just depart on my final day (if the hotel has my credit card, there are no charges to review, etc.). During this stay, we left around 10 on check out day to go do some sight seeing and left our bags with the concierge. We were cutting our train close and I told the concierge guy that I’d check out later in the day when we returned from our sight seeing. When we got back around 7 pm, I went to formally check out mainly to get a copy of my invoice, and they informed me that I had been charged with another nights stay because I “hadn’t checked out on time.” This wasn’t a trivial addition to the cost of the bill. I debated the point briefly with the front desk staff, and after a few minutes a manager came out and said they would remove the charge, but advised me not to do the same again on another stay. I thought this whole situation was a bit odd and it put me off slightly. RECOMMENDATION here - make sure you formally check out, on time, or you may get charged with another nights stay.

We treated ourselves to four nights at the Palace Hotel Tokyo at the end of a busy, 2-week family trip around Japan and were not disappointed. The hotel’s location is superb and the view from our balcony over the Imperial Palace gardens really was something special.This is a slick, highly-professional 5-star hotel. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, breakfast was excellent and service was of the highest standard throughout. We’re very happy to strongly recommend this excellent property.

Our stay at the Palace Hotel was disappointing. - After having stayed in an other high end place in Tokyo we were expecting much more at the Palace Hotel. It is just another large high end international hotel. - Unfortunately the Palace Hotel got stuck in the past even though it has been rebuilt only a few years back.Rooms are just ok. - Given the price paid per night the value for money you get is too low. Only positive thing about the room was the view over the park.Friendliness of staff, lobby area and breakfast (outside upon the pond) are the positive impressions we are leaving home with.

This hotel is the epitome of service and class. Everything was perfectly and tastefully delivered. The hotel has been recently refurbished and the rooms look refresh and well appointed. If you can I would highly recommend an upgrade to club rooms, access to the club lounge more than makes up for the price difference. Most importantly, this hotel is perfectly located with a view of the imperial palace and a short walk from the Tokyo Station. Biggest bonus are the staff; smart, efficient and welcoming. Ms Sakura in the Club Lounge was phenomenal ( thank you!)

This was our second family holiday to Japan and we decided this time to stay at the Palace because of its high ratings and great reviews. We were not disappointed, the hotel is immaculate throughout and the rooms were so comfortable and luxurious. Location is a short walk from Tokyo station and it's near a lot of restaurants nearby too in the large malls. Although the hotel is in a quiet area it was so easy to get around. The breakfast was a huge spread and I especially loved the fresh juice selections and the volvic water. A special shout out to the Sri Lankan fellow named Harry in the breakfast team, his service was impeccable and he always made us feel welcome and ensured our young child was well taken care of. A real gem in their team! I also loved the Royal Bar where I was to be found every night for a few (too many) nightcaps. Again the service, quality and attention to detail was second to none. Highly recommend this hotel, you will not be disappointed on any level!!

One of the most beautiful & perfectly serviced hotels I've been to, thoroughly recommend this stunning hotel! From the moment you arrive, the reception, the service, the lounge areas, the restaurant, the bars, the rooms.....I was not disappointed onceThe perfect hotel in the perfect position to explore everything from the Imperial Palace opposite, to town, to restaurants, this is spot on

Palace Hotel Tokyo is a very nice hotel with beautiful views, balcony and an excellent concierge. Hotel is located next to the Imperial Palace and walking distance to train station and Ginza. Highly recommended.

One of the best in Tokyo.For me, what distinguished this hotel from the others of the same caliber were the small touches found throughout our stay: from the chocolate covered peanuts to the the warm eye masks at turn down service....the little treats just made the trip that much more special. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone who don't mind splurging a bit for a comfortable and luxurious stay.

I recently stayed here for two wonderful nights. This is a beautiful modern hotel which maintains the best of Japanese traditional service which you find in grand Japanese hotels.Pros:- Modern and spacious rooms, lovely view of the Imperial garden- Just a beautifully designed hotel all around. Felt grand yet modern- First class service throughout- Excellent location with subway downstairs and a short walk to Tokyo station. Super convenient if coming in from Narita express - love the mask provided at turn down service - awesome shower pressureCons:- If I had to be picky I would say the window in our room was quite small so room felt a bit dark.- We had King Deluxe room. It would be nice to have some type of lounge seating or sofa.

This may be a go-to hotel in Tokyo for me, granted no new hotels to try open. Since its renewal opening five years ago, the hotel still looks in great condition and service continues to be excellent. I love that the hotel is in an open area overlooking a park and the rooms get great light. I had an interesting-shaped room with a W-shaped balcony. Breakfast buffet is a nice way to start the day. There are a lot of food stations and all of it is very good, especially the fresh fruit and juices. It's an easy stroll to the Palace gardens and Tokyo Station. Currently a new building is going up across the way from hotel; construction noise occurs Mon-Sat. Many rooms overlooking the palace (west side of building) have a limited view because of metal dividers, but these rooms are very quiet. It's nice to see trees and water outside from the lobby in contrast to many hotels that are all up in the sky.

With stunning Japanese heritage history, you’ll always get a great organizing view from here where it locates next to the Palace(こうきょ). Near to the Tokyo Station, and it’s about 20km JPY6,500-7,100 by taxi from HND Airport. I do enjoy the stay in Palace Hotel Tokyo.You’ll get all you expect an international premium 5star hotel is in here. The 3-nights are one of the most pleasant accommodation experience of mine in Japan. Thank you very much, Palace Hotel Tokyo!

Splendid hotel in every way. We had spacious rooms with balconies overlooking the Imperial Palace gardens The view from the gym encourages that extra bit of effort. Wide range of top quality eating options - the sushi we had was as good as I've ever tasted. location is superb - the hotel even has an entrance to Otomachi underground in the lobby - very useful if it rains as hard as it did during our visit.The best we've stayed in in Tokyo.

I picked this hotel as it was closest to finish line for the Tokyo Marathon. In all, it came with all the superb additional experiences from staying at this hotel. 1. As mentioned, closest to finish line the new route Tokyo Marathon (2018)2. So close to the Tokyo Station, it has underground path to the station directly from the hotel. Convenient for so many things. For one, all the restaurants under the Tokyo Station, include the Ramen Street with variety of ramen houses. Second, from the train to Narita Airport. Underground to the major subways. 3. The restaurant is convenient for setting up meeting and appointment as it is close to major train stations. 4. Across the street from the Imperial Palace for jogging circling the palace. Exactly 5km. 5. Very nice hospitality team. Received simple juice bottles (wrapped with ribbons) and nice card for welcoming back from the marathon run.6. Stunning gym and pool. In short, definitely will come back to the hotel. Such gracious hospitality that you hardly find in any other country.

Without a doubt, this is the best hotel in Tokyo! Staff is incredibly friendly, polite and helpful.My room was very spacious. It overlooked the skyline of Tokyo and had a glimpse of the imperial palace which is next door of the hotel.Large bathroom with separate bath tub and shower. I loved the bathroom amenities and the special bath salt which was provided every day during turn down.Breakfast was wonderful with lots of choices. Both European and Asian style breakfast was an option. The hotel even offers an outside terrace where you can have breakfast with views of the original old moats of the palace gardens.The hotel has an underground shopping gallery with shops ranging from a supermarket to designer clothes. It furthermore offers direct access to the Tokyo Subway system.Location wise the hotel is perfect too. Easy access to Tokyo’s subway making it really easy to explore the city. For sure I will be back soon!

I have had an incredible stay at the Palace Hotel in Tokyo. We stayed for only two days, unfortunately. We were very surprised about what a perfect hotel it is. We had access to the Club (floor 19) and it was wonderful. The staff at the Club was perfection, they even noticed what kind of sugar I liked in my coffee and brought it every time. We also had breakfast at the restaurant downstairs. Buffett style and everything was delicious. The evian spa is wonderful and I got a great massage. I will be back, for sure. Perfection at all levels.

The hotel was highly recommended by at college and absolutely lived up to my very high expectation. Close to Tokyo central station and the empirial gardens. A perfect base for exploring Tokyo and enjoy the helpful staff

I just returned from a short vacation in Tokyo. I was there to run the Tokyo Marathon and my two daughters, ages 10 and 13, came along. We absolutely loved our stay in the Palace Hotel. The rooms are beautiful and very well equipped. We had a room with a balcony and a view of the park and the Imperial Palace. Well worth any extra price. My girls were able to watch me finish the marathon from the balcony! The service was so amazing! The concierges at the Club lounge helped me find an Italian restaurant the night before the marathon and make a reservation (Il Ponentino in Giza —delicious!!). They helped me plan my days. They helped me understand the metro system and showed me the best way to get to the marathon start. After I finished the marathon, there was a beautiful plate of chocolates and fruit with a note of congratulations in my room. The concierges at the lobby were also very helpful all of the time. The breakfast was delicious. If you want to have the best possible visit in Tokyo, stay here.

My husband and I have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental and Peninsula hotel on previous stays in Tokyo - both were exceptional.The Palace however was another level up. Perhaps less intimate as the hotel is larger, it was nonetheless a beautiful place to stay. Furnishings including art were tastefully curated and the views of the Imperial Palace gardens are nothing short of incredible. We stayed in a corner suite on the right hand side of the building as you face it on the 18th floor, which had views of mount Fuji.Service was well polished and both the concierge and the bell captain looked after our every need throughout the stay. We had access to the executive lounge which affords lovely views of the city for evening cocktails. A great selection of drinks.Breakfast was in the Grand Kitchen which catered for every international taste.The Evian Spa was somewhat limited and there were costs for using some facilities, but the gym and pool were very good with friendly staff throughout.A nice turndown service in the evening with a face mask on our bed overnight and cotton pyjamas should we wish to wear them.Definitely one of our favourite hotel stays!

Stayed for a couple nights for business. Efficient check in and out. Rooms were thoughtfully well equipped and therefore convenient for the business traveler. Strong water pressure, mouth wash, etc. Not super luxurious but decently renovated. Good location.Didn’t get to check out any restaurants within the hotel as this was a quick in and out visit. However, interaction with the bell desk, front desk, housekeeping, guest services, and other hotel employees were all positive.Would recommend the Palace to any discerning business traveler.

I had the pleasure of staying in this hotel as part of a larger trip to Asia (my first). This was my favorite stop and much of that is due to this hotel. The service was impeccable. Someone would meet you in the lobby or the hotel and call ahead to the desk or the valet to let them know you were coming. So your car would be pulling up as you exited the doors. The room was very nice. I was on the top floor with a balcony and had a good view of the actual palace as well as what I understand was Mount Fuji. I told my wife this was the one place in Asia I’d love to go back. Overall an absolutely fantastic place.

I recently had the great pleasure of staying at the Palace Hotel for 4 nights during my very first trip to Tokyo. Believe the reviews - this is truly an outstanding hotel with 5 star luxury accommodations and service. The Rooms:- immaculate, spacious, beautifully appointed and, with a balcony, the views are spectacular;- gorgeous art-deco mini-bar, replete with Japanese whiskey, mandarin juice and flatware;- turndown service includes comfy pajamas, new slippers nightly, an eye mask that miraculously heats up upon opening, full ice bucket, 3 water bottles and a weather card for tomorrow;- best hotel hairdryer ever.The Restaurants: - beautiful suite of Japanese restaurants - kaiseki, sushi, teppanyaki, and tempura - we had the pleasure of dining at the kaiseki and sushi restaurants, where the omakase was the best we've ever had;- additional restaurants include French, Chinese and western all-day dining, where an impressive breakfast buffet is available (along with a la carte items);- for drinks, there is an inviting lobby lounge and a separate, swanky, dim-lit bar;- not that you need to leave the hotel, but there is also a nice selection of shops and cafes in the basement arcade. The Service:- every single member of the staff is professional and courteous;- no matter the request, whether something needed to be taken care of in, or delivered to, the room, someone showed up within minutes;- after asking if there is a business center (there is not, surprisingly), and letting them know that I needed to use a computer, a laptop was waiting in my room when I returned from the day (it didn't work, but that is another story);- after asking whether they have disposable cutlery and napkins for a picnic, sets were immediately sent up;- after losing a glove on the Palace grounds, the concierge, Natsumi, promptly called the garden officials (who located the glove) and arranged to send it back to me in New York with a lovely note (she even sent me the tracking number). Bottom line, I would move into the Palace Hotel in a heartbeat if I could. It is simply sublime and luxurious, in all the right ways - both grand and understated.

Everything about this hotel is jut right, perfect, convenient and pleasant. I would definitely go again next time I am in Tokyo.The location is great, being very central, 5min away from Tokyo station, and with a nice view over the imperial gardens.The service is fantastic. A special thanks to the concierge desk who proved extremely helpful when we needed to make and amend restaurant reservations in town.The rooms are very polished, and quite spacious for Tokyo. The spa and pool area is delightful, especially after a long day spent visiting the city.

Just returned from a four night stay. I have been coming here maybe twice a year since 2014. I notice a few long time staff and a few new faces. The excellent service standard is always maintained. I have been to the club lounge, and you certainly get personalized service there. What really shocked me was a surprise welcome back from Hamano san at the Grand Kitchen during my visit for breakfast. I last stayed Sept. 2017. That restaurant must have thousands of visitors a year. This wonderful surprise, prompted me to write this third review of this hotel.I sometimes feel like going back to the Shangrila, because of the location , next to Tokyo station. The Palace ,besides being a great five star hotel., is also an excellent value. I was at the JR Tower Hotel Nikko Sapporo, before the Palace. That hotel cost about the same and the room was much smaller.Everything works perfectly for me at the Palace. The staff, room, breakfast, even the packing box I buy every trip is just the right size. When I first came into my room and the porter asked if I needed anything I said no, because I already knew about all the amenities and truly felt like I came back to my home in Tokyo.

We spent 4 nights at this property.This hotel is all you expect and more.The location is a 5-10 minute walk to Tokyo Station, which means you can get anywhere in Tokyo as well as many parts of Japan by Skinkansen. You can actually walk all the way to the station underground's due to the interconnecting tunnels, which are great and well sign posted.The rooms are huge, with great lighting and a hug bathroom. We had a room with a view of the Palace and back into the city. Amazing views, both day and night. If you have access to the club on the top floor, the view is even better and you can even see Mt Fuji on a clear day.The spa and pool is amazing well worth visit.Then there is the service - nothing is too much trouble. Everything we needed was attended too.The breakfast buffet is awesome - try it out if you get the chance.The only downside I can see to this hotel, is that it is in a relatively quiet/business location. There are no shiny lights or happening bars close by. If that is what you want, maybe this is not the place for you.We highly recommend this propertyPros- Location - proximity to Tokyo Station and thus the rest of Tokyo- Room Size - Large by any standards- Service - everything you expect from a 5 star and moreCons- Quiet location if you want a party scene

Truly exceptional. A notch above the Mandarin Oriental, we think, which is impressive. Book the CLUB LEVEL for an immersive experience. ENTRYA bit confusing, as you must walk down a long, large hallway past elevator banks to the reception area. It seems as if you are in a public space belonging to the entire building that is not necessarily just the hotel. Staff seemed more like they were guarding the hotel than welcoming guests, but perhaps that is due to the nature of the location? We found someone at the front desk who was very fluent in English and who made our initial entry better. The reception area is large, grand and very well furnished, but quite busy. (We were getting in a bit late, and just off of much travel across Japan on the bullet train, so our experience might be colored by that a bit.)ROOMWe booked this property from a train station THAT day, and could only get a 'standard' room for our first night, which was just a bit small, but luxurious. CLUB DELUXE ROOMWe were able to move to a Club Deluxe room w/ 2 double beds the very next afternoon ~$650 + ~$120 taxes, and worth every penny, without hesitation. Hotel staff moved our luggage and belongings while we were out -well done. 485 sqft, free WiFi (no lag, no drops in service), refrigerator, well stocked mini bar, small Nespresso-type machine, tea & electric kettle, luxury robes, slippers, even pajamas for the whole family, Egyptian cotton high thread count beddings. The rooms are generously sized with copious storage, utterly silent and completely dark with the blackout drapes, and have expansive city & park views -a restful retreat. Everything -furnishings, fixtures, decor, amenities- is top of the line, exceptional quality. THE CLUBThe Club itself sets this property apart even more. It is a tranquil sanctuary from travels and busy outings. You are warmly, quietly greeted at the entry desk, shown to the lounge or dining area, and brought whatever food, beverage, etc., you would like. There is also a gorgeous outdoor terrace with quiet, lush seating areas and breathtaking views. Floor to ceiling windows in the lounge and dining areas provide stunning, expansive views of the city, and park. The decor is clean, yet luxurious, with highest quality furnishings. Service is exceptional -never intrusive, but you never want for anything, an empty dish never lingers on your table, and expectations are exceeded. They make happy hour very congenial, and we had great conversations with other guests who became dining companions and friends.The club food was unexpectedly exceptional -absolutely fine dining, while ensconced in the quiet comfort of the club, with highly personalized service. The presentation, selection, and taste, all exceeding expectations. Individual items were artwork, and were displayed together artfully, with an array of choices, never crowded, yet never lacking -the sign of an exceptional staff working quietly in the background. See our pics of sushi, appetizers, breakfast items, etc. ... and this is just a small sampling of what is offered. The cocktail hour selection was also excellent with an array of choices from quality spirits.SPA / FITNESS AREAWe did not use the spa, as we spent our time experiencing the city and being with our children. We did all use the pool, which is quite large, with a spacious incorporated jetted hot tub and a shallow/ shelf area. There is a generous tiled deck with plenty of lounges, a pool side shower to rinse off, soaring ceilings, and floor to ceiling, wall to wall windows giving a breathtaking views of the city from two sides.LOCATIONThe property is located right in the city, a few blocks from the bullet train station (in a very, very upscale retail mall), and directly across from the Imperial Palace Gardens and Edo Castle. From the hotel, you merely walk to the corner, cross the street and walk down the entrance to the Palace grounds. The Gardens are expansive with endless gorgeous and varied venues, as well as the castle remains. It is immaculately clean and manicured, you are surrounded in natural beauty, and there are some wonderful views. A must-see. OUR PICTURESWe were busy enjoying ourselves and experiencing the hotel and city, so our pictures don't do the Palace Hotel justice, but it will give you some idea of this incredible property.

This place is incredible. The balconies are all private and the rooms are spacious, bigger than what you expect in the US and definitely surprising compared to other lodging options in Japan. The restaurants on site are popular and delicious but make sure you reserve ahead because we tried to walk in our first day and they were all booked solid. Rooms have great toiletries the tub is cool with the automatic shades and blinds. The shower has great water pressure and water heats up almost immediately. Their gym is impeccable and like a full sized gym with a squat rack and a much larger range of weights than 25lbs. The pool is an infinity edge and the employees there really look out for you. Concierge is patient and can get you a reservation anywhere you want. Never an issue to get a taxi and the location is ideal from Tokyo station (you can walk) and you can see the Imperial Palace and Ginko row and the Tokyo skyline. Connection the the subway is downstairs underground so you technically don’t ever have to go outside to hop onto the train. Don’t worry, you don’t hear the train noises in the hotel; we were on the 8th floor. If you want cheaper food go to the basement. More reasonably priced food with no frills but delicious.

Classy, consistent hotel. Great central venue, near to the Royal Palace (which with a 5k wall round it is great to jog round to get over the jet lag.Expensive, but quality, spacious rooms, plus great customer service as I would expect in Tokyo. I tend to only have breakfast in the hotel, which is always of the highest quality.Lovely spa & facilities.There really isn’t anything I’d change, apart from introducing a loyalty programme as I often stay there!
