We had previously stayed at the Palace Hotel a year ago and gave it a 5 star review.Unfortunately the stay had a few hiccups which would have resulted in 3 stars but we told the management of our discontent and they reacted swiftly.The room was as usual beautiful and well appointed. It is great.The concierge service is one of the best in the world and they got us truly amazing reservations.We want to also acknowledge the team the Bar Privé who are amazing. Kanesaka was excellent as well. The let down was how the lounge, the dining room and breakfast area were managed during the stay. I will not get into the details as the hotel kindly acknowledged our complaints and did us good. In short summary, during the holiday period everything felt chaotic and slightly mis-managed with managers that preferred sticking to rules rather than using logic.We will stay again at the Palace Hotel and hope to rate them again with 5 stars.

We just returned from a family trip to Japan. We stayed at the Palace Hotel Tokyo on two different occasions. It was a wonderful experience. Given the jet lag, we had service needs at all hours of the night. They provided service with a smile whenever we needed it. Everyone in the hotel, from the maid and wait staff to the concierge, provided exceptional service to us. And i forgot to mention that the rooms were new, beautiful, with great views and a balcony. My only negative is that the restaurants are very expensive.

We booked this through Amex fine hotels and only knew that it was a good location. We were so happy at this lovely hotel. Wonderful concierge and staff that make our trip memorable. We are "hotel snobs" and this one was great. We were fortunate to get upgraded, had a balcony, beautiful view and the club level. Service was exceptional throughout the hotel, we used the spa, restaurants, and lovely rooms. We got there after a 15 hour flight and the staff made us feel so welcome with champagne and made arrangements for the spa that night. I would definitely stay there again.

Everything about this hotel is amazing. We stayed here last year and liked it and decided to return this year. Before arrival - We made reservations directly with the hotel and it was prompt and seamless. We asked the hotel concierge to help with restaurant reservations; concierge was responsive, warm and friendly, gave great recommendations and we were totally impressed when they sent us an itinerary of our stay with restaurant booking details (date, time, restaurant address, contact person’s name etc). They also kindly handled our late changes without any fuss.On arrival - other than the usual professional check-in expected of a world class 5-star hotel, they had printed a copy of our itinerary and maps of the restaurant showing where they are and how to get there. We were most impressed.Hotel hardware - Hotel is contemporary, and elegantly and tastefully furnished. The lobby is impressive and the room size decent. As with most Japanese hotels, the room (including linen and towels etc) is clean. The grounds around (palace and moat) lend an air of peace and tranquility, and a touch of Japanese tradition. The view from the room is great - lots of greenery and the palace grounds. I’ve also stayed at the Peninsula Tokyo and Mandarin Oriental Tokyo in the last year, both are fantastic hotels but I find the Palace better (except the room size in Mandarin Oriental is better).Hotel staff and service - Superb service throughout. Every evening when you return to the hotel, you are greeted warmly by hotel staff. When you approach reception staff for anything, they are obliging and helpful. Our flight was late at night and we left our luggage with the hotel and asked if we could use their shower facilities before heading out to the airport and they Said yes without hesitation. Staffed by predominantly Japanese who speak fluent English, you will have no difficulty communicating with hotel staff and getting anything you need.This is one of the best hotels I’ve stayed at. I would highly recommend it.

This hotel is awesome. I called them a month prior and asked for them to get me reservations to hard to get restaurants and attractions, since some do not take reservations from outside of Japan. (Jiro's, Ginza Kojyu, and Studio Ghibli musuem). They were so accommodating and made the reservation process so EASY! I arrived the check in process was incredibly easy and when I got to the room I felt at home. There is something to be said about coming back to your room, drawing a bath with the luxury bath salts provided, sitting in the tub putting on the tub TV to sumo wrestling in surround sound and having a nice cold Asahi from the minibar, after a long day of exploring Tokyo. The balcony is beautiful to watch the busy city at night while enjoying matcha covered wasabi peas. The robe and slippers are the ultimate in comfort and I HIGHLY recommend going to the Royal Bar and enjoying some 40 year Tawny Port. Delightful stay and I look forward to staying with my friends at The Palace again.

This hotel has been on my top list for sometime and to be able to stay here was a bliss. Located right next to the Emperor's Palace, the area and the view is pure stunning. The staff were very professional and helpful. They very tentative.The room was amazing, size, sleep, decoration, and the view from the balcony was beyond words to describe. Price was very steep, since it cost us around USD1000/ night, but it worth every penny. To sum it up, its so far the best hotel i ever experienced in Japan (exclude Ryokan) and will definitely come back.

Though Palace Hotel is in the Heart of Tokyo both historically, culturally and next to the Japan's Imperial Palace, the atmosphere was intimate, warm and gracious. The room was exquisitely balanced with light and dark, privacy and expansive views of the old moats and grounds surrounding the Imperial Palace. Though the rooms and aesthetics are top notch, the real assets are the staff and management of the hotel who never lacked for gracious assistance and attentiveness. Good as It Gets.

I love the palace hotel Tokyo.It is very clean, has spacious rooms and very attentive employees with great service. I have stayed here three times and was never disappointed.My highlights:- the location is great. The Tokyo station is in walking distance and also for leisure this is a perfect location.- they have an outstanding western and Asian breakfast buffet which you can join on a beautiful outside terrace with view of Tokyo palace

Great hotel, Modern and luxurious. Service is excellent. Good location for Tokyo station. Certainly would stay here again. Chose a deluxe room with a balcony. Great views over the city. Situated adjacent to the imperial palace gardens.

Booked into hotel for 4 days from 10/12 - 14/12.Arrived on a Sunday Night,used a mini bus service (green tomato),very good .The trip from Narito airport is almost 1 1/2 hours,so if you don't have much luggage use the train.The hotel is about 10 mins walk.If you have a map it is easy to find.The service in the Hotel was excellent,couldn't fault it and the rooms were big and luxurious.We had a slight problem with our booking,not the hotels fault the booking agent made the mistake.The staff couldn't do enough to help us.There are a few restaurants in the Hotel and access to a shops and restaurants in the arcade underneath the hotel.There is also a small 7/11 and coffee shop as well as access to an ATM.The hotel is located adjacent to the imperial Palace gardens and is well located to public transport and some shopsoverall I would give this Hotel 10/10.It is not cheap but worth every cent.Would certainly stay here again

My friend and I were in Tokyo for a week and we chose to stay at the Palace Hotel. I booked through AMEX and was promised a rather large room. When we check in around 6pm, we were given a small room. The only thing that was large was the balcony. The room was not nice and smelled of stale smoke so I went out in the hall to see if I could smell smoke, but realised that only my room smelled like smoke. I called the reception to see if they could change a room for us, the receptionist who answered was unhelpful and doubted what I said. She wanted me to check if there was smoke in the hall too or only in the room. I did not know what the point was but did as I was told and told her that only my room smelled of smoke. She then told me there were no rooms available and that I could leave the hotel if I was not pleased. Shocking service. She did not even offer to bring a air freshener into the room. As I was in a hurry to dinner, I told my secretary to deal with this and to find me another room at the same hotel while I was at dinner. But my secretary told me that the receptionist told me to move out instead since they could not come with with a room. I was horrified at this and decided to move out. I would not recommend this hotel to anymore. I cannot believe that the Palace hotel, with such a history in Tokyo would offer such sub standard service. I am terribly disappointed and will never stay at this hotel again. And to add, I was offered a coupon of $150 to be used at the hotel, but was hotel that I would not be able to use it at almost all the restaurants at the hotel. The only staff who were doing their job was the lady at concierge. She was the most courteous and was able to assist my restaurant bookings. A the end of the day, I moved to the Ritz Carlton Hotel, offered a suite of 1200 square feet at the same rate as a 500 square feet at the Palace hotel.

I stayed at the hotel with my wife end of November, We had a deluxe room with balcony overlooking the imperial gardens.The room was so beautiful with a very good size and arrangement.the bed was so comfy,the bathroom and shower had an outstanding water pressure with top notch amenities. View from balcony was breathtaking.Location was ideal for visiting Tokyo.Breakfast was so delicious with lots of varieties.The thing that makes this hotel outstanding is the service from the staff who work there. You really feel welcome and they exceed all standards.Many thanks to the hotel palace who made out trip to Tokyo so remarkable.

This hotel was the best hotel I have ever stayed in. They thought of everything and provided every accessory that you could need. The service was friendly and very professional. Would not hesitate to recommend- great in all aspects. Near a station with lots of restaurants underneath the hotel. A very special place to stay.

i stay here typically a few nights 3-4 times per year when visiting japan for business. this is by all means the perfect city hotel. not cheap, but absolutely top in every aspect! great rooms, great views. you can actually see mount fuji from the room balcony on a clear day! also food is fantastic! highly recommended!

I don’t think I have ever stayed in such a nice hotel. Rooms are extremely spacious and contain all amenities needed with the exception of an iron and ironing board, however housekeeping will bring this to your room. Breakfast in the main floor restaurant has lots of choice and terrace seating. Meeting and conference rooms are excellent. All staff are attentive, extremely helpful and go above and beyond expectations. Checkin and checkout was expedient. We used this hotel for meetings and a seminar as well as rooms for 11 travellers - an excellent experience and I will recommend this hotel be used when we return next year. If any improvements need to be mentioned it would be that the carpets are so plush that rolling your luggage on them is very difficult. The gym is spacious and has many pieces of equipment as well as water and towels. Wifi is excellent in all areas of the hotel.

A very quick review - One of our favorite hotes ever. We have been to a few.... upgrade to the CLUB LOUNGE if you can. The breakfast is amazing and happy hour wines are awesome. The service and overall exoerience is one for the books. I can not wait to go back!

This place is out of this world. Great service, beautiful view at night. Just one big problem is that they did not speak Well English and We did not know Japanese at all, a little difficult to communicate, Everything else is AMAZING

We stayed 2 times in the hotel, in between the stays we have visited also Four Seasons Kyoto and I have to say that we were very lucky to stay in 2 unbelievable hotels.Let me start with the location of Palace hotel – It is the best! 1-1-1 Maranouchi address!!! Right next to the Imperial Gardens, with astonishing view of the area – you can see the photos are just like Photoshop’d and most of them are made with just my Samsung Galaxy S8 !We stayed in 2 different Deluxe Rooms with Balcony and let me tell you in this place YOU MUST HAVE A BALCONY ROOM! Simply do not think it over; there is no such feeling to go out on the balcony with this magnificent view, in this magnificent city!!! It is worth every single cent!Our two rooms were in the 12th and 14th floor and the view was different as the layout of the rooms but both were absolutely great.Modern facilities incl electric curtains, automatic toilet (Japanese high standard) multiple electrical sockets suitable for our European plugs and so on.Free Wi-Fi with very fast Internet service is available throughout the hotel. Not a single fault.The bathroom is fantastic and very big for Japanese standards, great amenities and the water pressure was just astonishing.In the evening you have free water, free eye mask that are heating and help you sleep and they had the most amazing slippers.What was the most important thing however is the SERVICE. The service here was even better than the service in some Four Seasons hotels. The concierges they were so brilliant that I cannot describe and rate them high enough. They booked me everything in advance. First class train tickets for the Shinkansen to Kyoto, all the restaurants I needed. They prepared and printed every program, provided you with every brochure. They are so polite that you cannot imagine. Smile, Smile and again Smile after smile. What a lovely people (as Japanese in generally are) .Bell service, waiters everything is running like a Swiss Watch (or Japanese Watch). Taxis are always available outside the hotel.Location over the Otemachi station and Tokyo station is really close within walking distance as well (few blocks away). Dining option are countless in the area and Ginza is only 1000 Yen away by Taxi.We have dined in the hotel in GO Grill (teppanyaki) the food and service is brilliant and also at SUSHI KANESAKA where at lunch the value is fantastic. This is one really top sushi places in Tokyo. We had breakfast every morning in the Grand Kitchen and is also very, very good. We had fantastic autumn weather and you could have breakfast outside and the good Japanese hosts were providing heating, so you could be comfortable.End of October and Beginning of November is really top season in Japan and we could see for 10 days how the color of the trees was changing.In 10 days we had only one rainy day so the weather was absolutely gorgeous. We use to go shopping in Ginza and Maranouchi, visited Robot restaurant (that is crazy place you can not find anywhere in the world), Shibuya for kid toys, Shinjuku for shopping also, Akihabra for electronics, Ginza and Maranouchi for clothing. We visit some great teppanyaki places in Tokyo such as Biftek Kawamura Ginza (one of the best steak restaurants in the world, Misono Ginza Kobe beef teppanyaki and so on. I have to recommend to every European visitor in Japan to hire from SoftBank Pocket Wi-Fi and for less than 10USD a day we had absolutely unlimited fast (4G) Internet for 4 devices during our entire stay in Japan. The devices even work in the Shinkansen all the way from Tokyo to Kyoto. Japan has Amazing quality of mobile communications at very affordable price. You can take your pocket Wi-Fi directly from the Soft Bank kiosk at the airport and also return in the same way. Another must for traveller to Japan is the PASMO card that we also purchased at Haneda airport. Basically this is one of those Japanese inventions that are super smart you can travel with that on all the trains and you pay on very low price. You can pay with the Pasmo in taxis, shops and so on, so the just like debit card. We are really happy with that service as well.We also went to numerous bars in Tokyo as we were enjoying with my wife our time without kids and I have to say the bar on the 6th floor Lounge Bar Privé is probably one of the best in the city. Superb service and drinks. We like this bar better than the Aman bar (which was disappointment for us) and better than the famous Peters bar (at Peninsula Tokyo hotel).All in all we had absolutely amazing time in Tokyo. We stayed in one of the best hotels, we had such a lovely weather and this was one great break for us from our kids. We felt like singles again and the Palace Hotel Tokyo surely was immense part of our incredible journey in Japan.

Stayed for three nights for mostly business. We were told we did receive the AMX fine hotel upgrade, but the room seemed to be a standard king room (perhaps that we were on the Palace grounds side of the hotel was considered the upgrade). The room was fine in all regards, though the bathroom is not really very separated from the bedroom - so a bit noisy if one person is up to shower, etc. All that said, what is memorable here is the service. It was just as good as it could possibly be. The concierge was great, front desk team was wonderful. The hotel is in a commercial district - but so convenient to Tokyo Station and cabs are plentiful - so where ever you want to go in the area is easy to do.

Spent 4 days and 5 nights at Palace. At first I worried that this would be another big extravagant hotel. It IS large but that really pales with the tone of the place. Staff is very friendly and wonderfully efficient. The location is what is amazing. The views of the Imperial Gardens and the grand streets make this quite the location. You are also close to food, neighborhood shopping (neighborhoods being the closest way to describe a collection of office buildings). The food is not especially great but who needs it when all of Tokyo awaits. Worth the splurge.

I guarantee that the view is cooler than any other 5 star hotel in Tokyo. I visited with family because it was my father 's birthday. I was so happy to decorate the Happy Bulls Daybeds, and everything about the facilities and transportation was really satisfactory. I can not see the swan living in the garden there ^^ ;;; There is a price range, and it is often difficult, but I want to visit again. Very satisfied.

Hotel is very modern, got outstanding service, food and the location is within walking from the Palace (5 mins max). Have stay here for almost 2 weeks, just love the restaurants within, the food and service makes it exceptional great that I didn't want to go outside looking for other restaurants. The Staff were extremely helpful and polite. Definitely would stay here again.
user_name:
AST1127
New York City, New York

review_body: Our 5 day stay here was superlative in every way. First there are many many efficient helpful staff and they make Fodors a ‘Fodors Choice” call. Albany the Grand Kitchen operations manager is a marathoner who runs his wait staff like the athlete he is: no wasted motion and moves smartly but is not hurried and stops to chat about Tokyo. Then there is Maki the concierge supervisor who got us perfect Kabuki tickets and instructed the cabbie for us leaving nothing to chance. She also got us our Shinkansen tickets saving us hours. Location? Right next to the pedestrian entrance to the Imperial Gardens and on top of a subway line. Location for us was top. The building is five years old third one on this site. The most modern up to date in every sense making it #1 for comfort all time for us. Wi-Fi: perfect. Fitness and big pool both complementary. No ‘nickel and diming “ American style; no staff with that constant everpresent annoying hand out palm up American style. What a relaxed pleasure to have been here.

The hotel is a shining example of how good hotels can be. The place is beautifully designed, smells great, looks fantastic. The levels of cleanliness and customer service are exceptional. The hotel room itself is a lovely size, beautifully lit, features some wonderful features – the waterfall shower is phenomenal; the Japanese toilet was a real novelty for a westerner; the control panel for the electronic blinds and curtains, lighting control etc was a nice touch; the in room tea service and bar was beautiful; the bed large and very comfortable; the air conditioning was excellent; the nightly turn-down service a nice touch with freshly pressed PJ’s and a hot eye mask again a nice touch. The room in short was perfect.The service from the staff was exemplary throughout my staff, from the reception team, concierge, cleaners, spa staff, restaurant staff – all finely trained and dedicated to the job in hand. The food at breakfast and the dining room again flawless. The bar offered a fantastic place to unwind, with excellent waiting staff who remembered your order from the night before, again flawless.All in all, a fantastic hotel, excellent staff and amongst the best hotel stays I have enjoyed worldwide. I would love to return and would highly recommend to anyone visiting Tokyo.

Great hotel and location. Arrived at 8am having flown in overnight. Spa offered as facility to shower and freshen up which was great.Room very spacious - three of us staying - three beds in total. Loads of space. Lovely view over the water - great balcony. Breakfast excellent especially for fussy eater 14 year old son.Modern bathroom - separate shower and bath. Never saw cleaning staff -very subtle.Quiet - great nights sleep!

One of the best hotels that I've every stayed in. Beautifully furnished and generously-sized rooms; professional, helpful and friendly staff; great location for visits to the Imperial Palace and Tokyo station. Can't find anything to fault!

It is really difficult to stay in the Palace Hotel without admitting the attention to detail, the comfort of the rooms and the public spaces, the location right in the heart of Tokyo and - above all - the ‘nothing is too difficult’ attitude of every single member of staff that we met. Courtesy abounds, and after a long flight from the UK, it was just the place to get over the jet-lag. There is an excellent pool, a breakfast of champions and wonderful direct access to the Tokyo metro system - straight from the hotel lobby. The staff on the front desk and the concierge could not have been more helpful or charming. The view from our balcony of the Palace moat and gardens was lovely, and kept some of the city noise at arm’s length. All in all, this is a wonderful place to stay and I would recommend it to anyone wanting a relaxing haven in the middle of Tokyo.

One of the best hotels we have stayed. Very centrally located in Chiyoda District. Hotel location is directly adjacent to the Imperial Garden. One of the few hotels where rooms have balconies, a great thing enjoying the view of this fantastic city. The club lounge offers breakfast, drinks and snacks during the day. The ladies of the club lounge are very very kind and efficient. Every member of staff makes it a joy to stay at this hotel. A nice bar and several first class restaurants make this a top hotel.

This was our third stay at the Palace Hotel in the last couple of years and while the hotel has lovely rooms overlooking the Imperial Gardens, especially the ones with balconies, each stay has been marred by somewhat odd service occurrences.During our first stay, we were initially refused turndown by housekeeping, but this may have been a misunderstanding (see first review).During stay number two, a half full bottle of red wine (set on the nightstand with cork pushed in to reseal it, i.e. not in the trash bin) went missing from the room. When inquired, it was promptly returned along with a bowl of chocolates (as an apology but with no clear explanation as to why the bottle was taken in the first place). During our most recent stay, it was an aggressive interaction with the concierge that gave us pause. We had a reservation at a sushi bar (one we had been to a couple of times). We asked if we could make it earlier due to a work call scheduled for a little over any hour into our reservation. The concierge informed us that the reservation could not be moved earlier and that the meal would run two hours. Given that the cancellation fee was the full price of the meal ($300 for 2 persons), we decided we would go and at least eat an hour’s worth of food. However, the concierge “insisted” that we cancel (and incur the fee) if we could not stay the full two hours, because it would be “disrespectful” to the other guests. We ignored this, went to the restaurant a little early and finished our meal in time to make the call. Indeed, as we suspected, there were guests who were there before/after us and left before/after us. I don’t think anyone even noticed when we left. When we returned to our room, a letter from the concierge iterating her insistence that we cancel the reservation if we could not stay the full two hours was slipped placed under our door. It’s unfortunate given that otherwise our experience with the concierge staff was fine. We would still recommend the Palace and would probably stay there again (if only for the balcony rooms). However, I may be more inclined now to try out the Shangri-La or go back to the Peninsula, which is also on the Imperial Gardens and is more conveniently located to Ginza.Other things to note:1. The gym is 24 hours. The pool is nice.2. There is outdoor dining in the Grand Kitchen3. The hotel is connected to the Otemachi subway station4. We had a "club" room for one of our stays. If you are a tourist, we didn't really think it was worth paying extra for.
user_name:
MiffysPillowBook
New York City, New York

review_body: The exceptional staff at this hotel really made our stay perfect. The hotel itself is in a fabulous location and our room overlooked the palace gardens. Rooms are superb and offer every amenity you could wish for. One very minor negative was that we were staying post cruise and arriving mid-morning at the hotel to be advised that rooms were not available until 3pm meant that we could not fully appreciate the relaxing environment in our room until later in the day and experience everything the hotel had to offer. The concierge had managed to pre-book tickets for the Sumo wrestling on our behalf which we very much appreciated so instead of waiting at the hotel for our room to become available we headed off early to the Grand Sumo Tournament. The concierge also gave us comprehensive directions so that we could navigate our way on the public transport system to get to the Sumo stadium. Certainly from our experience would want to stay at this hotel when we visit Tokyo again. First class!

We had a vey lovely stay at The Palace Hotel. The hotel embrace its Japanese culture and all the staff shower you with their warm hospitality. A huge kudos to the concierge team - lead by Ms Mayako and her Assistant Mr. Kazushi. Whenever we need their help they were prompt, professional and provide thoughtful suggestions. If you have work with concierge in other hotels you have probably noticed that they only have you "standard answers". The Palace Hotel team - Do not.....Highly recommended and wed will be back.

This hotel is a must for stays in Tokyo. Walking distance to Imperial Gardens with views of same. First class appointments throughout. Walking distance to the Ginza district for restaurants and shopping.The room is spacious and modern, service is 5 star from entrance through turn down and checkout, restaurants are excellent, there are shops within the complex and there is a fabulous bar with a view. Easy access to subway and short taxi rides to Roppongi District.

A wonderful view of the Palace Gardens. This hotel has a bustling, youthful energy as you enter the lobby. The rooms are nice and modern. The restaurant was delicious. Lounge are relaxed with a great view!

This is one of the best and well known hotels in Tokyo, with a great views of the palace gardens and next to the vast shopping, restaurants and clubs offered by Ginza district. I first stayed here 20 years ago on business and wanted to enjoy the hotel with my wife for the start of our cruise holiday. It is basically impossible to rate it more highly. The hotel has been completely refurbished and its large rooms are the height of luxury (of course, being Tokyo, the toilet has a heated seat and had built in spray wash etc!). We had 2 excellent dinners in the hotel, particularly the teppanyaki meal). This is a large, busy and now, very chic hotel which is perfect to experience polite, friendly and ultra modern Tokyo city.

Everything about this hotel is outstanding. It is the combination of the best of western and Japanese hospitalities - from the design of the rooms to the staff - this is by far one of the very best hotel I've stayed in, and one that I'll always return to. The staff notices the smallest details- we decided to walk from Tokyo Station to the hotel (10 mins max), one of them spotted us when we walked in through the back door and immediately got another staff to help with our bags. After the check in process etc, we missed the official afternoon tea time by 10 mins, and when we called the bar to see if it is still feasible, they made it happened. Some context of why this is a big deal- Japan is very strict with rules and they seldom make exceptions. We are super grateful as this was one of the most creative afternoon tea that we've ever had. The rooms are spacious and we had one with a balcony overlooking Hibiya park. The sleeping area is clearly separated from the bathroom and lounge area - it's subtly done. Simple and classy decor. Words cannot express the experience, would just encourage everyone to stay there!

This was our last leg of our holiday in Japan. We're just so pleased we chose this place. Everything was (almost perfect). Still, this place deserves 5 stars - aside from 'ho hum' breakfast, everything was wonderful. The view from our room was absolutely beautiful (facing the palace garden)! Beds were very clean and extremely comfortable and everything in the bathroom was super! We love Ginza and feel this is the perfect location with the underground just below us. There are restaurants and convenient stores just in the basement! Well worth it!

We've just spent 3 nights at The Palace Hotel and were very sorry to leave. The hotel is a haven of tranquility and calm, and is also a visual delight. The service was outstanding; faultless in fact. Our room on the 16th floor had spectacular views of Tokyo, looking over the Imperial Gardens, and beyond to the skyscrapers that twinkled in the dark. The highlight of the room was the bath which was situated in front of a huge window so that you could take a long, hot soak whilst gazing out at the views. Breakfast was a feast, so well worth including in your booking. We enjoyed drinks at the Royal Bar on our first evening. Intimate and cosy, with just the right level of lighting, and they do a mean Martini. On the second night we ate at Crown, their French Michelin-starred restaurant on the 4th floor. It was a special occasion, and they didn't disappoint. See my separate review if you're interested. For our final evening the concierge recommended a traditional Japanese Sushi restaurant which was simply perfect. All in all, I would highly recommend The Palace as a base from which to explore the delights of Tokyo. They just got everything right!

This hotel had it all from the outside curb appeal to the fantastic rooms and service. Wasn't disappointed one time. Gym was wonderful but also the location to run at the Imperial Palace Gardens was one for the memory books! Amazing massages and relaxing pool! Also when it came to suggestions the concierge never failed!

The hotel is located 10 minutes walk from Tokyo station and right in front of the imperial palace. I loved to run every morning around the palace with many fellow runners. Breakfast is ok, I was disappointed by the limited choice of Japanese food as I always enjoy trying that when in Japan.

Services are TOP notch as can be expected from such a 5star class hotel in Tokyo. The room was spacious and the view amazing. One of the best location in central business district of Tokyo that also houses all the amenities and some restaurants in the basement as well.My only gripe was the fact that they couldn't provide me with a Ling bed as requested, and I ended up alone with 2 queen beds . But, they did join the beds a bit and it wasn't half bad - still, given their tier (and price) it would have been nice to get a king size bed. Revisit likelihood - good, depending on availability.The ala carte room breakfast is to die for

Possibly the best hotel that I have ever stayed in. From the moment we arrived, service was top notch. We booked through American Express and were upgraded to Club Floor access. I'm not usually one to be concerned about the view from our room, but the view was spectacular and definitely enhanced our stay. We overlooked the gardens by the Imperial Palace. While taking a shower, I could look out at the gorgeous view. The room was probably good sized by Tokyo standards. It was well thought out and maximized the use of the space. The breakfast buffet was included in our reservation and it was one of the best I've experienced. Both Western and Asian options were plentiful. The person stationed by the bread & pastries will warm your selection in the oven by request. The subway station is accessed from the lobby and there are lovely shops on the way to the station. We were sad to leave after 4 nights. I would return to Tokyo, just so that I could stay there again!

I've stayed at many a hotels on work and on leisure - this one has to be up there with the best of them. Amazing new rooms... I had one with a balcony overlooking the Palace. Service is second to none. Their gym is perfect. Breakfast was more than adequate. The hotel was understated elegance.

A french restaurant in the heart of tokyo ..the meal was an experience .every course was exceptional . every dish was a piece of art .portion sizes are french which for me are excellent . wheelchair accessible .wouldnt recommend it for kids ..smart casual . amazing view .defintiely a restaurant to visit when you want to wow your guest .Waiters were super attentive ...i would give it a 20 out of 10 .a bit pricey but worth every yen paid for it .

Really impressed with the Palace Hotel! The property overlooks the imperial palace so you have unique views of the Tokyo skyline and its light and bright. You breakfast next to the moat and have roomy balconies which is unexpected in a city like Tokyo.The hotel has a classy contemporary style with great bars and restaurants which given the size of the hotel, surprising still felt personal and even boutique like.Service was faultless. Very friendly and always trying to assist.Would certainly choose to stay here again when we are next in Tokyo!

Stayed there for our last few nights before we flew home and could not fault this hotel. The rooms are spacious, and the balconies have been designed so that none of them are overlooked. We had wonderful views from our room. The facilities are lovely, with a great bar and restaurant.

I've now stayed in the Palace Hotel twice this year and both stays were amazing. Service levels are exceptional with particularly strong concierge team. Definitely worth paying the extra for a balcony room to enjoy the view. Breakfast, bar and gym are all excellent.
user_name:
TrufflesNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: My family and I stayed at the hotel on Sep.10 ~12 for 2 nights.Initially, I was astonished by the grandness of the awesome hotel when we just came out of Tokyo station. The approximation to the JR and Metro demonstrated its convenience for tourists. The clerks were polite and zealous when we checked in. The room was modern and terrific; when I asked for kid amenities, they prepared right away. All the amenities were thoroughly equipped. The view outside depends on the location of room. However, Imperial palace was next to the hotel ; seeing the scene was a pleasant experience. We enjoyed the breakfast in Grand Kitchen, with a view of river surrounding Imperial palace. The food was delicious and fresh although the variety of buffet was relatively limited. I really love this hotel; nevertheless, there was an incident during this accommodations. I left my glasses on the bed but I can't find it when I came back to the room. I thought it might be wrapped into the bed sheets when cleaning, so I informed the counter clerks and the on-duty clerk visited. They promised they would call the laundry on the next day. Since I planned to stay in Disney Sea hotel on the next day, I left my email address to the counter and hoped they would inform whether the glasses are found or crashed. Unexpectedly, I've got no answers even after I left Japan. Prolonged use of contact lens made my eyes dry and reddish. It was so inconsiderate as one of the top hotels in Tokyo. Honestly, I was disappointed at the way they dealt with this event. Anyway, Palace hotel Tokyo is still amazing, and I will consider staying in this hotel again if I want to find a hotel around Tokyo station.

Convenient location at walking distance to Tokyo station and the palace. The housekeeping and concierge services are second to none in Tokyo. Room is not the biggest ones but you can get enormous view from balcony. Highly recommended.

My husband and I stayed in this fabulous hotel for three days - the rooms are wonderful and see to the travelers every wish! The staff are attentive and charming - the position is extraordinary being situated right next to the imperial gardens so taking a leisurely walk or run is so convenient! The restaurants are a treat and the attention to detail and service are tops!

This is certainly a 5 star hotel and then some. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. The facilities and conference rooms are of the highest quality available in Tokyo. The price is very high so is not for every budget.

I stayed there early August. This is the first I stay after their full renovation. It is very convenient as the subway can connect to the basement of the hotel. However, the front door service can be improved. More smile and quicker action is needed. Fortuately I was upgraded to a higher floor. Get a very good view of the park besides. I will be back tomorrow and hopefully will get an upgrade to a higher floor. The breakfast is good. The bar is nice but is a bit smoky. It still allows guests to smoke.

If I could I would put 6 stars to this hotel. Spectacular hotel, very friendly staff, spacious rooms, good food, great installations, perfect and convenient location. Also they adapted to our necessities not once or twice but three times no problem! Very happy stay. If you can afford it just do it!
user_name:
julisalsa1976
New York City, New York

review_body: We loved the location and the views. We had issues with our booking and had to wait a few hours for the management to do the right thing this was really the only issue, it should have taken 5 minutes. The rooms are nice and light, breakfast outside was great and uncommon for Tokyo.

Had the teppenyaki in a room- enjoyed a night of grilled vegetables, fish , foie gras and wagyu. We ordered the basic set which is more than fulfilling. Love the ambiance and service. Will definitely go again.

wow, gorgeous hotel, first class service and amenities.From the warm welcome to the bartenders, everything was superb.King room with a balcony was great. Bed very comfortable, bathroom very big and rain shower head, wow!! the included breakfast was delicious. we didn't use the spa or gym but did squeeze in a 3 mile run around the imperial palace which is right next to the hotel.

I stayed here for two nights in one room with my two adult children. As others have written, the staff are incredibly helpful (with almost everyone bilingual in English). One thing I have not seen mentioned in other reviews are the luxurious features of the room. The bathroom has glass walls with electrically-controlled wooden blinds that raise up and down and tilt open and closed – so cool! The shower head is built into the ceiling and is 10” in diameter (think tropical rain forest). There’s a TV built into the bathroom mirror so that you can watch TV while taking a bath. The toilet has frosted glass doors. The curtain shades are electrically-controlled and move from ceiling to floor. The staff fills the ice bucket for you each day. The reading lamps are small lamps embedded in the ceiling. In summary, this hotel is the height of luxury – the type of hotel everyone can hopefully stay in at least once in their lives.

This was our favourite hotel during our visit to Japan. The staff were incredibly attentive and helpful, the room was amazing and very comfortable and the view over the park next to the palace was lovely. The buffet breakfast is outstanding and had an excellent variety of Japanese options as well as western. The only negative I have is that room service was obscenely expensive.

tokyo is very nice place . we love it so much. we like people and the system in evreything.we like all places we visited. we like the respect. cleaness.really we like everything..but its need alot of money

What a fantastic place to stay, the staff are all well trained and know how to please, what a delight and luxury when one of the restaurant staff remembers you like your breakfast omelette cooked with egg whites and no butter the rooms are very cool and have all mod cons and the toilets are quite something in design!

We had a wonderful stay at the Palace Hotel in Tokyo this June. My wife and our 4-year old daughter accompanied me on a business trip. The room was extremely comfortable, the staff very polite (you wouldn't expect any different in Japan) and always willing to help. From the checkin to checkout to booking to Airport Limousine bus...everything was a breeze. The only downside I'd say is that the food options were somewhat limited and do take a note that it is all extremely expensive.

I'd rate 5 stars on the following: Location - conveniently connected to Otemachi station, which is the major changing station for four subway lines. Walking to Tokyo station requires approximately 10 minutes. Taking a taxi to Tokyo station costs about 1000 yen. Customer Service - Impeccable service from front desk and restaurant staff. Rooms - Super clean with the best bathroom design I have seen. The shower pressure was impressive. General Area - Luxurious and grand Food - Lovely breakfast with a good selection of fresh food and beverage. I haven't tried the spa, pool and fitness center so I would leave other travelers to comment on that

We stayed at The Palace Hotel from 8th-10th July 2017 and liked this hotel very much. Our room was of a very good standard with a balcony and the hotel is modern. The breakfast area was very large with an excellent and comprehensive buffet and seating inside and outside. The hotel was also very convenient for getting round the city being above the Otemachi underground station and close to the Imperial Palace (disappointing - they don't show you it, just a few admin buildings and car parks). Tokyo is a great city, the people and staff were very courteous and friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

You have to go, great service, amazing room space, amenities are excellent. You have views to the imperial palace gardensThe bar has a super view. You have nearby some metro stations, and Tokyo station is about 2 blocks. Great room service as well

Joined the wedding party for a friend of mine here at Palace Hotel Tokyo, "Yamabuki Room" on the 4th floor. As expected, they provided us the finest services, wonderful foods and attentive services by well-trained staffs at their beautiful venue for the wedding party. Outstanding hotel from any point of view.

Personal check in and welcome tea is a nice touch. A few minutes after settling in my room someone brought up some welcome tea cakes. Nice size room for Asia or even for the USA. Great views from any window you can find. Staff friendly-formal always asking how they can help you. Excellent on-site restaurants and bars. The Palace Hotel Tokyo has reset my hotel bar pretty darn high....

I was in Tokyo for three days and decided to return to a hotel that I had last visited 20 years before, in its previous incarnation. A lot has happened to Tokyo 5 star hotels in the past 20 years, with brands like the Conrad, Grand Hyatt, Mandarin Oriental and Peninsula really raising the bar. The new Palace hotel does not disappoint. What could be more central than an address of 1-1-1 Marunouchi? Even the Emperor does not get that! I had been in Beijing beforehand and, while not wanting to sound churlish, they are way behind Japanese levels of hotelier training and hospitality. I was made to feel like I was coming home. You must visit this hotel on your next trip to Tokyo.

So the old hotel caught fire years ago & so they rebuilt the hotel a few years ago. This new Hotel is spacious & its rooms come with a contemporary design & they are lavishly furnished with high quality fittings from ceiling to floor. The rooms are very huge by any Tokyo Standard, & its in-House CABLE TV has the full compliments of all the English Channels unlike other Hotels in Japan. The view from the rooms are magnificent as the Hotel overlooks the Palace & its moat, so there is no blocking view. Service is impeccable, so there is nothing not to like there. The Hotel has a basement access to the Otemachi metro.

We almost dropped our jaws when we arrived at the hotel Palace Hotel Tokyo. Check in procedure was awesome and fantastic! During our stay we experienced royal treatment like they treated us as royal customers. Employees spirit was high and cheered us up to high spirit! Their creativity impressed us! Personalized toiletry and hygiene kit including bath salt, british brand’s botanic soap and herbal shampoo/shower gel left us memorable. We loved soaking in hot tub. Large balcony was very nice for our outdoor breakfast. Lunch buffet was unforgettable and creative! Palace Hotel Tokyo gave us high spirit with their positivity, spirit, mindfulness, and creativity in hospitality.
user_name:
BizVisitor
New York City, New York

review_body: Visited Tokyo for our family's summer holidays.We usually stay at hotels right in the middle of shopping areas for convenience. But what an experience Palace has given me I've really liked this hotel.For a start we had a balcony over looking the Emperor's Palace Gardens. Such a wide open green view was most welcoming to the usually cramped rooms and lack of view offered in many of the hotels in the middle of the shopping areas. Sure for those who find a 15 minute walk too much to shopping areas may not favor Palace' s location, but hey it's a holiday I got loads of time. We also rented bicycles from the hotel to ride around..... it was great and safe.... I never felt threatened by car users around me. As usually most drivers were courteous and took notice of us bikers. The rooms were well appointed and large by Tokyo standards. I would really recommend this hotel to others. For those who want to know the hotel is about 15 to 20 minutes walk to Ginza.

I have visited many countries and stayed in many hotels.I rate Palace hotel as the best of them.Situated opposite Royal Palace,palace hotel stands majestically.We had a family trip to Tokyo and our daughter-in-law insisted that we stay in Palace Hotel and made arrangements.The cleanliness is of very high order.The staff are courteous and very efficient.I enjoyed my stay.

Stellar service, beautiful rooms and facilities, and excellent location. My wife and I like to experience different hotels when we travel, but we will definitely go back to the Palace. All the staff seemed to learn our names, and treated us as if we were official dignitaries. It was an incredible experience that we will never forget.

Really good hotel with excellent service and rooms. Booked this through WhatAHotel which included very useful perks. Really nothing to criticize about our stay. Nice pool. Nice spa. Nice restaurants! If you have to nit pick, perhaps the buffet breakfast can have more variety.

I have been staying for a week in this hotel. Rooms are quite and large. I was lucky enough to have a nice view on the Imperial garden. Everything is clean and service is really perfect. Hotel staff thought about every small details to make your stay as perfect as possible. I will comeback!

We spent three nights in this lovely hotel and were sad to leave. The hotel is across the road from the gardens of the Imperial palace and both of our rooms had fabulous views of the skyline and wonderful balconies. The bedrooms are well appointed with clean modern lines and comfortable beds. The bathrooms are lovely, with natural light and separated toilets and shower facilities. We had coffee and team making facilities and free WiFi.The hotel has a lovely spa and fitness center and terrific dining facilities. Breakfast is taken on the main lobby floor and we ate outside overlooking the moat complete with swans. Very good buffet which was included in our room rate. The bar was very nice and we had a drink or two there on multiple occasions. Staff were friendly and efficient and overall it was hard to find any faults.

My 3rd trip to Tokyo on business but this is the first time I have stayed at the Palace Hotel. The hotel is amazing. Extremely clean, good size rooms, amazing customer service. I'd certainly try and book this hotel again next time I was in Tokyo on business.

Palace hotel has a direct bus from the airport, but the last bus left at 4 pm. We missed that bus, but there was another bus to Tokyo station. Palace hotel is easily accessible from Tokyo station, however directly beneath there is another station. The only reason we didn't take subway directly to that station from the airport was because it would require us to change lines at least twice. This would not be a problem if we were not carrying heavy suitcases, as some stations do not have an elevator. From Tokyo station it was a 20 min walk to Palace Hotel, but could have easily been less had it not been for our heavy suitcases. The checkin was quick. In the room, the mattresses were firm yet soft (definitely the best hotel mattress I've ever had the opportunity to sleep on!) and there were some complementary Japanese snacks and chocolates. The fruits were amazing, juicy and ripe. The bathroom was modern and large. There was an automated toilet, as most in Japan, and the shower had contemporary finish. The bathroom was furnished with marble. There were plenty of large mirrors and a handheld magnifying mirror. The amenities included a wooden hair brush, unlike the typical fragile plastic comb. We were on the 22nd floor (they had 23 floors) from which we could see moat of the Imperial palace. Despite being unable to see the actual palace, the view was serene. From the swimming pool, we could see some of the actual palace. The location of Palace Hotel is centric, walking distance from a few malls.

This hotel is truly heavenly, it has some very strong points which make it so. On the first night when my family and I woke up we were all well-rested thanks to the comfortable beds, they had firm and comfortable mattresses and nice pillows which felt new. Breakfast was simply phenomenal, there were fruit juices and milk which tasted very good and they also had a gluten-free section which rejoiced my gluten free family members. They also had eggs galore. Now to conclude this all I would like to give some tips/facts. • Try to get a room on a high floor 17-23• This hotel has an amazing view• It has a good location (near Imperial Palace and Tokyo Station)

Amazing hotel with impeccable service. Palace Hotel is located by the Imperial Palace, connected with Otemachi Station in the middle of Tokyo. The rooms are spacious, spa is incredible, and the breakfast (both buffet and the Japanese set) are delicious. The bed is heavenly and the bathroom is enormous for Tokyo standards. I would advise against the room service as you would definitely get better quality food for half the price if you're willing to walk 10 minutes from the hotel in the Kanda/Marunouchi area.

Contemporary look, huge room, ample use of dark wood and mirrors - it was a pleasure to stay here. We stayed on the 22nd floor with views of the water and the Imperial palace. The bathroom had a nice bath tub and a glass window opening into the room. This could be closed if wanted with wooden blinds. The shower was amazingly powerful. Everything looks new and unused. The mattress was firm unless many other hotels and had great sleep quality. There are nice touches like complementary chocolates and Japanese snacks. I once called in for extra drinking water and they got it for me in a nice paper bag. The balcony was good size too with 2 chairs and a table outside. The bar with a water boiler and tea/coffee closes up nicely into a white cabinet. The lobby area also has lots of glass looking into the water channel. The hotel was expensive but we would love to stay here again. It's walking distance (15min) from Tokyo station so if you miss the bus from the airport (that drops you off to the hotel) you can still come to Tokyo station and walk from there. The last bus from Haneda leaves at 1600. All in all - a beautiful hotel, great spacious rooms.

Only the fact that you are staying opposite the imperial palace and having this splendid view on it is per se an impressive pleasure.Directly connected with public transport having the possibility to jog around the palace is another good reason to stay in this wonderful hotel. The pool and fitness facilities are great the choice of different restaurants with an al fresco area is another asset of this hotel.the rooms are untypical you big and well equipped.The best asset is the staff working there. All of them are super nice, speak perfectly English and try there very best every single minute. From the guys opening the door of your car you are arriving with to those maximum special people working in the club lounge. They arrange everything for you, even before you know what you would like. They are so professional in what they are doing for you but so heartily too on the other hand. The ideal combination. I was treated like a god.The best ones were Konatsu Onuma and machiko Yanagawa. They are the primary reason for coming back to this special high level house.

Stayed there during Winter 2016. Superb hotel, clean and modern.The subway is underground with easy access.The morning breakfast buffet was outstanding, relaxed and very friendly.Evening cocktail lounge was a great experience as well.Loved Tokyo! What an amazing city, people and destination, can't wait to come back!

We stayed here for two nights and it was just amazing. All the staff are so polite and helpful. The room was very clean, spacious and quiet, with an amazing view of the Imperial Palace. Great breakfast buffet and so relaxing eating it out on the terrace. I can't wait to stay here again!
user_name:
Fiona S
Edinburgh, Scotland, United Kingdom

review_body: Palace Hotel Tokyo was extraordinary in every way for our three day visit. We had traveled to five countries and six cities in Asia and saved the best for last! Assumed after three weeks of travel, it would be advisable to stay in a luxury hotel. Even though, we booked a standard room, it was a far better choice than a suite at the same price in another hotel (having stayed at The Imperial Hotel previously), The location next to the Palace grounds put us in the classy section of Chiyoda with great shops, department stores, train station and beautiful walks. The restaurant and lounge were beautiful, relaxing, filled with interesting guests and excellent drinks and food. Our room was immaculate, loaded with technologies and the modern bath had more conveniences than any 5 star hotel we have stayed. The Palace was superb for us!

The Palace is as fine a hotel as you will find anywhere in the world. From location to amenities to staff it can't be beat in a visit to Tokyo. It is across the street from the Imperial Palace and a short cab ride from the Ginza.

My 3 night stay here was extremely pleasant. Spacious room, very clean, very courteous and attentive team - from doormen, check-in team, extremely helpful concierges and waiting persons. Sumptuous breakfast, good sushi and sashimi on 6th floor. Spa was great as well. Convivial Cigar Bar! Great location. Within walking distance of Ginza and everything else that matters in downtown Tokyo. Japanese friends were also very much taken up by the service of all at the hotel. I will certainly stay there again. Thank you very much to all of you at Palace Hotel for making my stay a very pleasant experience.

Great location by Emperor's Palace and Garden and about four blocks from main Tokyo subway and train station. I think nearly all the higher floors have great views of parts of the garden or downtown. Staff sets it apart. Impeccably polite and high quality service- among the best I've ever experienced. Several restaurants and bars with really good food. Highly recommend. Worth 5 stars for sure.

The Tokyo Palace Hotel has to be one of the very best city hotels anywhere. Everything about our 10 day stay was pretty faultless. The staff were all excellent and charming, the room was comfortable and perfectly serviced, the food at the restaurants was second to none. We've stayed at the Four Seasons Marounuchi and the Aman which are both excellent but maybe the Palace tops them both?

Luxurious, serene, impeccable service, great location, wonderful food.The room was very nice but having a balcony (extremely rare in Tokyo) with a view looking out over the Imperial Palace was just unbeatable!Our mornings consisted of sitting on a gorgeous covered patio that faced the moat of the Palace watching the swans while eating fantastic food. The service on the patio was impeccable but not stuffy. Our waiter most mornings was Marc and our visit to the Palace would not be the same without him. Then off to see Tokyo! We spent many evenings in the cozy bar off the lobby, sipping some of the best cocktails I've ever enjoyed. Ok, the only sort of con was the club level. We usually get club level to get away from crowds and long waits for tables in the mornings. This was never a problem in the Palace's main breakfast area so we ended up very rarely using the club level. The room is a bit cramped an little under air conditioned. I think it would be a good choice for business travel but not for families but the concierge at club level was excellent. Can't miss with this hotel. We loved it!

We had a few days before our return home and I decided to book somewhere luxurious. We were not disappointed. Our stay at The Palace Hotel was really lovely. We choose a balcony room, which had a great view. The staff were all lovely too. We were given a late check out, which was much appreciated. We enjoyed drinks at the Royal Bar on two occasions. All in all it was a really lovely stay. We eat at the sushi bar too. Without a doubt the most expensive sushi I have ever had, but a lovely experience.

I stayed in the Palace in February and loved it. Everything was perfect. Very nice and cozy. Outside it was chillng,so returning to this place was just fabulous. Only across the street from the imperial palace.don't forget to book online a palace tour(free of charge) to avoid long lines. The rooms were spacious and the bar had the best drinks in tokyo. Of course this comes at a steep price. Very pricey but worth it :)Enjoy.

This is a wonderful hotel. Great rooms that have thought of everything. The public spaces are very nice. Different bars to choose from. Restaurant in the hotel are good but expensive. There are a lot of great restaurants nearby. Breakfast was very good. The whole stay was very expensive; but it is a special place.

We stayed 7 nights in April. Room, breakfast, service, location are great, but so is the cost!One minus is lack of fresh air in the room - one cannot open a window. Another, the dinner in the lounge should be better.

Travelled here on business and brought my 14 yr old son. Location is very convenient to Tokyo Station and the lobby is pristine. Staff is amazingly attentive, even for Japanese standards. But what I really wanted to call out was the concierge. They managed a number of tours and activities for my son, and made him feel completely comfortable on his first trip to Japan. They were very communicative before and during our stay. Thank you Palace!!!

Rooms:Room is quite spacious, the bath is nice they give as well sakura bath powder, smells so good after the long day.Separated toilet and shower, Excellent amenities!But i think they should change the carpet, the colour looks dirty.Location:Just in front of the King's/Imperial Palace, and within walking distance around 700m just cross the lake to Marunouchi shopping and food. Transportation:Connected to Otomodachi station so it is much convinient for transportation.They have shuttle for a fee to both Narita and Haneda airport.The service was good, quite reliable and fast response in requests. Thou i was a little disappointed when they didn't get me my upgraded room as a member of the Leading world hotel. In words i'd say, Definitely will consider to stay when i visit Tokyo next time.

The Palace Hotel is potentially the best hotel in Tokyo. The location is unbeatable - in the central business district but with extensive views of the Palace, parks and waterways. Convenient but with a mere glance, serene.The ground floor is sublime with a spacious lounge that hosts live music at night, excellent restaurant with a moat side terrace, and a speakeasy bar for cigars and whisky. At current exchange rates, its good value for a world class hotel.The rooms are modern and spacious with all amenities, including very comfortable pyjamas and slippers (even for 3yo). The rooms with balconies are a must - to soak in the amazing view both during the day and at night.Service is amazing - which is what you expect for Japan but at the Palace, it felt less formal and more personal.This is a hotel you will certainly want to revisit.

first time in Japan, it's our first night but the staff is splendid, it's very relaxing, the fitness room is amazing, the amenities are plentiful, and the view is great. Food seems overpriced but that's expected at any five star hotel in any country so it's easy to find a nearby restaurant for much cheaper on yelp or TripAdvisor. Super excited for this trip!

Me and some friends went to Palace Hotel and we were amazed by room view! There was a view to Imperial Palace and Marunouchi (financial area). The hotel was newly rebuilt so it seems new and modern. It has big spaces like entrance, hotel lobby, restaurant... The restaurant has an amazing view to Imperial Palace and a perfect terrace to enjoy morning or afternoon tea!We opted for club lounge access but it was not worth it. On opposite of many club lounges, this one doesn't have good variety of food (the breakfast in the restaurant with all other guest is much better), there is only alcohol from 5pm to 8pm. I don't recommend to choose club access. Another thing we didn't like is that you have to pay to go for sauna and hot bath.

This very hotel is an elegance statement and its restaurant to par. Food is highest quality and presentation is very accurate, as well. Just few steps from the Imperial Palace gardens, also if not in the budget for the premium accomodation - like yours truly - I immensely enjoyed the stop. Domo arigato gozaimashita.

Centrally located in the heart Tokyo, it has big comfortable rooms, friendly staff and very prompt service. Only it doesn't have anything for children to do on a rainy day. Food has a lot of variety, good pricing but doesn't taste as good as it's presented A good place to stay in on the whole.

My husband and I just returned home from a several night stay at the Palace Hotel. The room was amazingly clean. Customer service was unbelievable from each hotel employee that we encountered. Every evening they do a turn down service. Three people from housekeeping came to our room to turn down the bed, change out dirty towels, and bring bottles of water, drinking glasses, and and ice bucket full of ice. They also put out Pajamas and slippers. It was a very nice touch. Most of the staff members were able to speak very good English and were all very polite and respectful at all times. The concierge staff were all very helpful with information, tours and dinner reservations. We had the breakfast buffet every morning. The food was fresh, good and kept fully stocked at all times. There was a good variety of many types of food. We had one dinner at the restaurant on the main level of the hotel. The food was very tasty. The area around the hotel is very walkable. I sat out on the balcony often and could see many people walking and running by the palace grounds across the street. Transportation is very easy. There are always many taxis at the front of the hotel. The metro station is a short walk from under the hotel. The concierge was very helpful with giving us maps and telling us which stops to use. We found the 7-11 under the hotel to be very wonderful too. We did a currency exchange at a machine there, and got some snacks for the room. The only thing that I felt could be improved would be more storage for clothing in the room. I do like to unpack and put my clothing in drawers. There was enough storage room for one, but not for both of us. My husband won and unpacked his clothes and I lived out of my suitcase. The closet did have enough room for my dresses and his suits. One other thing to note. The Wifi is amazingly fast. Overall, I was thoroughly impressed with almost all aspects of our stay at Palace Hotel. If I return to Tokyo in the future, I would definitely stay there again.

This is a wonderful new hotel just a few years old next door to the Imperial Palace East Gardens. A quieter location but very close to Ginza. Excellent rooms, views and service. Nice piano bar downstairs and a terrific outside restaurant for breakfast.
user_name:
Preston T
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here for a long weekend with a friend:-Balcony room is really worth the extra and the views into the city/palace/park is great and with some night breeze it's a great way to spend the evening-Extremely polite and informed staff, very attentive to details-the hotel is connected to Otemachi statio by underground walkway which is great, and also a mere 5-10min walk to Tokyo Station-The hotel pool is nice but however the Jacuzzi was a little bit cold (not warm enough)All in a one of the best hotels in the area (on par with the Peninsula in my view) and will definitely return!

Stayed here for five nights during Cherry Blossom time. The hotel is immaculate and very well staffed. It is located right near one of the main subway stations so access to all of the Tokyo Districts is very convenient. The concierge was very helpful prior to our trip with restaurant reservations. We emailed them and they sent us several recommendations. They then made the reservations for us. They were even able to get us into a six seat gourmet sushi restaurant. The restaurants in the hotel are outstanding too. We ate at the Grand Kitchen and the Japanese one, Wakadura. We upgraded to a junior suite and it was very large. The bathroom was clean and bright. It had one of the Japanese computer commodes that was unique to say the least. Our room faced the street and the Imperial Palace, however it was one of the quietest rooms ever. There was no outside noise at all.Overall, I'd say this was one of the best service, ambience, and quality hotels I've experienced.

This hotel is a perfect location for seeing and getting around Tokyo. The Imperial Palace is right across the street. Easy walk to Tokyo station and to Ginza, a main shopping area. The service is first class. Our room was very comfortable - the shower is amazing!! Pricey but you get what you pay for. We were here on a week-long business trip combined with some sight-seeing.

My husband and I stayed in Palace Hotel Tokyo for 6 days 5 nights. Japanese rate it as the best hotel and we love it for many reasons. It's located right next to the Palace with great accessibility to a 5-km running track around the Palace. The hotel lobby is spacious and grand, decoration and ambience are tasteful. The size of our room is around 50m sq and the amenities are in very good condition. We love the balcony from where you can enjoy the park view with greenery around the Palace. A metro station is right at the basement of the hotel. The concierge provided value added service which was out of our expectation.

The hotel has great views but also a very practical location. Direct connected with the Metro and only a short walk away from the Imperial garden, Tokyo Station and some shopping. The Hotel itself has modern spacious rooms, we had one with a balcony which was great. The staff is very friendly and attentive, only negative at times of nice weather it is impossible to get a seat outside, not on the ground floor cafe nor at the bar on the 6th floor. We tried in the afternoon but no luck. Overall we enjoyed our stay very much

Japan does not offer great value on hotels and in general they are wildly expensive however this is a hotel in the heart of Tokyo that offers comparatively good value. The service is very good and the rooms extremely comfortable.

Our final stop on a great tour of central Japan this hotel was amazingly luxurious in every respect, probably the best we have ever stayed in. We were happy to chill out here for the last day and a half of our holiday and enjoy the hotel. Excellent if fairly pricey main restaurant, but very good choice of western and Japanese food. Our room had a magnificent view of the Imperial Gardens and had every facility imaginable. A very luxurious final hotel.

Our welcome was formal but pleasant, which reflected the excellent service we received from every member of staff throughout our stay. Our room was luxurious, with balcony, and overlooked the Imperial Palace gardens. Breakfast was served, at no extra cost, on our balcony in the sunshine. Dinner in the Chinese restaurant was also excellent, although the French and Japanese restaurants were fully booked.The hotel had a genuinely comfortable and formally friendly feel about it - excellent!

Spent 5 nights and then again a night later. Beautiful building located just outside the main palace gate with wonderful views. The location is excellent with regards to both the Tokyo station and the Oteimachi station. Walk to Ginza.The rooms are large, the bathrooms fabulous. excellent decor and clean as only Japanese establishment can be. There are great hotels and then there are Japanese hotels. I am most impressed with their stupendous service. The bellboy to the concierge they go all the way to be helpful and personable. The breakfast was amazing too.We also tried their Japanese restaurant which was excellent though overpriced. This was one of the best hotels I have stayed in. The service the best. Stay here you won't regret it. Ask the concierge for help before you arrive and while you are there. They are prompt and efficient with their help. Amazing never seen concierge service as in this place.

This was one of the highlights of the last 5 years. A truly great hotel where everything works like clockwork, from housekeeping to front desk to concierge to the restaurants, Not a cheap hotel but everything you spend seems to be reflected in what you get. Good sports and pool facility with views over the imperial gardens, Excellent staff that speak good english and that care about you - no bow will be lower than that received by the elevator staff. Sushi restaurant right up there and worthy of 2 Michelin stars. If in doubt about going there, don't be - it will live up to it.

Beautiful hotel with stunning views over the Imperial Palace. The hotel rooms are large and the attention to detail in ensuring a perfect stay are discretely present throughout the hotel. A special callout on the shower pressure which is excellent and the bathroom amenities. The amenities included a hair tie which is one of the best I have ever used - so much so I actually took it home with me - and I never take hotel amenities. This hair tie to me sums up perfectly the service I experienced across at Thr Palace Hotel, most guests wouldn't notice it or need it but it's been thought of and it's quietly waiting to help you out before you even realised you needed it.Special mentions also to the club lounge - fabulous and Wadakura serving up the best Japanese food you will probably ever eat.In summary an amazing hotel in a great location - you won't be disappointed.

Our stay at Palace Hotel Tokyo was brilliant. The view of our room was straight to Imperial Gardens. In the night we had a full view of the city lights. Beautiful service of staff -very attentive and full of recommendations.

Amazing Hotel in great location directly across from Imperial Palace. The hospitality in Japan is unmatched . The food is superb if you are adventurous and open to trying new dishes different from USA. The city is amazingly clean and I don't believe I ever heard a car horn. The trains and transportation are incredibly efficient and you need to be prepared to and and exit quickly. Many great markets, shopping , historical sites , and restaurants . Hope I can return.

We stayed at the hotel for our honeymoon and can say it's one of thee if not the best hotel we've stayed in.They upgraded us to a balcony room for free and decorated our room for my wife with complimentary gifts.The hotel is stylishly decorated and there is always a staff member at hand to help.The amenities provided within the room are stocked up twice a day and the turndown service provides a classy service.Breakfast choices are vast as you would expect with a hotel of this quality and if you're lucky like we were, you get to sit by the fire. As we had to check out early one morning we used the breakfast coupons for in room dining and this too was impressive. The hotel is located right next to the station and 2 mins away from the palace gardens.I would highly recommend visiting for that bit of luxury.

As good as it gets!! The Palace is one of those places one has to experience at least once in a lifetime... Everything about it exceeds perfection..Location/setting is as good as it could be...the service/attention to details exceeds the high Japanese standards..the spotless room left nothing wanting...Wall Street Journal delivered to the door every morning...AND then there's their buffet breakfast that's a 5 Star in itself...expensive, but worth it..at least once

I should have written this up when we returned last autumn, but we had the most traumatic flight back so a really wonderful time was pushed into oblivion for a while - it was THE most wonderful place to stay. Under normal circumstances we would not have been there (rather beyond our budget!) but due to travelling with "Into Japan" we had a few nights there and it was spectacular! Service perfect ; politeness inestimable; food lovely;cleanliness superb - as it is throughout Japan. I could not fault it and it made a brilliant start to the holiday . The Japanese are a very proud people who take great pride in their service, country and way of life. "Into Japan" are also a great company and usually start their holiday with this hotel. The hotel for us was good value but had we been travelling alone, the price of the rooms would have been beyond our reach - but still highly recommended - and I have travelled widely!

The Palace Hotel is located next to the Imperial Gardens and close to Tokyo Station. It is very easy to walk across the street and visit the gardens. There is a subway station below the hotel, as well as, shops and restaurants. The staff at the hotel anticipates your every move. It seemed like there was a staff member at every corner ready to help you. We were able to get an early check-in, around 11:00. The front desk, as well as, the concierge staff were very professional and accommodating.Our room was huge with a very large balcony. It had floor to ceiling windows. There was a nice sitting area with table and chairs. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was also large with a stand alone shower. In the evenings, turn down service was available. They place a robe on the bed, slippers bedside and water and ice on the bedside table. WiFi in the room was good and free.We ate the buffet breakfast which was very good. They had a good selection and would make eggs to order. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Palace Hotel and definitely would return.

Cozy, upscale and can't believe this isCenter Tokyo! Good for Business and gatherings with friends. Food is casual, pasta, burgers to duck confe.Good service, great atmosphere. This April, my girlfriends and I and a 9 month old baby had lunch at the grand kitchen. The terrace was just so calm and peaceful. Loved it so much, felt bit like a vacation out of the city. Would recommend it to anyone

We enjoyed our stay at the Palace Hotel. It is in an excellent location. The service is wonderful and we liked our room a great deal. We also enjoyed the food and service by staying on the club floor.

We are a family with a school age old child and had a fantastic 5 night stay at The Palace. I cannot say enough good things about the service at this hotel. The Concierge staff was so helpful and patient with guest requests. They even offered to send back a lost personal item of my daughters several weeks after our stay when we realized it was gone! Most hotels would have thrown it away or not bothered to look. There is staff everywhere to help and answer questions and English is widely spoken by staff. The buffet breakfast was excellent as well. I couldn't find fault with anything there. It was convenient to subway lines via underground concourses and reasonably priced for the quality of hotel. This is THE place to stay while in Tokyo.

Stayed one night in this beautifully updated hotel in deluxe room with amazing view of the park. Incredible bathroom amenities- rain shower and soaking tub. Fully stocked mini-bar. Delicious buffet breakfast in Garden Restaurant on first floor.

We stayed at this luxurious hotel three nights. From the window great view over Emperial garden. It is a pleasure to have good room after 9 hour flight. Only problem was on the first day when we had to wait 4 hours to get to room and have good nap. We spent a couple of hours in lobby bar which was very expensive. Location was good,a train station was easy to reach.

We just finished a five night stay at the Palace Hotel. It’s elegant and sophisticated, but really comfortable, with some of the best service we’ve ever experienced at a hotel.We had a standard room with a view of the imperial palace grounds.
