Because of the buildings architecture, the view isn’t expansive, but it’s lovely. Higher rate rooms on the other side of the building do have better, more expansive views. The rooms have everything you expect to find in a 5 star hotel, but the Palace does them just a little better. There’s a U shaped piece of fabric on the wall that the blackout shades fit into, so there’s no light leakage on the sides. Instead of a nightlight in the bathroom, a few lights are on a dimmer, so you can control the light you want at night. In addition to robes, the nicest nightshirts we’ve ever worn are laid out at turn down, and because we’re both men they put out two large instead of the typical large and small. The towels were amazing too, and both towels and nightshirts can be purchased in the shopping arcade downstairs.Food and service in the bar and restaurant were as good as the room. The breakfast buffet is one of the best… tied with my all time favorite at the Langham in London.We almost stayed at the Andaz this trip. My partner stayed there last year. He raved about the rooms and views when he came home, and we had dinner there this trip. We’re both thrilled we chose the Palace.

I stayed at the Palace Hotel Tokyo for three nights a few months ago. My stay was excellent overall, there is not a single thing I could possibly complain about.My stay was not during a very busy time of year for the hotel (first half of December), I don't think there was a shortage of rooms. I was given a top floor room with a lovely view of the palace gardens and city. It had a balcony with some balcony furniture, and fortunately the weather was nice enough to be able to go out on the balcony, and the sky clear enough to see Mount Fuji.The room was quite large, especially considering average hotel room size in Tokyo. It had a modern, glass-encased bathroom sort of in the middle of the room, with a separate toilet and shower stall.My favorite thing in the room was the tea setup, with a kettle, a teapot, and a few varieties of tea. It had a Nespresso machine too, but I didn't use that.There were little extras in the room that made my stay just a little more enjoyable than it otherwise would have been: small snacks, and weather forecast cards (which perhaps aren't entirely necessary in the age of smartphones, but still). I'm also a fan of the robes and "pajamas" in the room. Basically, the room had everything I could want in a hotel room.I did not have dinner in the hotel, but I did eat breakfast at the buffet every morning, and was quite pleased with both the selection and quality of the food. There are US and European style options in addition to more local fare. Personally, I was a big fan of the small pastries. Not the waffles, though There was real maple syrup to go with those, which is always a big plus, but the waffles just weren't great. There was a different curry every morning, which was delicious, although I only sampled it because I'm not a fan of curry in the morning.The staff was excellent.The hotel's location is pretty good, too. It's walking distance from all kinds of things, and connects directly to the metro via the underground mall. Very convenient.All that said, I probably wouldn't have paid full price for this hotel. I booked through a third party seller because they had a special. I normally like to book with hotels directly, but in this case, that would have cost me almost twice as much! The price I paid was reasonable, but the regular price seemed a bit excessive.
user_name:
lotgottod
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights and loved the rooms. The included breakfast was good. The location is wonderful, across the street from the Imperial Palace and a subway station/mall in the lower level. Be careful of the restaurant pricing!

Amazing hotel in downtown Tokyo, walking distance from Ginza area, we booked the Superior Club room, facing to the Imperial Palace, fantastic view at night, we had dinner in the very famous sushi restaurant on the 6st floor

This is well located, being walking distance of Tokyo Station plus the mall under the hotel has some handy shops. The concierge was excellent. In general I liked the style of the hotel and rooms. Our room had a nice layout and a great view of Shinjuku over the gardens. Unfortunately, we had some problems, our room frequently smelled of smoke and there was noise during the night from the pipes. Also, some of the staff's English was not as good as of the other places I have stayed in the city. Given their prices I probably would not stay here again.

Location is very convinient not far from Tokyo station and next to Imperial Palace East Garden. Breakfast is marvelous, really good choice. View from the room is wonderful. We were located on the 16th floor. We were on holiday with our 9-year old daughter to see Sakura bloom. Staff is so kind and helpful. Without doubt we will chose this hotel next time if we visit Tokyo.

Concluding our two weeks in Japan, we stayed at the Palace Hotel Tokyo for our final night.We've read a lot of good things (here on TA too) so our expectations were (maybe too) high. We booked the Fine Hotels & Resorts rate several months prior to our stay.The location is amazing, just opposite of the Imperial Garden, very close to Tokyo station, Ginza and the subway runs just below the hotel. The check-in was the best we received in Japan. Super efficient, attentive and friendly.The room is rather modern and very large for Tokyo standards. The size of the bathroom alone is a full room's size elsewhere. Although the FHR rate may contain a room upgrade (if capacity available) we did not receive any. I am OK with that. But even contrary, we received an (obviously) "accessible" room on the lowest possible floor (8) with no separate shower - although stated otherwise for this category on their official website. Additionally all facilities like sink, tub, etc. were super low mounted. Considering the ¥ we paid for this night this was more than underwhelming and I am not sure why one would treat a first time guest this way.We both had dinner and breakfast. The dinner (main restaurant) was good and the staff attentive but not overly welcoming. We felt a bit alienated.After that we went to the bar on the sixth floor which has amazing views but lacked in service - we had to wait roughly 20 minutes after being seated to place the order, 15 more minutes for the (two) drinks. That felt a bit long for 5***** standards. The breakfast was also very good, amazing location and very good spread. Service was also more friendly on that occasion.The check out again was picture perfect, helpful staff, very good front office team - that's how we had wished for our entire experience at the Palace Hotel Tokyo.All in all the Palace Hotel Tokyo is a good hotel, but our experience and the price/value ratio was not.

I stayed a night at the Palace Hotel for a business trip. I was placed in a 3rd floor room with a view onto the Palace. The room was quiet and spacious. It was modern and the bed was super comfortable. The bathrooms was also spacious and you could watch TV from the tub. I was unable to take breakfast because I had to leave so early the next morning, but the staff were courteous and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Luxury western style hotel with delicate Japanese touch - what do you want more?!? I really enjoy my stay at Palace hotel. The room and bathroom are spacious. The amenities are luxurious and more than I need. The staffs are friendly and helpful.The location is not far from Tokyo station and daimaru shopping mall which you can find almost everything you would want to get in Japan. It's within walking reach to both metro and JR station so it's very convenient. The arcade under the hotel also has convenient store, bookshop and restaurants.The breakfast buffet is not that impressive but provided adequate Japanese, continental and American breakfast as well as their original vegetable curry. I didn't have a chance to try the hotel restaurant and would Iove to do it during my next stay. I highly recommend Palace hotel to everyone especially the business traveler.

It's right next to the Imperial Palace (less than a minute walk), great access to many subway lines, there's a train station right below, it's even a walking distance to Tokyo station. The room in which i stayed in had a great view of the Imperial Palace and the staff were all very kind and helpful. I would definitely stay there again!

Excellent overall, good restaurants if staying in, or outside within 10 minutes more choices...... however restaurants and bars hidden out of street sight. They are underground or 6 and 7 floors up in nieghbouring buildings....The hotel restaurants are also very good.Nice pool and excellent gym overlooking the Royal Palace and park across the water.Ginza high end shopping is about 20 to 30 minute walk or 5 minutes subway (get directions to subway lol and the many sub terrain walkways. It is pricey here. But if only in town a couple of days wow it's great.Note: Jr rail pass must be ordered before you arrive in Japan don't forget.... and get one! Gets you almost everywhere around Tokyo.

Hotel is beautifully located, directly opposite the Imperial Palace. A five minute walk to the subway station either outside or underground Rooms very nicely appointed. There is a bar on a high floor which affords a tremendous view of Tokyo.Lobby restaurant has a great buffet breakfast, complete with a wood burning over where pastries and rolls are warmed up to perfection. Very much recommend it.

Stayed in the Palace Hotel for a week on business. Very enjoyable stay. Compared to many of the other similar hotels on offer feels more spacious and coherent with a pleasant restaurant and bars on the ground floor and other options on floor 6Very light, pleasant and well equipped gym, nice pool which was empty every time I visitedBreakfast bar is pleasant, service very occasionally less good (bringing coffee when they are busy was sometimes slow)Bar is good, particularly the larger lounge barRoom service phenomenally expensive, even for Tokyo

If anyone is looking for a great deal on hotels you can check it out on HotelRaven. com Booked a room on there and they had the cheapest rates around...The Palace Hotel Tokyo is amongst my top 10 hotels of all time. Stayed in a Club Room and the team across the hotel were accommodating to all requests. The room service from the various hotel restaurants is very broad in terms of choice. There is a 7-11 in the basement which helps cut down on the mini-bar charges and the basement also connects to the subway for good access to public transport.

I appreciated my stay at this hotel. The staff is very well-trained and polite. The conceirge is extremely knowledgeable.The club lounge was a nice addition. I think their portion sizes were relatively small but quality of the food was pretty good.There were few occasions that I had a hard time communicating with the staff due to them not speaking English. It would be nice to have more English speaking staff...

Beautiful room in a great location. Easy to find and the airport bus drops directly to the door. The staff were lovely and gave us a great recommendation for ramen that we would never have found ourselves. Luxury accommodation is expensive in Japan!

This hotel is located within walking distance or a quick taxi ride from the Tokyo train station. There's an underground walkway from the station to the hotel. We appreciated sinking into the fabulous bed after a long day of sight-seeing. The room was quiet and had a beautiful shower and tub. The service and amenities were impeccable including the indoor pool and hot tub. We took advantage of our balcony, sitting out there with coffee in the mornings, or enjoying the balmy evenings with a glass of bubbly.

My experience of this hotel started before my arrival in Tokyo. I asked the concierge to do various things for me such as buying tickets for the bullet train and making restaurant bookings. Everything was done perfectly, calmly and so politely. Every person on the concierge desk was a delight to deal with.I was met on arrival at the airport by a car (arranged by the concierge) and on arrival at the hotel, whisked up to the 19th floor to check in to my club room at the club lounge. A soft drink was provided and the check-in procedure was wonderfully easy. I was even given a choice of smells for a room spray.My room was beautiful. I had a balcony overlooking the Imperial Palace gardens on the 17th floor. The bed was extremely comfy and the bedding beautifully soft. The shower/bath were in their own wet room. All toiletries were quickly replaced when used and there were plenty of free bathroom gifts/toiletries on offer. The hairdryer was the best I have ever used in a hotel. I had to call the reception to find the room safe which was in a drawer which actually made it far more easily accessible. If I have a criticism of the room (and this is the only one I can think of) it was that the case stand (where you put your bag/case to pack/unpack) was located by the entry door and therefore of no use being the furthest point from the places your clothes would be.I went to the Japanese restaurant (Go) on the 6th floor and it was quiet and elegant. The food was delicious and the staff (as ever) attentive. The main restaurant on the ground floor was of a good quality but more mass market. That said, it was always busy.Every member of staff I spoke to was unfailingly polite and helpful. The hotel was tastefully and elegantly decorated and exuded a sense of calm sophistication. I have stayed in many 5 star hotels and this was as good as any of them if not at the top. I would strongly recommend staying there.

advertised as an excellent luxury hotel and lived up to these expectations. Rooms very well appointed and the bathroom especially good. Had a number of meals and all were the highest quality. Location very convenient and safe area for walking.

Stay was part of a tour group booking. Staff were excellent and looked after us all as individuals.Rooms were spacious and a good view. Right opposite The Imperial Gardens.Beautifully presented meals.Extraordinary bandwidth on their free WiFi.

Quiet location near the imperial palace and close to Tokyo station.No request is too much for the staff, the rooms are beautiful, the club level food and drink service is amazing. We had dinner at the Chinese and the Japanese restaurants as well as the sushi restaurant in the hotel. We did not find the food amazing, but that is probably because we are used to the Western versions of those cuisines.

For some this might not be the ideal place to stay as not in the heart of the cities tourist area. This is a 5 Star property with stunning views overlooking the Imperial Palace and moats. A visit to the Palace is a must but be prepared to join a large group. Many of the areas are not open to the public but the buildings and gardens are awe inspiring, be prepared to take off your shoes before entering .

I don't think I have ever experienced a class of service this high. Aside from the beauty of the hotel itself and the attention to detail in every respect, the level of service at this hotel is impeccable. It is clear that the staff has undergone intensive training to cater to foreigners and Japanese travelers alike. The concierges are knowledgeable and multi-lingual. They make every effort to make your visit more than memorable. The rooms are tasteful and gorgeous - the epitome of class. They provide the most comfortable pajamas each night and have amazing products in the bathrooms. I would never stay anywhere else in Tokyo. In fact The Palace Hotel makes me want to return to Tokyo again and again. I love it!

This hotel is very good from start to finish. Rooms are ok with palace views. Breakfast was well presented and varied. All staff were super friendly and very helpful. Would certainly stay here again despite price of coffee.

Our room with a balcony looked over the Wadakura Fountain Park as do most of the rooms. You need a room facing east to get the views of the Imperial Palace gardens - I'd imagine they are a lot more expensive though. The rooms are beautiful and clean. The service fantastic and the staff could not be more helpful. The bathroom is lovely and we had a full bath and shower in our triple single bed room. The ability to hook up your computer to the TV was great to review your photos in the evening with all cords supplied. There is a 7 11 and a lovely pizza place downstairs under the hotel and access to the local train station. Cabs are available all the time but you can easily walk to Tokyo station in under 10 minutes.

The hotel is centrally located, lots of walking areas immediately outside in the Imperial Palace parks, walk to the central train station and shopping district. The hotel has well appointed rooms, hi tech bathrooms, a range of world class restaurants and a very helpful and friendly English speaking staff, but its not cheap!

Although in the business district of Tokyo, these hotel rooms have amazing views over looking the city. We ate at almost all of their restaurants and were not disappointed. It has a very classy upscale atmosphere and the breakfast in the downstairs restaurant is amazing.

Everything about this Hotel was excellent. It's lovely, the restaurants are wonderful, the service was perfect and the rooms are large and beautiful. Our whole family went on this trip and it was a great start. The single negative is it's a little bit away from the touristy stuff. But it sits above a metro station so getting around was easy. If you're looking for an elegant but not stuffy Hotel, this is perfect.

We booked the club level and it was an excellent experience. The staff was warm, friendly and very accommodating to our needs. They have breakfast, cocktail hour and appetizers during the day. The hotel was perfect location to Tokyo train station and underground being attached to the hotel! Dinner was great at the Chinese inspired restaurant. Breakfast was ok, we had better at other hotels, but still in the top 10.Hotel and staff did a great job! Thank you!!!

The Palace hotel is well located close to Ginza yet right next to the Imperial Palace. The hotel is connected to the Otemachi Station and is linked directly to Tokyo Station by an underground passage - about a 15 min walk. It is also on the Airport Limousine stop - about 1 1/2 hours from Narita. The hotel rooms overlook an open area and you can se the Imperial Palace from most if not all rooms. The concierge was very helpful with restaurant reservations which I made prior to arrival and on arrival I was presented with maps of the restaurants for ease of showing to the taxi drivers. There are several restaurants on site including a pretty good sushi restaurant. Rooms were comfortable and had all the necessary amenities including a continuous supply of bottled water. There was a nice spread of food at the buffet breakfast but I think that the Japanese selection can be far better.

The Palace hotel delivers on all fronts. It is the perfect urban hotel. It blends the luxury and polish of a 5-star hotel, while still feeling connected to the city. In many cities nowadays, the idea of staying in a typical large ‘business’ hotel feels stale. Tokyo; however, is a largely modern city noted by its meticulousness. Staying at a hotel like the Palace in some cities may feel removed from the city life and sterile; however, here, Japanese business men and women utilize the lobby and its restaurants for meetings, the host of restaurants on site, are top notch, including Michelin starred Sushi Kanesaka with its approximately 12 seat counter feels far from a typical hotel restaurant. In fact, in Tokyo many of the cities fine restaurants are located on upper levels of buildings in Ginza and other posh neighborhoods around town, or even subterranean (some of the cities most storied ramen shops are below grade in Tokyo station). The property also is connected to the Ottemachi metro stop, and is a 5-minute walk from Tokyo station which makes doing both business and sightseeing from the hotel a breeze. Also of note, the hotel fronts the imperial palace (near the entrance of the gardens, open to the public). Another great way to feel connected to city life is by taking a jog around the palace, just out the front door of the hotel. The property provides a jogging station with water, cool towels (for upon return), and maps, although the route is fairly self-explanatory and very safe. As an anecdote highlighting the level of professionalism on site, one afternoon I returned from a jog and was talking towards the front door. In the distance appeared the water bottles at the ‘jogging station’ had been removed for the day, as most people run in the morning, or were all out. Out of the corner of my eye, I caught a bellhop running hurriedly across the driveway into a room. He emerged out of another door before I could reach the entrance of the hotel with a bottle of water and a hand towel. I would have been fine just grabbing a bottle in my room, but this level of anticipatory service is what the palace is all about. Another service highlight, upon leaving While the Palace has a long history in the Tokyo hotel scene, the current iteration is only about five years old, so its design is fresh, but one gets the impression that even after years have passed the attention to detail and high quality finishes will keep the place feeling luxurious for quite some time with artful touches everywhere, down to the over width guestroom corridors that while likely unnecessary even from a handicapped accessibility standpoint, lent an even more luxurious feel to the place. The room service food, Sushi Kanesaka, and Grand Café lobby bar/ and breakfast buffet were all top level. The gym and indoor pool are fantastic as well, and complimentary for guests. The only minor caveat I have is to use the spa ‘facilities’ consisting of a hot sauna and three plunge pools of varying temperatures, a guest has to pay 2500 Yen. While this is a great remedy to jet lag after a long day of travel, these items should be complimentary to hotel guests in my view as they really weren’t that extensive. If they were grander in appearance and offering I could understand the charge. While beautifully decorated with lovely public spaces, and beyond comfortable guestrooms with top notch technology, the level of design for the true design snobs is not quite up to the level of the new Aman Tokyo down the street. I was happy to visit the Aman for lunch and tea, two days in a row and take in the gorgeous sky lobby and view. I would certainly love to stay there some day; but even just visiting the lobby the Aman feels more pristine and museum life, and less connected to the daily life of the city. What I liked so much about the Palace was the perfect balance it struck. The Palace is a hotel that will provide comfort and luxury for anyone who visits.

I stayed in the Palace Hotel Tokyo for five nights. This place is amazing, true perfection, it even smells beautiful. The rooms are spacious and every detail has been thought of. The beds are very comfortable, bathrooms are gorgeous, water pressure is strong. The staff is accommodating in every way. The hotel is attached underground to the metro and the bars/restaurants are all top notch. I can't wait to come back!
user_name:
Suzanne S
Westchester County, New York

review_body: I "always" stayed at the old Palace Hotel (same location) before it was taken down and completely rebuilt/reopened some years ago. This was my first stay in the "new" Palace Hotel, and I must say it was a super experience.The location I already knew was super, and I had some expectations of the renovated hotel as I had heard from friends it had become better than before. This is true, indeed.The same friendly ambience as in the past, the extremely welcoming staff and most important for me; it has not become a "big" hotel. I felt I was in a boutique hotel wrapped in a fairly large modern building.The best ? The bed and the shower. The worst? Nothing (but it took a while to get used to the light switches.... not a big deal).

If you've traveled to Tokyo, then you will know that people looking out for you and remembering what you need is simply par for the course. So of course when I left my bags in the hotel and my wife checked in afterwards, they miraculously knew she was my wife and had the bags delivered to our room. Piece of cake!Of course, on the second day, the lounge knew that I liked my pinot noir and it arrived without my having to ask anyone - expected, please! But the concierge's figuring out what we would like and not like at Tsukiji fish market - telling us to wake up leisurely and eat at the outer market because, unless you're an aficionado, going at 3 am to watch tuna being auctioned in an unfamiliar language leaves a lot to be desired - that was useful. Location? Utterly fantastic. There are no less than 5 Tokyo metro lines that converge at Otemachi station which is almost directly under the hotel, which means that you are pretty much connected to all of Tokyo from there. If you're like us and you haven't figured out that tourists can get a 3 day unlimited pass for Y 1,500 at the airport, well the helpful concierge will tell you to take a short walk to Yurakucho station, the Bic camera store will sell you one, and you're off!I do have to warn you about one thing. The path back to the hotel from the train station takes you past the hotel pastry shop called Sweets and Deli. Do not, repeat, do not stop at that shop early in your trip or you are truly doomed. I don't care where you come from - the chocolate and pastries are sinfully good. I was reduced to eating a single dark chocolate truffle by the end. Look the room's alright, it's not the most modern room you will find, the hotel amenities are adequate - the gym is convenient if not completely kitted out, but the little touches and the convenient location, make this an absolute gem.

The Palace hotel is located right next to the Imperial Palace so is very central. Rooms are large, modern and comfortable and even have balconies. Service was exceptional at all times. I really couldn't find fault with anything.

For my last night in Japan I opted to stay at the Palace Hotel mostly due to its close proximity to Tokyo Station (wanting to make my trip to the airport the next day as easy as possible). From check-in to check-out the service and attention to detail was exceptional! I lucked out and was able to get an upgrade to a larger room with a balcony. I braved the cold and enjoyed the lovely view from the balcony of the Imperial Palace and its grounds. Looking out at the wide expanse of the grounds you have the feeling of a lot of space which is welcome right in the middle of Tokyo! The room itself was large, beautiful and had a lot of great details.My booking included a room service credit as well as the breakfast buffet. I had dinner in my room which was tasty, but if I had to pay for it I think it would have been overpriced. The breakfast buffet in the Grand Kitchen was great - they had a mix of western and Japanese style foods.

Attention to every detail.I stayed there some 30 years ago, good memories, and coming back to the recently renovated Palace was a very nice reunion.One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at, and thats a few.

We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Is located near the palace which makes it perfect for tourists although is not in the touristic center per se. The views from the room were unbeatable and there was a perfect calm to enjoy a good night sleep. The rooms are fully equiped with many details that upgrade your stay to perfect. The shower in our room was one of the best i've enjoyed in a hotel. Will totally recommend it without a doubt.

We only stayed overnight before our flight back but the hotel is new nicely decorated and the staff was nice. Not the very best hotel among Tokyo 5 stars hotels (mandarin four season etc) but a little less expensive and still a good choice.

Our number 1 choice in Tokyo. Distinguished elegance at its best. Second stay as LH club member. Upgrade not granted as "on availability" only. Room seemed smaller than the traditional deluxe room layout (far away from elevator). Breakfast: very busy, different buffets, all choices available (Western and Japanese)Great Chinese restaurant: food was delicious, meticulous service. However, Peking duck is only served as skin and not "traditional way" in three courses: at this price tag we wonder why?

I enjoyed every minutes of my stay and this is the best hotel I ever stayed in my life. The hotel is located in front of Imperial Palace and the view from my balcony was unforgettable. The room was spacious and super clean. I saw three housekeepers came to turned down the room one night. The upgraded bathroom amenities and they were newly replaced if used. I was treated with their "Omotenashi" and I highly recommend to stay there. By the way, I really liked their Panasonic Nano-e hair dryer. I bought the same at the airport. It cost me about $200 but its worth it!

A relatively new hotel very near to the Imperial Gardens. The staff were attentive without being overpowering and always eager to help. There is a reasonable shopping centre in the basement that offers some cheaper dining options than those on offer in the hotel. Worth knowing that the transit time from the hotel to airport on the Hotel Airport Coach is about an hour and 20 mins as the hotel is the first to be picked up to the airport and the last to be dropped off... suggest taxi or Uber if you're in a rush...

Stayed here for 3 nights back in November. Picked this hotel because we had previously stayed here in 2015 and was very impressed with its location and service. It is peaceful in a beautiful surrounding and that is very hard to come by in Tokyo where most of the luxury hotels are located on high floors on an office building. The 1st time we stayed in the most basic room but this time we opted for a room with a balcony overlooking the Imperial Palace and WOW...What a difference! As mentioned in my previous review everything in this hotel/room is very well thought out. From the water pressure in the shower to the toiletries provided to the slippers in room, everything is top notch and is designed for the utmost comfort. My husband's Japanese friends came to visit us in our room one night and even they were impressed. It's the little details that matter indeed and we will not stay anywhere else but here when we come back to Tokyo.

We really enjoyed our four night stay in this hotel. It was our first trip to Tokyo and the hotel had been recommended to us. The rooms are large and have a spacious balcony offering great views across the Imperial Palace area and part of the Tokyo skyline. It has a good mix of formal and casual dining and bars. The staff and particularly the concierge, were always eager to help and knowledgeable and we gratefully accepted some recommendations for good restaurants. When one of our party became ill, they offered medicine and assistance. I highly recommend this hotel. My only reservation is that it is in a relatively quiet, business neighbourhood so it won't suit people who prefer a more dynamic area.

This was a pretty neat hotel. But I would also say that it requires a pretty penny too. No matter, as it is absolutely worth it. The rooms we had where so cool. I loved playing with the electronic curtains. One thing I've noticed about Japan is that hotels pride themselves on having amazing bathrooms. And this place was no different. Everything was state of the art. The staff were very friendly and compliant too which is always a plus. They go out of their way to make sure that you're happy. We ate at a few places in the hotel and they were quite decent. I think the main positive of the hotel was the area. Underneath the hotel was a walkway where you could get to the train station. And I'll tell you right now. If you have access to a train station in Japan, you have access to anywhere and everywhere. From Disneyland to Asakusa, we only needed to walk a few hundred metres. Also, this place is right across from the Imperial Palace which is pretty cool. Overall, a hotel worth revisiting.
user_name:
Sohail D
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: This is the perfect hotel for a peaceful and beautiful visit to Tokyo. It is located right across from the Imperial Palace, with a beautiful view of its gardens. The rooms are very large and have a modern Japanese design. There is a swimming pool and good breakfast, including a very nice lobby. The staff is fantastic, super helpful, respectful and kind. Very recommended!

My wife and i stayed for around 10 days in January and we can confirm that this hotel is world class with world class service. The contemporary design of the hotel is beautiful, the rooms are modern and elegant and the bathroom and in particular the rain showers are fantastic. The rain shower was wonderfully powerful.All the staff with no exception were beyond fantastic. We were enormously impressed with their professionalism, charm and efficiency. If there is a better 5 star hotel in Tokyo then i will be astonished. We were going to stay at the Shangri-La hotel in Tokyo but it is not in the same league as the Palace hotel. In fact we visited the Shangri-La during our stay and can confirm that if you have the choice you must stay at the Palace hotel.The gym was good as was the pool. The design of the hotel was stylish with beautiful modern art. We stayed in a Club room which was quite fun as good champagne was served every evening in the Club lounge.If i had one complaint i would say that the afternoon and evening snacks in the Club lounge were not to my liking but that is a very subjective view and some may disagree with that view.Would i stay again ........ without any doubt.Would i stay elsewhere in Tokyo .......... i would not.What would the highlights of this hotel be ............ its contemporary design and its staff who are simply superb.

My family (including 2 teenage daughters) stayed 7 nights in this beautiful hotel. We loved every part of this hotel but it was the hotel staff that made it truly special. Although mostly business people seem to stay at this hotel, the hotel staff didn't treat my family and I any differently. The Concierge were particularly helpful organising for us a Tokyo cycling tour and providing clear directions to anywhere we wanted to go including Disneyland. My daughters loved the pool and the buffet breakfast and the hotel was conveniently located close to the metro trains so we could easily get to Ginza, Shibuya and Shinjuku. A very beautiful hotel - highly recommend.

Spacious rooms, great location, amazing breakfasts and service make this hotel unique. Beautiful Lobby and gardens outside. Near train station for any excursions and a central London cation from where to walk to all different neighborhoods. Not as congested as center city.

I always stay at the Palace Hotel when coming to Tokyo on business. I particularly enjoy the balcony from my room, which overlooks a historic part of the city and the Imperial gardens. The rooms are very modern and the hotel restaurants are some of the best in the city.
user_name:
runningtheglobe
New York City, New York

review_body: Rooms are huge,and some are with Balconies, where you can view over the Royal Palace.Plenty of Greens.The Japanese restaurant are Good, but booking is absolutelynecessary. Don't expect a Cheap Meal, it costs more than Yen 15000 per person

A glorious hotel, full of charm and class. The rooms are beautiful, uncluttered, elegant and luxurious. The crisp white bedding is a joy. A glass of champagne in the lobby bar area is one of life's pure pleasures. The staff are so friendly. Even the flowers are exquisite. Have a said enough? How about the timeless views of the Imperial Palace or the 10 minute walk to Ginza? Go if you can

Palace Hotel Tokyo has a great fitness center that is 24/7 - with free Evian water! They also have the best breakfast buffet! The hotel seems to be busy all the time... but they have everything you need!

I can't even say enough about the amazing service at this hotel. Everyone offering to help at every second. I thought everyone was looking for a tip but found out you don't tip in Tokyo. The people were amazing. Had a huge balcony on the 18th floor with stunning views. The food in the grand kitchen was amazing. The area is safe and central to the best high end shopping and restaurants. Also convenient to subway. I can't say enough about this fabulous hotel.

Hotel is nicely located, by the Palace. The jogging route around the Palace is one of the best route I've been running on. Boutique shopping arcade is right at the basement and subway station is about 10-minutes walk.Room is spacious and clean, city-side view is good, Palace-side view is fantastic. Amber Palace restaurant offers great Sichuan cuisine and Lounge Bar with decent cocktail. Pool is a bit small, about 20 meter in length.Very good service here. Concierge could book almost every restaurant and bar in the city. Room service is timely and responsive to all kind of needs. Staffs are polite and professional. Overall, it has been a wonderful experience.

We stayed at the Palace for a week, and we could find no fault with the experience. Checking in and Checking out was very prompt, and we were sown to our rooms very quickly. As a family of four, we had two rooms, and the rooms had a common area that was separated from the rest of the rooms, which was a great arrangement for us. The rooms were luxurious and modern, and so were the bathrooms. If it is important to you, Wi-Fi was amazing. The concierge helped us plan each outing from the hotel, and they even managed to get us tickets for the Sumo tournament which we couldn't get on our own. The breakfast buffet is huge and delicious, and stuffing yourself in the morning will probably keep you going for the rest of the day. Sushi Kanesaka, a Michelin 2-Star restaurant is located within the hotel, along with multitude of shops in the Hotel Arcade. the hotel is connected directly to the Otemachi Station, which means that you have access to 5 different Tokyo Metro lines without even leaving the hotel.

I travel frequently for work around the world, I must say this is one of the nicest hotels I have ever have ever experienced. We were lucky enough to stay at this hotel when they opened up the Imperial Palace Gardens for the Cherry Blossom Festival. It was an experience I will cherish forever. The hotel staff truly understand service. Never once did we need anything that a member of their team wasn't there already anticipating our needs and wishes. Truly amazing service.

What an amazing introduction to Japan. The staff are friendly, cheerful, polite, and will try their utmost to make your stay wonderful. They clearly take pride in their hotel and their country. The rooms are impeccable. The breakfast outstanding.

I highly recommend this hotel! Modern and luxurious. Fantastic location and walking distance to the train station, good sized rooms, excellent staff including a pool stellar of concierge staff who did all they could to make our trip even more memorable. Will be back again in the near future.

My wife and 2 children and I stayed at the Palace for 4 nights last week. We had a phenomenal experience. Highlights include:- Extremely convenient location with easy access to 4 subway lines- Flawless service- Attractive, clean and comfortable rooms with technology that actually works- Great views of the Imperial Palace and gardens- Excellent breakfast spread with extensive Western and Japanese optionsOur only issues were (1) the fact that the pool is only open to children under 16 from 9AM to 5PM (this is not stated anywhere on the hotel's website) and (2) the fact that our "adjoining" rooms were not actually adjoining, but separated by a share hallway. Despite these minor inconveniences, we had an excellent stay and recommend this hotel very highly.

Very great hotel. This hotel really sets the bar for hospitality. Everything is impeccable from the moment you enter or even before we arrived. Once I booked the hotel I was able to reach out to concierge to make reservations. They were able to make all the request except for Sushi Saito, but that's because they only take reservations with regulars. Every staff I came across was extremely helpful and courteous. I also find the bed sheets to be softer and smoother than other hotels I been to. Great view of the palace. I was able to walk in the underground passage directly from the hotel to Tokyo station takes maybe 15-20mins. Great location though as typical Tokyo we expected to walk a bit to every where we need to go.
user_name:
mstravelernyc
New York City, New York

review_body: Great 4 day business trip with 4 evenings at the Palace. Dinner once and breakfast 4 times. First class, well appointed room and bathrooms. Excellent fitness center. Great location near Palace and Tokyo Station, shopping and restaurants. Will be returning to the Palace soon!

Once you've done them all: Park Hyatt, Grand Hyatt, Peninsula, Mandarin, and may be even the Aman, chances are, you'll come back here. Because it's the most Japanese of them all. Because the service is impeccable (and do splurge on the Club level room and the 19th floor lounge will become your retreat from the hustle of the big hotel). Because the quality of restaurants makes you feel bad you go out. Because they remember you here. Because the view over the Palace gardens from your balcony is so poetic. Yes, it's not all perfect - the concierge gets overwhelmed at times and not offering up the enchanting Tokyo secrets you wish she would. But we forgive it - and come back every time.

When I read the reviews on the Palace Hotel, they were so positive that I assumed the staff was writing them or there was a 10% discount for writing them. I was wrong. This hotel deserves all the praise it gets and much more. I have stayed at many hotels over my 10 years plus of trips to Japan and this one beats them all. The reason? Many. The hotel rooms are beautiful and spacious, leaving you feeling an immense sense of relaxation. The views are incredible and the access to a balcony unique to this hotel in Japan. We were so enthralled by the view that we purposely got up for sunrise and had breakfast in the room to take advantage of it. The room service and restaurants we tried (Amber Palace and Lounge Prive), where excellent. The spa is stunning and most of all, all the service given and staff is first class. Everyone was so polite and happy and they even waved us goodbye. We were so sad to leave and going forward will make this our first choice in Tokyo. Thank you Palace Hotel and Staff for an amazing trip, we look forward to seeing you again.
user_name:
Tasha_Kitchen
New York City, New York

review_body: One of the best hotels I've stayed in anywhere in the world, and I am a luxury traveler. Concierge went above and beyond at all times. Service is amazing. Rooms are very comfortable. Incredible sleep with super comfy bed and blackout shades. Bathroom is world-class. Breakfast was great. Design is beautiful and modern. Hotel above most train lines. Very convenient.Highly recommend!

I could write an assay about this hotel. It is one of the best hotels I have ever staid (been in over 50 countries). There is nothing that I can say, but "Bravo!" and "Thank you". I would suggest to ask for higher floors so that you could enjoy a great city view.

stayed in the the relatively brand new Palace ( I had stayed at the old one aeons before) - it is absolutely superb. there is nothing that is missing from this hotel - it is perfection .the staff are amazing, the location is brilliant, the rooms are spotless and fully appointed. Highkly recommended and i wont go anywhere else in Tokio in the future. It abuts the Imperial Palace, has a great view, great restaurants (try the sushi one) and a nice shopping arcade. Don't think of anywhere else. Oh, and with the cheap yen it was a bargain .

I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel last fall during a vacation in Tokyo. It was one of the classiest and luxurious hotels I've stayed at in Asia. The lobby and check-in areas were grand and classy, without being over the top. The rooms were clean, modern, and simply luxurious. From the rooms, the view of the Imperial Palace grounds were breathtaking. Service was efficient and discreet, in line with high-end Japanese standards. It has a very nice gym with the expected amenities for a 5-star hotel and a nice view through picture windows from the treadmills. There is also the option of a nice cool brisk morning jog around the picturesque Palace grounds.The location was walkable to Ginza, if you're the active and motivated type, or just a short cab ride away. The environment is quieter and more peaceful than other luxury hotels in the area like the Peninsula, or more removed and isolated, depending on your perspective or preference. Overall a very elegant and classy hotel.

Palace Hotel is one of the most complete hotels we've stayed at. The hotel is a true 5 star providing a luxurious stay with many amenities. The location was convenient, just a 10 minute walk to Tokyo Station. The room was spacious, up to date, and very comfortable. We had a balcony that overlooked the park down below which made our stay that much better. The staff was over the top kind and courteous. With every step, an employee was ready to greet us and help us plan our day. Don't think twice, book this hotel!

This is a wonderful hotel located in the great district of Marunouchi.Fine dining, shopping and with Tokyo central station a few blocks away.Service is excellent, rooms luxurious and spacious, and great food at the house restaurant. There are several restaurants inside the hotel, and very conveniently located small shops and convenience stores in the lower level.

Just finished a 7 day visit to Tokyo with a 10 year old. Great location, great spot to go for morning walks at the Imperial Gardens and easy access to various locations around Tokyo. The service was impeccable and attention to detail was everywhere. For a little bit more a rollaway is available for kids. For my son the buffet breakfast was a favourite and our meal at Sushi Kanesaka was sublime. A great place to stay over the festive period. My suggestion is to book a room with a balcony ... the sunsets are drop dead gorgeous from this vantage point.

We arrived from the long U.K. Flight at the Palace Hotel just wanting to get to the room only to find ourselves enjoying the check in process on their club floor. It was accurate,informative,detailed and above all warm and hospitable unlike so many first class hotels nowadays.This set the scene for a great four days. The location opposite the imperial palace is fantastic and to wake up in the morning to see Mount Fuji from your balcony was stunning. The service levels and staff at the hotel couldn't do more for you but most importantly they knew or found out the answers for any question. The breakfasts were great as was all of the food. Tokyo is never cheap but we left feeling that we had received great value from a fantastic hotel. The Oriental Bangkok has always set our level for top hotels and the Palace is right up there. Well done.Room tip- try and get a higher floor for views over the city and the Palace gardens.

We stayed at the Palace hotel Tokyo for 7 nights and we loved it!The staff was super friendly and always try to help us.Our room was perfect, size, view and so on.The hotel is a high price but its worth it! I wouldn't choose any other hotel or area. Transportation was easy, the metro station is located downstairs in the lobby area. Overall great hotel, I would like to be back for sure. Only thing negative for me was the breakfast it is always the same after a couple days we started to get bored of the same option.

I love this hotel and would like to go back. Breakfast is great, the large room is amazing and the beds are comfortable. Service is good. However the room was not soundproof and when the neighbour turned on the TV I woke up and could not sleep. It was a bit surprising and irritating as the hotel is so perfect in any way.

A lovely hotel in a perfect location. Wedged between Tokyo station and the imperial palace grounds. The hotel lobby, bars and restaurants ooze class and the service continuously impresses. Rooms are well appointed and great value for Tokyo but the F+B is priced at lux plus plus

توجد محطة قطار اسفل الفندق لكن لا تنفع اذا كنت تسخدم عربية اطفال لانه لا توجد مصاعد. There is a train station to the hotel but is not useful if you are using Baby stroller because there are no elevators يوجد متجر 711 لكن يغلق الساعة 11 مساءً .. there is 711 but close at 11pm وجود شرفة .. the balcony .. وجود مربية اطفال (بيبي سيتر) عليك الحجز قبلها بليلة .. they have Baby Sitter but you need to book before خدمة نقل الحقائب الى اي فندق داخل اليابان برسوم .. you can send your Luggage to any hotel in Japan-----------حجز مبلغ 200 الف ين من بطاقة الفيزا كتأمين مبلغ كبير جداً .. they took deposit 200,000 yen بعيد عن شارع جينزا ..والمطاعم والخدمات الاخرى. Far from Ginza street .. and restaurants and other services. السعر مبالغ به جداً .. price very expensive.. هناك خيارات افضل من هذا الفندق .. There are better options than this hotel ..

Best view in Tokyo. The location is also very good, very convenient to other areas of Tokyo by subway. What we loved most was the stylish and the elegant atmosphere of the hotel, and the space of room big enough compared to the price. Nothing to complain, only the front is not very friendly, they tried to avoid eye contact when in a communication.

I loved this hotel as it is positioned right on the Imperial Gardens which are fabulous to run through mornings and evenings.The rooms are big, spacious and luxuriously turned out. The staff are efficient and friendly aiming to please from housekeepers to concierge to spa therapists. The spa is fabulous with steam room options and the gym, alongside the spa, has great views from the treadmills, over the city, which I always find helpful when pounding away as a distraction! Every expectation was exceeded and I would definitely stay here again.

Hello All,I'm a traveler, for both personal and business. I love Japan - so after my 2 week Asia trip, I decided to stay in Tokyo and this time I wanted to choose Palace Hotel because of reviews.All the other reviewers told about the room and cleanliness, while I appreciate them, if you are a 5 star hotel, you have to deliver that. All Top 10 TripAdvisor 5-star hotels will deliver that.The difference between 5 star hotels is made by Senior Staff and Details. Because Senior Staff decide how to manage the hotel and details.From really below average in-room dining / breakfast, to not answering or 1h delayed answers to simple requests like extra cleaning material like towels, there are many small details I can share but this box won't be enough to tell all of them. If the room is enough for you, then please stay here, I sincerely tell you: their rooms are really nice.But, if you're like me, small details and approach to the guest is important for you - then you should not stay here, please try another top review hotel. You will be disappointed - and a few days / weeks trip you do once in a while and expect to be enjoy that, you won't have it here. I could'nt find enough time to write a review in generally - but Palace Hotel changed that. I will write both +/- reviews for the hotels I will stay from now on - and I think I owe this to you all Tripadvisor community / visitors. And I also owe this to the great hotels I stay every year.Enjoy your upcoming / current trip!

Palace hotel is one of the newest hotels in tho which is located around the imperial palace. Thus you need sometimes to go to Ginza or other shopping area.The design is very modern Japanese. The hotel itself is quite huge and spacious. The guest room offers a very magnificent view. The room is very well designed and spacious. The service is splendid. The breakfast is nice.

Rooms are spacious, comfortable and fitted with the latest amenities. Service is excellent in the discreet Japanese style. Concierge was very knowledgeable, helpful and gave very good ideas for food, places. The hotel is quite new. We got woken up at 6 am by a 7.3 earthquake. The rocking was very gentle and calm, with soft squeaking in the framework while absorbing the shocks. Announcements came direct and loud in the room to stay put.

Arrived directly from London and fortunately did not have long to wait until our room was ready. Very smooth and professional check-in and a lovely room with balcony overlooking the Wadakura Fountain and plaza. On arrival we were staying 3 nights and a further single night prior to return to England. The room was excellent for a city hotel with good amenities and a nice bathroom with bath and separate shower. We ate all breakfasts and 2 nights in the Grand Kitchen restaurant mainly because we were tired and wanting a quick meal so couldn't do justice to the other in-house restaurants. The food was well presented with a reasonable choice in the evening and a huge choice. for the morning breakfast buffet.The personal attention we received from everyone - check in staff, room staff, restaurant, concierge, housekeeping and throughout the hotel was friendly, genuine and very professional. The bar-lounge is very nice and a good place to relax with a cocktail and listen to some good piano music. The pool and fitness centre looked very good but sadly with jet lag we never made it past the door.

just coming from a beautiful contemporary Zen hotel in Kyoto, the first look in our hotel room was a bit disappointing. Stains on the chairs and carpet and we had really to find our way around in our bedroom. But to be honest. The room has everything, is nice, big and has all amenities you need and would expect for 5-star hotel. The best however is the view over the Imperial park at the high rise buildings around the park. In the evening mindblowing beautiful. The hotel is convenient located, just a short walk from Tokyo Station. We noticed that Tokyo is much more international then Kyoto. So in this hotel plenty Western food, and a more Western feel in general.

Just next to the real Palace with access to a perfect running route around it. Great for a morning run full of palace view.Fabulous in room facility with an extremely nice bed Friendly staff and great service with ice water at night which is so nice for summer. Also the ice water and towl at hotel gate for morning runners are very sweet

Got nothing to say but perfect. This was my second time and the lounge staff recognized me immediately. After a sincere and warm welcome they provided us with everything that we asked for, even an onsen egg for breakfast!

Okay, this place is expensive. Japan is expensive. Tokyo even more expensive. Given that, this place was great. Central location, great service, helpful staff, fantastic rooms. All you could ask for in a hotel.

The room was amazing and the hotel is really well located. If you're lucky and you get a room of the palace, thats even more amazing. When you wake up, have a cup of self made nespresso on your balcony, and just look out at the greenery.Of course, you also pay for it. Japanese service is impeccable and especially at this hotel . Was here for a wedding so we spent a few nights dining and drinking at the bar. The rooms were really spacious compared to ordinary japanese hotels. Good pillow selections, big beds. Also provides you a speaker in the room! Shower was strong, automatic toilets. Theres a metro stop and small mall where you can find a convenient store and some casual eats below the hotel ( connects to this mall) . The whole vibe was just really comfortable. The design is simple yet very soothing. Nice flowers and very spacious. Would def come back.

It's in Tokyo, it's a 5 star hotel, so take for granted that the service is perfect in every respect. The staff are incredible and seem to have a sixth sense of your needs.The entrance foyer is beautifully designed, contemporary yet very Japanese. (The carpets are so luxurious it is a struggle to wheel your suitcase.) The rooms are flooded with light, very well planned with amazing attention to detail, and have a subtle design style. The bathrooms have a big picture window, and we had a large balcony which is unusual for a Tokyo hotel.It's the location and view that really made an impression. Situated at the end of the Imperial Palace grounds we could see the panorama of the historic gardens and the skyline of Marunouchi. Seeing green from your hotel room in Tokyo is a real treat.The Marunouchi area is also ideal for getting to Tokyo Station, Ginza, and some great shopping and restaurants.We didn't get a chance to try the hotel food, but will be back soon.

I have stayed in some of the best hotels in Asia, and the Palace ranks very high in that group. The rooms are beautiful and well designed, with toiletries to fit any need of the guests. My room had a balcony that overlooked the moat of the Imperial Palace. The location is perfect, within walking distance of the Ginza district ( if 30 minutes is not too far for you) and it is very close to the financial districts. The staff is helpful and smart and welcoming. I loved my stay in this hotel!

Across from the Imperial Palace and a 10 minute walk to Tokyo central train station. The Palace has several restaurants -- I especially like Crown, the French restaurant -- an fine executive level and a gym overlooking the Imperial gardens. Plus, most evenings they have top jazz in the bar downstairs. No weaknesses.

If you come to Tokyo for work and your office is somewhere around Tokyo Main station, this is an outstanding place. The rooms are clean and modern. Many of them have view over the palace garden, which is such a great balance compared to the busy work life of Tokyo.The breakfast is outstanding. If you eat in the restaurant in the first floor you can sit outside and again enjoy the view over the palace garden.If you have lounge access there is free breakfast with great views but only inside.The walking distance to Tokyo station is around 10 minutes.Of course, if you come to Tokyo for leisure as couple and you don't have budget constraints, it is a great place as well. The location is good because from Tokyo station you can go everywhere.Enjoy Tokyo.

You will not regret your stay at this amazing property. The views alone are worth it. Every staff member at every level we encountered was extremely kind and genuine. This is what top notch hospitality should be. Hotel also smells delicious! A true gem in Tokyo and a value for what you get. Tip: you can get to the hotel directly via the Limo bus from the airport.
user_name:
Mimi N
New York City, New York

review_body: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. Excellent service. Checked in by Ono who was so professional. Hotel is in excellent condition, perfectly clean with outstanding amenities. Concierge was amazing, professional and knowledgeable. Excellent location in very safe area and in walking distance to train/subway. The only small issue was the 4$ extra charge per night in checkout that I wasn't expecting but otherwise perfect hotel.

I stayed in a deluxe room. I think that it is a perfect facility. There is a large veranda outside the window from which you can see the Imperial Palace. Buffet of breakfast is luxurious. I am also satisfied with the delicious flavor of this restaurant. It is adjacent to Tokyo station, so access is good wherever you go in Japan.The staff is well trained and offers great service. A little expensive but worth enough.

Great lobby with many sectionsRoom is spacious. Although there are numerous odd angles, the furnishings made it work. the interior aesthetics (room and bathroom!) flowed with the view of the gardens below and beyond.great gym to compliment the iconic Imperial Palace Gardens. running track round the Imperial Palace is about 5km.there is sense of calm in the hood, away from the bustle and yet so accessible.service was efficient, but could do with a little more warmth.

We stayed one week in the first half of October. It was a real pleasure being there, highly attentive staff with good level of English, upscale and new room interiors generous space not only at Tokyo standards. Buffet breakfast was both Japanese and Western style with delicious Danish pastry and even muesli besides the standard freshly prepared ham, egg, sausage and full Japanese specialities. The location is great, in walking distance from Tokyo Station and direct access from the hotel lobby to Otemachi metro station (exit 13B) which is linked thru underground passages to Tokyo Station and other major office buildings. On the hotel site you will find that it is accessible on foot (8 minutes) from Tokyo Station and we’ve done so, but if you have more than a cabin bag it is highly recommended to take a taxi. It is not so easy to roll your cases on the streets or underground passage-ways with lots of busy people around.Our room was a Grand Deluxe with balcony overlooking the Imperial Palace. The weather was nice during our stay so we enjoyed a lot having this very private open air place with magnificent views. A Nepresso machine (the home version) is part of the standard amenities for this room type, and it makes a difference when you can start the day sipping your coffee above the Imperial Palace gardens.

Even for Japan, which has high service standards, this place has amazing service. Everything you would expect from a luxury hotel in Tokyo. The Japanese breakfast was so good, it reminded me of my mom's cooking! Concierge was able to help me in English which was nice since my Japanese is not great (sorry).

We spent a week in the Palace. The location is wonderful because it is located over a subway station, across the street from the Imperial Palace, right beside beautiful ponds and fountains, and close to lots of shopping and dining. The service was wonderful, too. They helped us with guidance on eating, touring, and shopping as well as a beauty shop appointment. The meals were delicious whether the buffet or menu and you can sit outside with a beautiful view. Our room had a beautiful balcony that we looked out over the fountains and the lights of Tokyo. I would highly recommend them for their service and location.

My first time at this hotel on the recommendation of a friend, and I'm kicking myself for having stayed anywhere else. This is a simply superb hotel, from the moment you step out of your car until well past checkout. Everything about it is elegant, smooth, highest-quality, and incredible. The staff is among the best in the world that I've seen. I plan to return here every time I'm in Tokyo, nothing else could compare.
user_name:
barryp790
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Just accompanied my husband for a reception among Filipinos to honor our President's visit to Japan. Huge ballroom to accommodate people. Great halls, Chinese restaurant at the fifth floor and French/ Japanese restaurant at the 6th floor. Ground floor cafe serves wines and sandwiches. Just had my most expensive club sandwich at $21. Very friendly/ courteous staff. Huge waiting areas.our friends told us room is reasonably priced at p12,000/ night. We didn't stay at the hotel coz our son reserved us in another, smaller hotel.

First time in Tokyo. Took NEX train to Tokyo Station. Hotel only few blocks away. We stayed Club Level and were treated like royalty. Rooms simple but beautiful. Great amenities. Located across the street from Imperial Gardens. Hotel supplies you with simple map and water as you explore. Staff very receptive to all your needs. Very helpful in helping you get around.

I stayed for four nights. I would love to come back for business for the following reasons.1)personalized service at Concierge deskI asked one concierge the mission impossible - try to find Japanese cucumber seeds in off season. After calling several places, she took my request herself. A few days later, I received packs of Japanese cucumber seeds in my room!! She left a note saying it was a gift to me. I have never received such a generous and tenacious service from a concierge in my life. Bravo! 2)modern, newly renovated hotelNot masculine, not ultra feminine... not too grand and not too cozy. I love the ambience at this hotel - rooms, fitness center, lobby - all quiet and serene like a oasis in a busy city. 3)excellent bar to dine alone quietly I tried the bar on the ground floor and was delighted. I only wanted to have a light dinner and a glass of champagne alone. The bar men were so professional, so attentive to almost every move guests make shared a polite and friendly conversation with me. The bar ambience, service and nice selection of fresh food totally made me relaxed at the end of busy work day. I would love to return to this hotel.

The Palace is a very nice hotel in central Tokyo, right on top of the subway station. Easy walking distance to the Ginza. The rooms are large with very nice views over the imperial gardens. The staff was very friendly and had very good English. Restaurants were more than adequate. I would definitely stay here again.

After having stayed so many times at the Okura over the years I thought I could never be pleased with another place in Tokyo. But I loved the Tokyo Palace.Everything was perfect, I loved the interior design which is very elegant. The service is superior and last but not least the rooms are extremely comfortable with a cosy atmosphere. We had a very large room, very quiet with a view on the Palace gardens from our balcony. Perfect bathroom, very large wardrobes, excellent laundry service.We would love to be back!

This hotel opened our Japan and East Asia travels. We arrived thoroughly jet lagged but happy (since we easily managed to negotiate Tokyo station and the short walk to the hotel - in retrospect I would not be embarassed to take a taxi, though) to the very surprised but civilized looks of the doormen , to find ourselves in a true palace of comfort, cleanliness and beauty, located on top of a huge underground station (Otemachi) , and commanding wonderful views towards the Imperial Palace Gardens. Our room faced those, and on the first day, at sundown, we could make out the majestic shape of Mount Fuji. The room itself was huge and full of every mod- con you can and cannot think about, furnished in clean-lined beautiful furniture ( the Japanese inspired wooden super comfy swiveling chair comes to mind) and a very comfortable bed, and the balcony was handy in the hot for October weather. The business lounge provided an oasis within the oasis , and the swimming pool was just delightful for a morning swim. We knew the minute we left that we were missing the hotel already.

To be fair, we stayed on the club level -22 flour- our first couple of nights at the Palace Hotel, we had a magnificent room overlooking the Imperial Garden. Every amenity imaginable plus the use of a spectacular club lounge with food all day and lots of extras. We were treated like royalty.when we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted with a welcome drink and snack and the on site concierge were incredibly helpful. We did then travel throughout Japan and came back to the Palace on our way home for one night and did NOT stay on the club floor... This time our room was on the 16th floor - room not as luxurious and no use of the club... but have to admit breakfast was much better on the first floor then on the club floor. Still a fabulous hotel..right by Tokyo Station and OTemachi subway station.

My wife and I just completed a 3 week adventure traveling throughout Japan. Our trip plan was to start in Tokyo and finish there. Originally, we had reserved 5 nights at the Mandarin. However, after a medium experience there to begin, we opted for The Palace for our last two nights. The staff at Mandarin takes themselves way too seriously, to a fault. And sometimes, they do not deliver what they have promised. We are extremely happy to have made the change. Everything about this hotel is magnificent. It is open, light hued and elegant. Our room was divine with a comfortable balcony overlooking the Gardens. The level of service was fantastic and charming. Beautiful lobby and restaurants add to the experience. Highly recommend this hotel.

My husband and I stayed at the Palace for 5 nights as part of a month long tour of Honshu, 4 nights upon arrival and a final night before we left. Both times we were treated to a room upgrade and enjoyed gorgeous views of the city, Palace and its grounds from our balcony. The team at the Palace is exceedingly helpful and congenial. The rooms are attractive and highly functional featuring a very comfortable bed with soft linens, sitting area, desk, excellent shower with both rainfall and hand held shower heads, soaking tub with a great view, separate room with a Toto washlet toilet, plenty of big soft towels, quality amenities, very good hairdryer, cotton and terry robes and slippers, sufficient drawer and hanging space, lots of outlets in convenient locations, fast and reliable Wi-Fi, good size safe, well-stocked mini-bar, and free bottled water (though the tap water is good to drink). There were thoughtful and unexpected touches such as a tray for jewelry and a tasty local snack. Though we didn't spend time watching TV, there was a flat screen as well as a cool TV built into the mirror in the bathroom. There was plenty of light though the curtains were effective at blocking the morning sun if you prefer to sleep in. The rooms were clean though perhaps the carpets could use a refresh.It was very quiet inside and out. Even on a high floor we could hear traffic at times while outside on the balcony, however the soundproofing is effective and we were never bothered by it in the room. Elevators arrived quickly and the public spaces are tasteful and comfortable.The breakfast buffet is excellent and we enjoyed peaceful breakfasts on the outdoor terrace watching the swans glide by in the moat. We had dinner once in the Grand Kitchen and would not recommend it. We didn't have an opportunity to try any of the other restaurants.The hotel is in an ideal location and is an excellent value for the price. We were very pleased with the experience and can highly recommend the Palace.
user_name:
BAM1113
New York City, New York

review_body: Upon arrival, one is greeted by smiling staff ready to assist in whatever way possible. You quickly learn that this hotel is superb in every way. We stayed for three nights in August and were sorry to have to leave. The breakfast buffet each morning was wonderful Nearly all staff spoke English well. Maid service with turndowns was perfect. Our king bed room had a nice view of the Emperial Palace gardens directly across the street. If you can get a room grab it. You won't be sorry.
user_name:
IntrepidTravelerNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: Fresh, comfortable and elegantly simple. This hotel has a homelike ambiance. My second time to stay at the palace. Service is excellent and staff very helpful. With all amenities in your room this hotel gives you value for money. Definitely will return.

The hotel was awesome itself. We used the Aoi hall for the venue. It was awesomely big. We ate at the hotel restaurant and had coffee break. Food were yummy and affordable than we expected. Staffs were kind and helpful.

This is one of if not the best hotel I have stayed in anywhere in the world.If u can afford it do yourself the pleasure.Service, meals, bar, all the best.Easy walk from Tokyo station and right across from the palace.Enough said!

Beautiful hotel right across from the Imperial palace and gardens. Rooms are nice but not huge. Great showers and selection of soaps and shampoos etc. Toilet seat is heated, bathes your butt and will even deodorize ( lol). Buffet breakfast is quite extensive and a big selection of foods.
user_name:
JimmyB726
New York City, New York

review_body: From the early check in, before 12:00 noon until my departure everything went very well. My room had a large balcony which is pretty rare in Tokyo. The room was very well appointed and large. The executive lounge offered a good selection of wines in the evening and Champagne and some fingerfood. The outdoor terrace gave s perfect view to the city not to mention up to Mount Fuji San!!!The main restaurant had outdoor facilities as well overlooking a pond. The food was great , the pool and the fitness area were great. Unfortunately I could not experience the spa Evian. All-round the service was great and perfect. The hotel makes you feel like coming home.Sure will come back.

My husband and I were visiting Japan for 2 weeks and Tokyo was our first stop. People have recommended the Palace Hotel so we gave it a try and we were beyond happy to have chosen the Palace Hotel for our first 3 nights. We arrived just before midnight and the restaurant was closed, so we ordered room service. It was delivered within record time and very yummy! But the best part of our stay was the bed. I don't know what it was, but we both slept like babies every single night. The mattress and the blankets are great I think but there must have been something else.. just haven't figured out what it was yet. Anyway; the shower was great too and the towels.. so fresh and soft! I could have stayed in the room all day! Staff was very friendly and helpful and the location is great too I think. Close to the train station and the Imperial Palace garden. We absolutely loved it and would definitely recommend it and stay again. A perfect stay, thanks to the whole team for making us feel like at home.

Our stay at the Palace hotel for 3 nights in September was excellent in every way. Service from everyone we met was impeccable and charming - especially in the club lounge, access to which we were given as a most welcome upgrade. Our room was extremely comfortable and the view over the Imperial Palace Gardens was an unexpected pleasure. We very much enjoyed the use of the club lounge for breakfast and pre dinner drinks. I suspect that breakfast in the main part of the hotel offered a larger selection but the lounge offerings were more than sufficient for our needs and we could have chosen to go to the main dining room had we wished.The Palace Hotel had not been my first choice and we decided to stay there really to take advantage of a good deal. I would not now look at any other hotel in Tokyo, having experienced what the Palace had to offer. I heartily recommend it.

A five star grand hotel overlooking part of the Imperial Palace gardens in the centre of Tokyo within walking distance of Tokyo station. Superbly comfortable rooms; the turn down service at about six pm talked four maids and they bring you ice in a bucket. Several restaurants, Japanese and French very pricey but relatively reasonable all day eating venue with a terrace over looking the palace moat. Food very high quality and the staff are very attentive.

Our stay at the Palace Hotel was definitely something special. Our room was amazing, as was the view over the Palace Gardens and out to Mt Fuji. The service we received while staying here was excellent.

We stayed at the end of September for 5 nights. It was the last leg of our honeymoon having previously stayed in a number of Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton properties. We had high expectations and were not left disappointed. The location of the hotel is absolutely stunning. Looking over the imperial palace gardens. The staff are welcoming and the rooms are large, modern but in keeping with being in Japan. I would highly recommend a deluxe room with a balcony - the rooms are larger and the views incredible. Sitting on the balcony watching the sun set with the city and imperial palace as your backdrop is pretty incredible. We also had executive lounge access and although the lounge itself is lovely it simply doesn't compare with the Four Seasons offerings. More should be on offer for guests throughout the day. My only other slight criticism is the fact that the SPA charge you extra to access the sauna - there is no charge for the fitness centre or pool which are by far the best bits so the extra charge for the sauna and steam seemed a bit silly/unnecessary. It should be available to paying guests.If you want good value luxury in the very best location with a modern yet elegant vibe then this is the hotel for you. Most Tokyo luxury hotels are either getting a little tired or are stuffed in the middle of office blocks. This really is the best of Tokyo. I would certainly return.

It was a nice experience to me ...i really enjoyed the stay ..the hotel is clean and calm the staffs are very kind and they are always ready to help with a smiling face ...i should stay in the same hotel when i going to there next time .. I surely recommend this hotel to my friends and all who wants good and clean stay....

Lovely, classic design in the rooms and common areas. Make sure o notice the flower arrangements and the art. Staff are attentive, friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast is very good,lots of choices. There is an underground arcade that connects to the subway making the location so convenient. Across the way from the Imperial Palace, nice spot for a walk. Highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel is absolutely awesome. High tech and very high end with a terrific staff who really wants to please in every way. The cost is high, but this hotel is better than a five star establishment in my opinion. Our room was huge with a great view of the city and the emperor's palace park across the street and a big outside deck too. The fitness center is vey large with nice equipment. The attendant even cleaned our machines after use. Our marble bathroom was very large and so high-tech that the toilet was heated and had five other functions. The breakfast buffet is great too.

We stayed at three different hotels (palace hotel, mandarin oriental, park hyatt) during our holiday, in terms of most areas palace hotel wins the other two! Buffet breakfast had the most choices and quality was as great as mandarin oriental. Staff at the front desk, concierge, club lounge and also the spa were so professional and attentive. The room we stayed at has a balcony overlooking the emperors palace and the surrounding river which is amazing both day and night. The style is the most Japanese compared to the other two! Our lunch at grand kitchen was great too, the quality of food cannot be any better. The hotel is within walking distance to the Tokyo station where you can find lots of places to eat and things to buy. Thank you so much Palace hotel. We look forward to staying there again.

This is the kind of hotel one should stay at least once in a lifetime, despite the high price. We stayed in a Club Lounge room. Thus, we could take the breakfast (wonderful) and apperitivs (superb) after 5PM in an exclusive lounge, enjoying one of the best Tokyo's view. The room and amenities are luxurious, offering a yukata to guests every night. The location is a strong point: just in front of the imperial palace gardens. Better impossible. A truly five star.
